loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, esta soltera y vive con sus dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela.
Ana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace ya un año fue una amiga quien le dio la idea de trabajar en ese negocio ella vende a todas sus amistades y vecinos.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de cosméticos para venderlos, ya que en estos momentos no tiene productos para vender.

El sueño de Ana es construir su casa y poder ponerle un techo fijo, también quiere que sus hijos se preparen académicamente para que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones  la familia
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old and studied until 7th grade.  She is single and lives with her two children, who attend school.   Ana has dedicated herself to selling cosmetics for a year now.  It was a friend who gave her the idea to work in this business, and now she sells to all her friends and neighbors.   

The loan will be invested in buying cosmetics to sell, as she currently has no products to sell.  

Ana's dream is to build a house and be able to have her own roof, and also she wants her children to prepare themselves academically so that they can help improve the family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetology products.

loans.name: Sofia De La Paz

texts.es:
Sofía, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudió hasta segundo grado, luego se dedicó a los oficios del hogar, se acompañó cuando tenía 16 años de edad, su compañero de vida trabaja en una empresa privada brindando el servicio de electricista, tiene 2  hijos los cuales aún están yendo a la escuela.

Sofía, desde que era pequeña aprendió a trabajar, inició aprendiendo a realizar todos los oficios del hogar y fue a la edad de 20 años cuando decidió poner una pupusería en su comunidad, la cual solo abre los fines de semana y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien. 

El préstamo lo necesita para iniciar un nuevo negocio, específicamente necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para vender, pues cada vez la vida está más difícil y los ingresos no son suficientes para suplir todas las necesidades.

Sofía, sueña con llegar a tener un establecimiento de venta de ropa, con el cual pueda generar ingresos estables que le puedan dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sofía, 24, is an enterprising woman. She studied up until the second grade and then dedicated herself to the household chores. She entered a relationship when she was 16. Her partner works in a private company as an electrician. She has two children, who are still in school.

Sofía learned to work from a young age. She started with the household duties and at the age of 20, she decided to start up a shop selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She only opens the shop on the weekends, and thanks to God, it has gone very well.

She needs this loan to start a new business, specifically to buy clothing which she will then sell. Life is more and more difficult and her income is not sufficient to cover all of their needs.

Sofía dreams of having a business establishment to sell clothes so that she can generate a stable income, thereby giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar is a joyful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a rental worker. 

Gavhar had a business of buying and selling grocery products and clothing. After participation at a three-day training provided by IMON to startup clients, she decided to open a new business serving Tajik women with traditional dresses. She came to the mind that if she will sew with a computerized, up-to-date sewing machine, her business will be effective and succeed. 

She asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a new computerized sewing machine and start doing business. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new computerized sewing machine and start doing business.

loans.name: Idimoh

texts.en:
Idimoh is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan. Her husband is a constructor. She is a tailor sewing traditional women's dresses. She has regular clients and orders. She is well known among neighbors and friends as a responsible, hardworking, and patient person. 

Idimoh requested a loan from IMON, which she will will use to buy a computer sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a computer sewing machine

loans.name: Ma. Liberty

texts.en: Ma. Liberty is 51 years old and a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Liberty has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 18 years. Ma. Liberty requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business. In the future, Ma. Liberty would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mildred works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and rice retailing businesses. Mildred is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Umazi operates a grocery vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Sibabu

texts.en:
Sibabu is a married woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Sibabu operates a grocery vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Rodolfo Alexander

texts.es:
Rodolfo, de 25 años de edad, es un joven esforzado, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltero y sin hijos, vive junto con su madre, quien tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa.

Rodolfo, se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos, inició ha trabajar en un taller automotriz luego de haber culminado sus estudios de bachillerato, en dicho taller trabajó por 3 años, estando ahí aprendió a vender carros usados, dicho trabajo consiste en adquirirlos, repararlos y venderlos por un precio mayor y es por eso que decidió independizarse y actualmente parquea los carros en las afueras de su casa.

El préstamo solicitado es para invertir en el negocio de pupusas que una tía de él, pues la clientela es cada día más demandante y enfrente de la casa no hay suficiente espacio para ellos.

El sueño más grande que tiene Rodolfo, es que su negocio siempre siga creciendo para llegar a tener un auto-lote con muchos carros; además quiere que su familia siga siempre unida y vaya prosperando en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 25 years old and studied through high school.  He is single with no children and lives with his mother, who has a store in their home where she sells basic necessities.  

Rodolfo makes a living buying and selling vehicles.  He started working in a mechanic's shop after finishing high school.  He worked there for 3 years and learned how to sell used cars, a job that consists of obtaining the cars, repairing them, and selling them for a better price.  He decided to become independent and currently parks the cars in the area around his home.  

The loan that he is requesting is for investing in the pupusa (stuffed tortillas) business of his aunt, since her customers are more demanding every day and there is not enough space for them in front of her home.  

Rodolfo's biggest dream is that his business continues to grow until he can have a lot with many cars on it.  He also wants his family to stay together and prosper in their various businesses.

loans.use: to invest in his aunt's pupusa business

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has five children. Her family is big. 

She and her husband are doing business together. They have land where they plant cotton, wheat, and other agricultural products. She has many years of practice in agriculture. 

Tahmina wants to get a good harvest this coming season. She is planning to buy natural chemicals and fertilizer to process the land. She does not have money to buy fertilizer, but she knew about IMON's service and appealed to get a loan from the trustee organization. 

She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her and help her to gain a good harvest because the only source of income that Tahmina and her husband have to ensure their family is agriculture.

loans.use: to buy natural chemicals and fertilizer to process the land

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is an honest woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in big city with her family; she is married and has two children. She is a teacher at secondary school. She wants to do a new business. She is willing to do business in agriculture and plans to keep livestock. She has good conditions for keeping livestock. 

She is thankful to IMON and KIVA for giving an opportunity to women entrepreneurs that also helps her to develop her business. 

She appealed to IMON and KIVA to get a loan to buy calves. She hopes to be supported in her first business and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo is 67 years, married, and has 6 children. None attend school. They are living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Festo is a farmer growing crops and rearing pigs for commercial purposes. He is a hard working man, still strong with high hopes of looking after his family needs and himself. He is faced with the challenges of pests and diseases, plus poor climatic conditions which affect his business returns. 

Festo will use the loan to buy pesticides and pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and  pay for labour.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 49 years old and married with 6 children. With three children in school, Estrella works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, school supplies, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Estrella has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, school supplies, junk food, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling flowers in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling brooms. Irene is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more flowers to sell for her business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell

loans.name: Venesio

texts.en:
Venesio is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom are attending school in Kasese, Uganda. 

Venesio owns a general merchandise shop and earns his additional income from motorcycle transport. He is hardworking and has hopes of expanding his business. However he faces the problems of market competition and price fluctuations of retail products. 

He intends to use the loan to buy bread, sugar, rice, Blue Band (margarine), and other merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, rice, Blue Band (margarine), and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 10 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Santhiaba 2 Group

texts.fr: ce banc villageoisa été inauguré le 23 Mars 2001. Ce groupe est composé de vingt deux femmes qui s' activent dans le commerce, se soutiennent mutuellement et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Aminata Sifaye qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 57 ans et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille. Elle s'active dans la vente de tissus depuis plus de dizaine d'années. Elle va acheter 10 pièces de tissus teintés en khartoums. Elle n'est pas la seule dans cette activité mais a une clientèle potentielle qui fait des commandes. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari dans la dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: This ‘banc villageois' was inaugurated on the 23rd March 2001. The group is made up of 22 women who work in commerce. They support each other, and contract loans that they repay promptly. Mrs. Aminata Sifaye, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is 57, married, and has three children; two boys and a girl. She has been selling textiles for more than ten years. She will purchase 10 units of  fabric of the Khartoum quality and design. She is not alone in this business, she has a potential clientele who order their goods. She will use the profits to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Tursunoi

texts.en: Tursunoi is a kind woman. She was born in northern Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in a remote district famous for nuts and almonds. She is married and has six children. Her husband went abroad in order to earn money to ensure income for their family. For many years she wished to help her husband because it was difficult for him to feed their family alone. She started selling and buying kids clothing, but initially it was hard because she had no customer base. Now she has seven years of business experience and her own retail space. She has regular clients, and her business is doing well. She is planning to increase her working capital and wants to get a loan. She asks for a loan to buy clothing to widen her assortment. She hopes for your understanding and trust.

loans.use: to buy clothing to expand her assortment

loans.name: Wenima

texts.en:
Wenima is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling beauty products. Wenima is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of clothing to resell for her clothing retail business.

Wenima has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eva is 37 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Eva has a buy-and-sell personal care product business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like lotion, roll-ons, etc..

Eva has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like lotion, roll-ons, etc.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina is 29 years old and married with 1 child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evangelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Evangelina has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando, de 51 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo año de secundaria, está casado, su esposa se dedica al comercio de productos lácteos y vive solo con su esposa porque sus hijos viven en la ciudad, el mayor de sus hijos está estudiando para médico y el menor ya está acompañado. 

Fernando, cuando terminó de prestar servicio militar, trabajo en diferentes lugares de la capital del país como vigilante y fue hace seis años que decidió dedicarse al comercio de lácteos, pues uno de sus patrones fue quien lo incentivó a que iniciara en este negocio;  pero hace 3 meses un señor ganadero lo contrató para que trabajara como mozo en su hacienda.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar productos lácteos para vender, pues actualmente su esposa es la que ha quedado con el negocio y necesita tener suficiente mercadería para generar ganancias.

Fernando sueña con llegar a mejorar su casa y hacer las paredes de bloques y mejorar la estructura del techo para mayor seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is 51 years old and studied until the second year of middle school.  He is married and his wife makes a living selling dairy products.  He only lives with his wife because his children live in the city.  The oldest of his children is studying to become a doctor and the youngest is already married.  

When Fernando finished serving in the military, he worked in different areas of the capital as a security guard.  6 years ago, he decided to start selling dairy products, since one of his bosses encouraged him to start a business.  However, a cattle rancher contracted him to work as an assistant on his ranch 3 years ago.  

The requested loan is for buying dairy products to sell, since currently his wife is taking care of the business and needs enough merchandise to generate a profit.  

Fernando's dream is to improve his home by building cinder block walls and improving the structure of the roof so that his family can have better security.

loans.use: to buy dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees. She has operated a pub business for the past 20 years selling drinks to the community and at the market. With the loan she wants to purchase a stock of drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of drinks for resale

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 58 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Emerita works very hard to provide for them.

Emerita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Emerita has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Emerita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ernalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling flowers in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling beverages. Ernalyn is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more flowers to sell.

Ernalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell

loans.name: Wendy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Wendy, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la construcción y tiene dos hijos que viven con ellos.

Wendy, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un año, se decidió a vender estos productos por que en la colonia donde vive se vende las personas comprar bastante ropa; ella vende cerca de su casa con sus vecinos.

Wendy, necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa para la venta, porque quiere colocar una tienda de ropa.

Ella, sueña con que sus hijos puedan crecer sanos y se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Wendy is 23 years old and studied until the 5th grade.  She is currently in a relationship, and her partner works in construction.  They have two children who live with them.  

Wendy has made a living selling clothing for a year.  She decided to sell these products because people from her community buy a fair amount of clothing.  She sells her clothing close to her home with her neighbors.  

Wendy needs this loan to buy more clothing to sell, because she wants to put up a clothing store.  

Her dream is for her children to grow up healthy and well-educated.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 51-year-old married woman with eight children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosario has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Rosario has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grados, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 10 meses de nacido.

Ana, tiene una sala de belleza desde hace 6 años, de la cual ella se mantiene a su familia y le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para mejorar la sala de belleza y comprar herramientas indispensables para trabajar. 

Ana, sueña con ampliar su sala de belleza y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 yeas old and studied until the 5th grade.  She is married, with 3 children who are 10, 8, and 10 months old.  

Ana has owned a beauty salon for 6 years, which belongs to her family and allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.  

Ana needs the loan to improve the beauty salon and buy tools that are indispensable to her work.  

Ana's dream is to expand the beauty salon and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her beauty salon and buy necessary tools for her work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ether Sulema

texts.es:
Ether, de 28 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales ya estudiaron bachillerato y viven con su mama.
Ether, se dedica a la venta de pescado, lo compra a las lanchas y luego lo revende, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace ya 3 años, anteriormente tenía una tienda,  en el negocio se involucra su hijo mayor se dedica a vender en un carrito en distintas comunidades de La Unión. 
El crédito será utilizado en la  Compra unas hieleras, las cuales servirán para transportar el pescado, así se podrá desplazar con más facilidad a las comunidades para vender el producto.
El sueño de Ether es seguir trabajando para comprar un carro que este en buenas condiciones, y así poder transportar el pescado de una comunidad a otra.
texts.en:
Ether is 28 years old and studied until the 9th grade.  She has 2 children who have finished high school and live with their mother. 

Ether makes a living selling fish.  She buys it from the fishing boats and resells it later.  She has been doing this business for 3 years.  Previously, she had a store.  Her oldest son is involved in the business and makes a living selling from a cart around various communities of La Unión. 

The loan will be used to buy coolers to transport fish, so that she can get around the communities more easily to sell her product.  

Ether's dream is to continue working to buy a cart that is in good condition so that she can transport fish between different communities.

loans.use: to buy some coolers to transport fish.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline is 35 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Jaqueline works very hard to provide for them.

Jaqueline runs a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Jaqueline has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Jaqueline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jerry Lou

texts.en:
Jerry Lou is a responsible and hard-working man. He is married to a teacher and has three children who are still attending to school. Jerry Lou has been engaged in the agriculture business for 15 years.

Jerry Lou plans to purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizers and insecticides, for his rice field, but he struggles with a shortage of additional capital. To make his goal possible, he is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000, which he will use to purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizers and insecticides, to improve the growth of his rice field.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizers and insecticides, for his rice-farming business.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: 25 летний Рустамджон из района Джиликул милый и заботливый парень. Он женат и имеет прекрасных детей. Зарабатывает он себе на жизнь земледелием. Основным его трудом является растениеводство. На своем участке он посадил несколько видов овощных культур. Продавая овощи на рынке, он обеспечивает  себя и семью. Однако чтобы получить хороший урожай, растения нуждаются в минеральных удобрениях. Средств на покупку этих удобрений у Рустамджона не достаточно и он обратился за кредитом, надеясь на Вашу милость.
texts.en:
The 25-year old Rustamjon from the Jilikul region is a nice and caring young man. He is married and has lovely children. He makes a living by growing farm produce, mainly vegetables. On his field he has planted several types of vegetables. He sells vegetables at the market and supports himself and his family in this way. 

However, to obtain a good harvest, he needs to use mineral fertilizers. He has insufficient funds to buy fertilizers and thus he has applied for a loan, hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like beverages, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like beverages, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Antipolo

texts.en:
Antipolo is a married woman, 57 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Antipolo has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Antipolo requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products like bags, body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Antipolo has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like bags, body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and other personal care products

loans.name: María Ana Dilia

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, estudió hasta secundaria, está casada, su esposo al igual que ella se dedican al comercio de café orgánico, el cual tiene propiedades medicinales, en la casa viven junto con una de sus hijas y una nieta.

María, inició a vender café hace cinco años, cuando a su esposo le diagnosticaron una enfermedad crónica y le dijeron que debía realizarse las hemodiálisis, pero él no aceptó y se fue a su casa; un amigo de la familia les comentó sobre este producto y les dijo que le podía ayudar a su estado de salud, él aceptó y gracias a Dios todo mejoró.- Actualmente, su esposo ya no padece de dicha enfermedad, pero a partir de ahí fue cuando María se interesó y decidió afiliarse a la empresa que vende este café, actualmente es una buena distribuidora del producto.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más café, pues ha salido una promoción donde le dan más cajas de productos por la compra de un paquete, a parte de otros productos novedosos; ella no quieren perder la oportunidad en esta temporada de oferta.

María, sueña con tener una lista grande de clientes y afiliar a más personas, para poder vender más producto y así generar mayores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and she completed high school. She is married and lives at home with her husband and one of her daughters and a granddaughter.

Together with her husband, Maria sells organic coffee which has medicinal properties. She began this business five years ago, when her husband was diagnosed with chronic illness and was advised to undergo hemodialysis. He refused and went home. A friend of the family commented that this product could help him with his health. He accepted, and thank God everything improved. 

Nowadays her husband no longer suffers from the illness, but it was at that time when Maria became interested and decided to become affiliated with the enterprise that sells this coffee. She is now a successful distributor of the product.

Maria needs the loan to buy more coffee, so that she can make the most of a promotional offer that will give her more packs for the purchase of each box as well as new products to try. They do not want to miss the opportunity during this season's special sales.

Maria's dream is to have an extensive customer base and to recruit more affiliates, thereby increasing sales and generating more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy more coffee.

loans.name: Neverless

texts.en:
Neverless is a 55-year-old widow living in Kasese, Uganda. She has nine children, three of whom attend school.

Neverless owns a retail shop of general merchandise. She has no additional income. She works seven hours a day, six days a week.

Neverless hopes to expand her business, however much she is limited by inadequate capital. Neverless intends to use the loan to buy salt, sugar, soap, cassava flour and rice for selling.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap, cassava flour and rice for selling.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 28-year-old Ugandan woman who is married to James. They have two children aged 5 and 2, and only one attends school.

Margret is a cattle trader, alongside farming in Kyarushesha. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy cattle for fattening. Her dream is to establish a modern ranch area and also set up a dairy processing plant.

Margret describes herself as a hardworking and honest person. She appreciates the financial boost because it will help her achieve her dreams in the near future.

loans.use: to boost her cattle-trade business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldrons and buckets for her husband's crockery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sports equipment and decorations in order to open her own sports center for women.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is 63 years old and married with four children. Pacencia works very hard to provide for them.

Pacencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Pacencia has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Sherlita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling brooms in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Sherlita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more brooms to sell in her broom business.

Sherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more brooms to sell.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae works hard to support her family. She is single with two children, and has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines.

Mae requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more seafoods like crab, shrimp, oysters and other foods.

Mae has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from fishing.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood like crab, shrimp, oysters and other foods

loans.name: Marebel

texts.en:
Marebel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marebel is 36 years old and has four children who are presently in school.

Marebel has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products like bags, body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Marebel has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products like bags, body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roxan is 24 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Roxan has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coconut wine to sell.

Roxan has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Mine

texts.en:
Mine is married and is a mother of two. Her husband is a labourer working in a factory. 

To make a contribution to the family budget, she is making Turkish raviolis at home. Customers who buy her products love them and recommend them to others. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy flour, meat and eggs in bulk. Then she will sell her products and expand her business.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Mine hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi fabrikada işçi olarak çalışıyor.  Aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için evde mantı yapıyor.  Mantısını alan müşterileri beğeniyor ve başkalarına da öneriyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan un, et ve yumurta alarak üreterek ve satarak işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat and eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Ronilyn

texts.en:
Ronilyn is 36 years old and married with four children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ronilyn is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ronilyn has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Halime

texts.en:
Halime is married and is a mother of four. After she raised her children she started home cooking. She is cooking daily for a company that she has made a deal with. 

With the help of the loan she is planning to buy oil, butter, sugar, flour and dried beans in bulk. She will make food and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.
Halime hanım dört çocuk annesi çocuklarını büyüttükten sonra evde ev yemekleri yapmaya başlamış.  Anlaştığı bir işyerine günlük ev yemekleri yapıyor.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile toptan malzeme yağ, şeker, un, kuru bakliyat alarak ve üretim yaparak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy oil, butter, sugar, flour and dried beans in bulk.

loans.name: Serpil

texts.en:
Serpil is married and a mother of two. After she retired, she had financial problems and she opened a café and Turkish ravioli house. She has been running it for one year.

She heard about loans for women and applied for it. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy meat, flour, and eggs in bulk to produce more Turkish ravioli and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Serpil hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Emekli olduktan sonra ekonomik olarak sıkıntıya girmiş çalışması gerektiğini düşünerek cafe ve mantı dükkanı açmış, bir yıldır işletiyor. Mikro kredi kullanan kadınlardan duyarak müracaat etmiş. Aldığı mikro kredi ile mantı malzemesi et, un, yumurta alarak, üreterek satışlarını artırmayı ve işini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, and eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling herbal products and vegetables. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell to customers.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. She is married with two children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Melanie has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from fishing.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sarah is 42 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Sarah has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell beverages.  Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy additional supplies needed like microphone, etc. for her videoke rental business.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies needed like microphone, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Margarita works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  

Margarita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more seafood like crab, shrimp, oysters and other foods for her buy-and-sell seafood business.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seafoods like crab, shrimp, oysters and other foods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and has nine children. She is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Mary is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan, she is requesting of Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 25-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 4 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Samina is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also help her increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre trabajador, muy responsable que se esmera día con día para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, él cuenta que con el crédito anterior logro realizar la inversión en su negocio de venta de frutas  y  afortunadamente mejoraron sus ingresos, que ahora ha empezado la construcción de su casa y en estos últimos días la construcción ya finalizo pero quedo aún pendiente las puertas y las ventanas, pero Juan no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar los últimos detalles que le hace falta a la casa por lo que nuevamente solicita un crédito y poder cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Juan es mejorar aún más su casa para que su familia cuente con hogar digna.
texts.en:
Juan is a hard-working and very responsible man. He makes an effort day after day in order to earn an income and move his family forward. He states that with his previous loan he was able to invest in his fruit sale business. Fortunately, his income improved.

Recently, he has been performing work on his home. In the last few days, he finished the construction, but he still needs to install the doors and windows. However, Juan does not have enough money to buy the last things that his home is missing. For this reason, he is requesting a new loan to cover this necessity. Juan dreams of improving his house even more so that his family can have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows.

loans.name: Id Na Yoome Group

texts.fr:
Mr KOUKA SYLVAIN est responsable du groupe ID NA YOOME. Marié, il est père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 09mois. 01 va à l'école. Il a 04personnes en charge.

Mr gère une boutique de pièces détachées et met en location des machines de construction depuis 10ans. Il s'approvisionne en ville.

Mr veut ajouter son argent pour s'acheter 01 machine dégèle pour mettre en location.

Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne pouvoir s’acheter plusieurs autres machines afin de renforcer son activité et aider sa famille.
NB: sur la photo, il tient les pièces détachées de sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. KOUKA SYLVAIN is the head of the group ID NA YOOME. He is married with two children ages 9 months and 10 years old, and the eldest goes to school. He supports four people. 

For the past 10 years, Kouka Sylvain has been running a construction supplies shop where he also rents machinery to his customers. He gets his inventory in the city. In the photo, he is holding spare parts from his store.

He plans to buy a Degele machine to rent. 

He will use his profits to bolster his activity. His goal is to purchase several other machines in order to strengthen his business and support his family.

loans.use: to buy a Degele machine to rent.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado, tiene 2 niños de 9 y 5 años de edad. 

Luis, tiene 3 años de vender sorbeletas, de esa manera obtiene ingresos para suplir algunas necesidades de su familia. 

Luis, necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para elaborar las sorbeletas. 

Luis, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y tener muchos más clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 27 years old and he studied up to Grade 3. He is in a relationship and has two children aged 9 and 5 years old. Luis has been selling sherbert for 3 years and in this way obtains income to supply some of the family's necessities.

Luis needs this loan to buy raw material to make his sherberts. Luis dreams of expanding his business, having a greater quantity of clients and improving the quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make his sherbert.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 55 years old now.

Lolita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 3000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lolita has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Marlita works very hard to provide for them.

Marlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Marlita has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Marlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Sarra

texts.en:
Sarra is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old, and her two children are still in school.

Sarra has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products like bags, body lotion, perfume, beauty soap, and other personal care products.

Sarra has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products like bags, body lotion, perfume, beauty soap, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 3000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 54 years old and married with four children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Vivian is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

Vivian has been in this business for two years and also earns income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Claribel

texts.en:
Claribel is 47 years old and married with three children. Claribel works very hard to provide for them.

Claribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like home care products, feed, junk foods, and other groceries.

Claribel has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, biscuits, feed, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Claribel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like home care products, feed, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer  de 26 años de edad actualmente se encuentra soltera tiene dos hijos , los mismos que son menores de edad. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella dedica mucho tiempo a la crianza y cuidados de sus  hijos ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, y quienes han  sufrido las consecuencias adversas el abandono de su padre. Ahora Rosa vive en una parroquia del Cantón  Pujili, ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. En este sector la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la crianza de animales  y existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Rosa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos cuyes  y sus ventas las realiza en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad,.
Solicita un crédito para comprar cerdos y alimento y esto  ayudará a  mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de sus hijos.
Rosa agradecen a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old and at the moment is a single mother with two young children. Despite having a job that takes up a lot of her time and energy, she works hard at raising and caring for her children since she does not have the support of a father for them. They have suffered difficulties because their father abandoned them.

Now Rosa lives in a parish of the Pujili canton located in Cotopaxi province in Ecuador. Most of the local inhabitants raise animals for a living. Some families take on a variety of jobs to cover their own and their community's needs.

Rosa raises and sells young animals such as pigs and guinea pigs. She sells them in the various markets of the town.

She is seeking a loan to buy pigs and feed. Then she will be able to improve her standard of living and that of her children. She is grateful to Kiva for making possible this improvement to both her work and personal life.

loans.use: Buy more pigs and feed so she can pay for the education of her children

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, de 55 años de edad,  nunca estudio, ella es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos,  dependen de ella solo uno de sus hijos  y su esposo.

Santos, se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace  3 años, fue su esposo quien tomó la decisión un día de trabajar con ganado, uno de sus hijos también ayuda al cuidado de todo el ganado.

El crédito será utilizado en la siembra de maíz y maicillo, ya que por medio de ello estaría aprovechando el zacate para su ganado.

El sueño de Santos es comprar  unas vacas lecheras cuando estén pequeñas, y criarlas hasta que den la mejor producción de lácteos y luego venderlas.
texts.en:
Santos is 55 years old and never went to school. She is married and lives with her husband and 3 children. Only her husband and one of the children depend on her.

Santos has worked for 3 years raising livestock. It was her husband who one day made the decision to work with livestock, and one of her children helps to care for the cattle as well.

The loan will be used to plant corn and sorghum, which will provide feed for the cattle.

Her dream is to buy some milk cows while they are young, raise them until they are at their best milk production, and then sell them.

loans.use: to plant corn and sorghum.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 32 years old, married and is currently working with ESCO LTD Uganda as a quality controller in cocoa processing. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. He took up the job after undergoing training and hopes to complete his house but is challenged due to the low salary payment.

 William has requested for a loan of three millions to buy building materials like cement, sand and timber to construct his house.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, sand and timber to construct his house

loans.name: Rosa Eva

texts.es:
Rosa, de 77 años de edad, nuca estudio, está soltera y vive solo con su hijo el cual se dedica a trabajar de vigilante.

Rosa, se dedica a vender mariscos desde hace muchos años, fue su madre quien le enseño a vender estos productos, ella sale a vender en la mañana 3 veces a la semana en su comunidad.

Rosa, necesita el crédito para comprar mariscos y venderlos, de esa manera pretende mejorar sus ingresos porque venderá más. 

Rosa, sueña con comprar una lancha para que su hijo la trabaje en el mar, ya que el comercio de mariscos es su pasión.
texts.en:
Rosa is 77 years old. She never studied. She is single, and she lives with her son, who works as a guard. For many years, Rosa has made a living selling seafood. Her mother taught her how to sell these products. She sets out in the morning 3 days per week to sell in her community.

Rosa needs a loan to buy seafood for sale. She hopes to improve her income this way because she will have more to sell. Rosa dreams of buying a boat so that her son can work at sea, since their passion is selling seafood.

loans.use: to buy seafood for sale.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena is married and has one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband needs to repair his taxi because the current condition is not good and it requires maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. 

Meena requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to pay for maintenance of his taxi. He will be able to provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Meena also plans to save the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

loans.use: her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Aminda

texts.es:
La señora Aminda  de 55 años de edad vive con su esposo  tiene un hijo que depende de ellos, vive en su casa que esta ubicada en la ciudad de San Lorenzo en la parte sur de Honduras, se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotaría, desde hace muchos años.
Doña Aminda sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de la comunidad es una mujer trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante junto con su familia, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos para vender y a la cría de ganado, en la actualidad vende golosinas y desea ampliar este negocio, también está vendiendo carnes de cerdo.
Doña Aminda está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, café, lácteos, jugos, pollo, verduras, etc. para tener productos para seguir con sus negocios.
 Con el apoyo del préstamo espera  tener mejores ganancias y de esta manera salir adelante junto con su familia, su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorando más  su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
Aminda, 55 years old, lives with her husband, and has one son who is still dependent on them. She lives in her house, which is located in the city of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras. She has worked in the sale of groceries for many years.

Doña Aminda and her customers are friends and neighbors in the community. She is a hardworking woman and is very eager to forge ahead together with her family. She also works at raising and selling pigs, and raising cattle. Currently, she sells sweets and wishes to grow this business. She also sells pork.

Doña Aminda is asking for the loan to purchase soft drinks, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, dairy products, juices, chicken, vegetables, etc. so she can have products to continue with her businesses. With the support of the loan, she hopes to have better profits, and in this way move forward together with her family. Her dream is to continue working and improving her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June, 2015

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, dairy products, juices, chicken, vegetables, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Lidia  de 50  años de edad, tiene 01 hijo que depende de ella, vive con un nieto y su esposo en casa propia  en una comunidad de Nacaome  valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace unos 12 años al negocio de venta de ropa y ahora también vende tortillas.
Doña Blanca Lidia  sus ventas  la realiza de forma ambulante y en su casa sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que visita está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, maíz y leña para sus negocios. Con esta inversión espera satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y  también mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, solicita su tercer crédito. 
Su sueño es seguir mejorando su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
Blanca Lidia, age 50, has one child who is dependent upon her.  She lives with a grandson and her husband in her own house.  She lives in community in Nacaome, Valle al Sur, Honduras.  

She has been in the business of selling clothes for 12 years.  Now she also sells tortillas.

Blanca Lidia makes her sales in an itinerant manner and at her house.  Her customers are friends, neighbors, and people who visit.  

She is requesting the loan to buy blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, corn, and firewood for her businesses.  With this investment she hopes to meet her customer demand.  She also hopes to improve her income, which will improve her quality of life.  She is requesting her third loan.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June, 2015

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, corn, and firewood for her businesses.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 27 years old. She works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Aiza is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production for her food vending business.

Aiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elif

texts.en:
Elif is married and a mother of two. Elif worked in restaurants for fifteen years. She saved money and opened her own café and made home-made food a year ago. The café is doing well, and she wants to expand her business in home-made cooking.

With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy flour, meat, sugar, butter, and oil in bulk, make Turkish ravioli, and make more money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Elif hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Elif hanım on beş yıldır lokantalarda çalışmış, para biriktirerek cafe ve yöresel ev yemekleri işletmesini bir yıl olmuş açmış. Cafe olarak işleri güzel gidiyor, yöresel ev yemeklerinde işlerini artırmak istiyor. Kullandığı mikro kredi ile toptan olarak un, et, şeker, yağ alarak mantı üreterek satışlarını artırmak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, sugar, butter, and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Carlos Jaime

texts.es:
Carlos vive en la cuidad de Santo Domingo junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos, viven en casa propia ya varios años, la misma que pudo construirla con su esfuerzo diario.
Carlos actualmente se dedica a la cerrajería, realiza ventanas, puertas, cerramientos, los hace a domicilio y también en su taller propio, en ocasiones cuando no tiene trabajos también se dedica a la albañilería; trabaja duro para traer ingresos a su hogar porque sus hijos están estudiando y necesita para que culminen sus estudios. Su esposa se encarga de cuidar a sus pequeños, ella es ama de casa.
Carlos es cliente fiel de la fundación, este es su segundo crédito, con este dinero podrá invertir en materia prima como ángulos, hierro y demás para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio de cerrajería, crecer en el negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos, además comenta que los ingresos de su negocio quiere seguir mejorando su casa que poco a poco la ha adecuado.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the city of Santo Domingo with his wife and two children. They have lived in their own house for many years, which Carlos built himself by working hard every day. 

Carlos currently makes a living from his ironworks business. He makes windows, doors and closure systems. He makes them in his home and in his own workshop. Sometimes, when he does not have work, he also does brick-laying. He works hard in order to bring income into the home because his children are at school and need money to finish their studies. His wife takes care of the children, she is a house wife. 

Carlos is a loyal client of the foundation. This is his second loan. He will use this money to buy primary materials such as angles, iron and others so that he can continue to strengthen his ironwork business, expand it and keep supporting his children. He also wants to use the earnings from his business to continue improving his house which he is working on bit by bit.

loans.use: to invest in primary material and continue to strengthen his ironworks business. In the future he wants to improve his house and give his family a more comfortable life

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.es:
Floridalma es una mujer de 30 años de edad, es soltera tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de los cuales son dos varones y una mujer de las edades entre 2 y 7 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá. Para Floridalma el bienestar de su familia es lo más importante y para brindarles todo lo mejor se dedica a los oficios domésticos  y tiene diez años de realizarlo, Floridalma viendo su gran necesidad de una casa, ahora solicita un crédito para poder comprar sus materiales de construcción como cemento, block, arena y hierro, y poder tener antes de finalizar el año una casa más digna para su querida familia.
El gran anhelo de Floridalma es contar con su casa y seguir comprando más terrenos para incrementar el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Floridalma is a 30 year old woman. She is single and has a beautiful family of three children two of which are boys and one a girl between the ages of 2 and 7 years old. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

For Floridalma the well-being of the family is most important and in order to provide them with the best she works doing domestic work and she has 10 years experience. Floridalma sees a house as a great necessity and is now requesting a loan to be able to buy construction materials like cement, cinder blocks, sand and re-bar.

Before the end of the year she wants to be able to have a more dignified house for her beloved family. Floridalma's big desire is to have her house and continue to buy more land to increase the assets of her children.

loans.use: to buy cement, cinder blocks, sand and re-bar.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 15 años comercializa sus producto en los diferentes mercados que se encuentra cerca de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maya para pescar ya que esa es su fuente de trabajo y así podrá tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
35-year old Rosa lives in her own home with her partner and her two children. She has raised fish for 15 years and sells them in the various markets near her home. 

Rosa is seeking a loan to buy fishing equipment. Fishing is the way she earns her living and she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: Buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 50 years old and has eight children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in the buying and selling of cocoa and gets additional income from cocoa growing. He also grows and sells food stuffs such as maize, cassava, and beans to get more income for his family. His main challenges are price changes, expensive labor, theft, and inadequate capital to expand the business.  

Jackson requested a loan, which he will use to rent cocoa gardens to harvest and sell to cocoa companies. He works hard and has plans of educating his children, buying land, and expanding his cocoa growing.

loans.use: to rent cocoa gardens to harvest

loans.name: Vernice

texts.en:
Vernice is 58 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vernice runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Vernice has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is 55 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gene has a pottery business in the Philippines. Gene requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Gene has been in this business for four years. In the future, Gene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela pero sabe firmar, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura juntamente con sus dos últimos hijos.

María, no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, pero antes se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para mejorar sus cultivos.

Y ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old. She didn't go to school but she knows how to sign her name. She is married and her husband works in agriculture together with her two youngest children.

María has no business, she used to sell tortillas.

She needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs like manure, pesticides and herbicides to improve her crops. She dreams of improving her house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like manure, pesticides and herbicides to improve her crops.

loans.name: Duygu

texts.en:
Duygu is married. In order to make a contribution to the family budget, she started to make gifts from felt and sold them to her neighbours and relatives. When her products were appreciated by everyone, she started selling them on stands.

With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy felt and jewelry materials in bulk and produce more. She wants to make more money and expand her business.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Duygu hanım evli. Aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için çalışmaya karar vermiş evde yaptığı el becerileriyle keçeden hediyelik eşyalar yapmış ve onları evden yakınlarına satmış. Beğenildiğini görmeye başlamış ve pazar arayışına geçerek tezgahlara koyarak satışlar yapmaya başlamış. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan keçe ve takı malzemeleri alarak onları üretmeyi hedefliyor. Para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy felt and jewelry materials in bulk.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Delia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is a 27-year-old mother of three sons who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband runs a food stall selling different types of items such as amosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, and kabab paratha. Her husband is the family's sole source of income for food and household expenses.
Shabnam's husband needs to purchase different types of items for his business to improve his sales and earn maximum profit. But her husband is not in a financial position to purchase these items.
Therefore Shabnam has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will help her husband purchase food items for his food stall business. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items to increase her husband's food stall buiness

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
Norlinda works hard to support 10 children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Norlinda requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Norlinda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Germelina

texts.en:
Germelina is 50 years old and married with three children, one child in school.  Germelina works very hard to provide for her family.

Germelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Germelina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, noodles, candies, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Germelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 44 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de ocho hijos de las edades entre 7 y 19 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango, Maria para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de blusas típicas y venta de refacciones, ella tiene veinte años de realizar esta labor, a Maria le preocupa mucho que su familia no cuente con terreno suficiente por tal razón quiere aprovechar la oportunidad de enganchar una cuerda de terreno pero lamentablemente no tiene el dinero, por tal motivo solicita un crédito para no perder esta oportunidad de incrementar su terreno.
El gran sueño de Maria es poder comprar el terreno para construir una casa más grande y cómoda para su familia, pues donde actualmente viven es una casa muy estrecha.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old and married.  She has a lovely family with eight children between the ages of 7 and 19.  This humble family lives in a community in Chichicastenango.  In order to get income and to get her family ahead, Maria makes typical blouses and sells refreshments.  She has been engaged in this work for 20 years.

It worries Maria a great deal that her family does not have enough land.  That is the reason that she wants to take advantage of the opportunity to acquire approximately an acre of land.  Unfortunately, she does not have the money to do so.  That is the reason she is requesting a loan.  She does not want to lose this opportunity to increase her land.

Maria’s big dream is to be able to buy land in order to build a build a bigger and more comfortable house for her family.  They currently live in a house that is very small.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Elif

texts.en:
Elif is single. She processes and sells meerschaum (soft, white mineral often used to make smoking pipes) like her parents.  She has been doing this since she was a child and the pipes and jewelry she makes are very much appreciated.  With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy meerschaum stone in bulk, process it, make good money and develop her business. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Elif hanım bekar.  Aile mesleği olan lüle taşı işlemesi ve satışını yapıyor.  Çocukluğundan beri ocaklardan çıkan lüle taşını işliyor özellikle pipo ve takı yapıyor yaptığı ürünler beğeniliyor.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile ham olarak aldığı lüle taşını işleyerek üreterek satarak para kazanmayı hedefliyor ve işlerini geliştirmeyi düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy meerschaum stone in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Gricelda, de 38 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a la agricultura junto a su compañero de vida, Gricelda es  muy dedicada a su familia, actualmente vive con su compañero de vida quien trabaja en la agricultura sembrando granos básicos.

Gricelda se dedica a los oficios del hogar, y también trabaja la agricultura trabajo que ha realizado toda su vida

Gricelda utilizara el préstamo en la compra de insumos como abono 15-15-15 y sulfato que es lo que necesita su milpa.

Gricelda  quiere seguir produciendo granos básicos para la alimentación de toda su familia y así poder darles una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Gricelda, 38 years old, is a homemaker and also makes a living in agriculture with her life partner. Gricelda is dedicated to her family and lives with her life partner who works in agriculture growing basic grains.

Gricelda takes care of her home and also works in agriculture, which she has done her whole life. 

Gricelda will use this loan to buy materials such as 15-15-15 fertilizer and sulfate, which her corn field needs. 

Gricelda wants to continue to grow basic grains to feeder her family and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy materials for agriculture

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, de 33 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijas, las cuales estudian y su esposo trabaja como empleado en un taller de soldadura.

Lucila se dedica a los oficios del hogar pero tiene su tiendita, ahí vende variedad de cosas como golosinas y lo basico para el hogar

Lucila necesita el crédito para  invertir a su tienda en la compra de granos basicos, golosinas, gaseosas, pan, et. desea vender más productos ya que sus clientes le han dicho que sería bueno que se ampliara para así poder tener los productos más cerca.

Lucila sueña con ver a sus hijos preparados académicamente y también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucila, age 33, lives with her life partner and their three daughters.  The children go to school, and her husband works as an employee at a soldering shop.

Lucila devotes herself to the household chores, but she has a small store.  She sells a variety of things like candy and basics for the household.

Lucila needs the loan to invest in her store by purchasing basic grains, candy, soft drinks, and bread, etc.  She wishes to sell more products because her customers have told her that it would be good to expand.  This way she would be able to have the products on hand.

Lucila dreams of seeing her children prepared academically.  She also dreams of improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products, candy, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mayra Veronica

texts.es: Mayra de 31 años de edad, vive  junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 13 y 4 años y uno  2 meses de edad. Mayra es una mujer trabajadora que gracias a su labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia ya que ella  se dedica desde hace un buen tiempo a atender una pequeña tienda de productos básicos de primera necesidad en su lugar de habitación, negocio que logro surtir gracias a un crédito anterior por lo cual se encuentra muy agradecida y deseosa de superarse cada vez mas.
