Mayra  pensando en mejorar sus ingresos económicos desea instalar una venta de pupusas las cuales piensa elaborar y vender los fines de semana con los vecinos de su comunidad, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder invertir en la compra de la materia prima es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de adquirir un nuevo crédito en FUSAI para comprar una plancha para pupusas, y la materia prima como: queso, chicharrón, frijoles, etc. para iniciar su negocio  y a si generar mejores ganancias que le permitan dar a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mayra is 31 years old and lives with her life partner and three kids, ages 13, 4 and 2 months. Mayra is a hard working woman that thanks to her labor has supported her family. She has made a living for quite some time attending to a small store of basic goods out of her home. 

Her business was made possible thanks to a previous loan, for which she is very thankful. Hoping to increase her income, she wants to sell pupusas on the weekends to her neighbors in the community, but she does not have the capital necessary to do so. Because of this, she requests a loan from FUSAI to buy a griddle for the pupusas and materials such as: cheese, sausage, beans etc to start her business and begin generating greater income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for pupusas and materials such as: cheese, sausage, beans, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with eight children, two in school. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 11 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, beans, flour, crates of soda, rice, sugar, and cartons of salt. She works in the shop seven days a week . Her major business challenges include seasonality of commodities. She would like to buy a refrigerator to start selling soft drinks. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her shop and food.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, beans, flour, crates of soda, rice, sugar, and cartons of salt

loans.name: Cahide

texts.en:
Cahide is married and is a mother of three children.  Her husband is a laborer, and her children are going to school.  Her husband's income was not enough to support the family, so Cahide started making and selling jewelry at home.  Then, six months ago, she decided to open a store.  She needed capital, so she decided to apply for a loan.  With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy jewelry in bulk, to increase her sales, and to develop her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Cahide hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Eşi işçi olarak çalışıyor, çocukları okuyor eşinin parası yetişmediği için Cahide hanım evde takı yaparak satmaya başlamış.  Sonra dükkan açmaya karar vermiş, altı ay olmuş dükkanı açalı.  Sermaye desteğine ihtiyaç duymuş ve mikro krediden faydalanmak istemiş.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan takı malzemesi alarak ve işleyerek satışlarını artırmayı ve işini geliştirmeyi düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 45 years old, is married with four children, and lives in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia.  For over 15 years, her family's main source of income has been selling rice.  Additionally, her husband (40 years old) works as a policeman, and two of her children are factory workers (the other two are in school). 

Sopheap, her husband, and her two working children can earn around $72 (USD) per day.  Now, she would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle to help her children commute to work and to deliver rice to her customers.  This loan will help her afford a motorcycle, which will improve her children’s traveling conditions and her business.  Sopheap plans to expand her business, renovate the house, and support her children's efforts to achieve higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help her children commute to work and to deliver rice to her customers.

loans.name: Berrin

texts.en:
Berrin is married and a mother of two. She is running a cafe and local food house with her husband. She had worked as a laborer in a factory for years but her salary was low so she decided to open a place of her own. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy flour, meat, butter, oil, and eggs in bulk for her food business to increase her income.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Berrin hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi ile beraber cafe ve yöresel ev yemekleri işletmecisi.  Fabrikada işçi olarak uzun yıllar çalışmış, aldığı para yeterli olmamış, onun için işyeri açmaya karar vermiş.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile yaptığı yöresel yemeklerin malzemesini toptan olarak alacak et, yağ, un, yumurta onları üreterek para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, butter, oil, and eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Serpil

texts.en:
Serpil is divorced and living with her child. She has a ceramics and Çini (tiles painted with china ink) workshop. She has been doing it for three years. She has used a loan three times. With her first loan, she bought materials for making ceramics, increased production and expanded her business. With the second loan, she developed her Çini business. With the third loan, she bought a stove for her ceramics and Çini production. The stove is a major help for her developing business. With the help of this loan, she is planning to buy materials for her ceramics and Çini, to buy moulds, and to produce more thus developing her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Serpil hanım eşinden ayrı bir çocuğu var.  Seramik üretim ve çini işletmeciliği işi  ile ilgili dükkanı var.  Üç yıldır yapıyor.  Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı.  İlk kullandığı mikro kredi ile seramik malzemeleri aldı üretti ve işini geliştirmeyi sağladı.  İkinci kullandığı mikro kredi ile çini işini geliştirdi.  Üçüncü mikro kredi ile de seramik ve çini fırını alıyor ve kendi atölyesinde fırınlama yapıyor işlerini geliştirmede çok büyük etken oluyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile çini, seramik malzemesi ve kalıpları alarak üreterek işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy materials for ceramics and Çini (tiles painted with china ink).

loans.name: G.s La Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
El G.S. LA GUADALUPANA ESTA CONFORMADA POR  TRES INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON OCHO HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD,  SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPAÑÍA DE SUS HJOS. LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICO NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABARJA A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES SABRI Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA, COMO CAMISAS, CAMISETAS,PANTALONES DE VESTIR, JENS, ROPA INTERIOR, FALDAS, SHORES, MONOS, VESTIDOS, ETC. ELLA TIENE DIES AÑOS DE DEDICARSE A DICHA ACTIVIDAD, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN UN LUGAR ESPECIFICO DE LA LOCALIDAD. SU RUTINA DE TRABAJO ES DE UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, PARA MANTENER SUS CLIENTELA Y MEJORAR SUS INGRESOS, Y QUE TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA. EL OBJETIVO ES SURTIR  DE MERCADERIA NUEVA, PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS  CLIENTES. G.S. LA GUADALUPANA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en: The G.S. La Guadalupana group is comprised of three members, who are single mothers with eight children under their responsibility. They describe themselves as hard-working, responsible, with the desire for personal improvement. In their free time, they enjoy spending time with their children. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, they were not able to study and found themselves with the need to work at an early age in order to help with household expenses. Thanks to her willingness to get ahead, the coordinator, Sabri, works in sales of new clothes, like shirts, T-shirts, dress pants, jeans, underwear, skirts, shorts, overalls, dresses, etc. She has dedicated 10 years to this work. The store is located in a specific location in the town. Her work schedule includes 10 hours every day, selling her products in order to maintain her customers and increase her income. She has lots of competition. The objective is to stock up on new merchandise to satisfy the demand from her customers. G.S. La Guadalupana appreciates the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have decent employment.

loans.use: to stock up on new clothes, such as shirts, shorts, skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on retail basis for five years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, cabbages, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, and onions. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and poor transportation. She would like to become a whole seller supplying different people in the market. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, cabbages and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 13 and the youngest is not yet 1 year old. She earns a living by providing services like spraying mango trees so they bear fruit. She is 31 years of age and a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

Lourdes has requested a loan to purchase treatments for mango trees to bear fruit and equipment, such as a sprayer. With the loan, Lourdes would be able to serve more customers and improve her income. Lourdes would then be able to support the needs of her children and also continue sending them to school. 

Lourdes is determined enough to strive hard to be successful in her chosen field to support the needs of her growing children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase treatments for mango trees to bear fruit and equipment, such as a sprayer

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 59 years old with seven children.

Petronila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Petronila has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Petronila aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old and married with 7 children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Susan has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as junk food, biscuits, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 46 years old and is a married woman with five children.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Leonila has a business in which she buys and sells rice in the Philippines, and she requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sanem

texts.en:
Sanem is single and living with her parents. To support her family and with the assistance of her mother, she opened a cafe and breakfast house and has been running it for one year. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy soft drinks and breakfast food in bulk to increase her income.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sanem hanım bekar ailesi ile beraber yaşıyor.  Ailesine destek olmak için annesinin de desteğiyle cafe ve kahvaltı salonu açmış ve bir yıldır işletiyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan olarak cafe ye meşrubat ve kahvaltılık malzemeler alarak cafe’de satışlar yaparak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and breakfast food in bulk.

loans.name: Kezban Gülçin

texts.en:
Kezban is married and has one child.  She has a ceramics and Çini (tiles painted with china ink) workshop. She sells her products either by wholesale or by retail. She used loans three times, buying materials for her ceramics and Çini and developing her business. With the help of this loan, she is planning to buy materials for her ceramics and Çini, buy molds, and produce and gain more to develop her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Kezban hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Seramik ve çini üretimi atölyesi var, yaptığı ürünleri toptan ve perakende olarak satıyor.  Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı seramik ve çini malzemeleri alarak üretti ve satışını gerçekleştirdi.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile de seramik, çini malzemesi ve kalıpları alarak üreterek satışlarını yaparak işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor

loans.use: to buy materials for ceramics and Çini (tiles painted with china ink).

loans.name: Sreyneat

texts.en: Sreyneat is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 17 years old. Her family owns 7 hectares of rice fields and 1 hectare of cassava field. In 2012 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that afights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sreyneat makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for fertilizer and diesel for the fields. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en: Sreyneang is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 19 years old. Her family owns 5 hectares of rice fields and 1 hectare of cassava field. In 2012 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sreyneang makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for animal food, fertilizer and diesel for the field.  Thanks to the loan,  she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
In the picture, Chhoun is on the right and her husband in on the left. Chhoun is 50 years old and comes from Kompong Thom Province. She has five children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for around 20 years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day, on average.

To accelerate her farming operation, she would like to use a hand tractor to help her in the farming process. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a KIVA loan to buy a hand tractor. 

With the supporting from this loan, she hopes that she can operate her farming business better and go faster. She is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 66 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda is 59 years old and widowed with 7 children.

Wenefreda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Wenefreda has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Wenefreda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, junk food, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 55-year-old resident of Butoole. His major source of income is selling agricultural products and farming. He grows crops like maize and beans which he sells to gain income.
He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy cereals since it is now the season when they are available at low cost. He is assured of customers and profit after sales.
His dream for the future is to acquire more land and expand his produce business.
He says the biggest challenge he faces is bad weather/climatic changes.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Filis

texts.en:
Filis is married and has one child.  She is making jewelry, special designs for special days, and door ornaments from felt.  She has gotten three loans and bought felt and materials in bulk. She made a lot of sales, thus developed her business.  

With the help of her fourth loan, she is planning to buy felt and jewelry materials in bulk.  She wants to develop herself in the jewelry business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Filis hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Keçeden takı, kapı süsü, özel günler için özel tasarımlar yapıyor.  Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı keçe ve malzemeler alarak üreterek ve satarak işlerini geliştirdi.  Dördüncü kredi ile keçe malzemesi ve takı malzemesi alarak takılar üreterek ve satarak takıda da kendisini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy bulk felt and jewelry materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sausage (hotdog) and pork meat to sell

loans.name: Jorema

texts.en:
Jorema is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jorema is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jorema has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Jorema would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children, and all attend school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She operates a boutique selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT – SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy land and start farming. 

She lives in rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Eduardo Ramiro

texts.es:
El joven Eduardo tiene 19 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Trojes y cuenta con más de 2 años de dedicarse  a la actividad de ropa y calzado de todas las variedades producto que sale a vender a todas las comunidades aledañas al sector.
Eduardo necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como vestidos, blusas, camisas, pantalones, etc. para surtir su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y que esto le permita obtener muy buenos ingresos para suplir sus necesidades básicas.
Eduardo uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio y que este sea uno de los más reconocidos de su zona.

Trojes, Honduras  -  Junio del 2015
texts.en:
Eduardo is 19 and lives in a community in Trojes. For over two years he has been making a living selling clothing and footwear of all types. He sells his products in neighbouring communities. 

Eduardo needs the loan to buy merchandise such as dresses, blouses, shirts, trousers etc. to stock up his business and be able to meet the needs of his customers. This will allow him to make a very good income to provide for his basic needs.

Eduardo dreams of being able to improve his business and of it being one of the most well-known clothes businesses in the area.

loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses, shirts, trousers etc. for his business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Vhenekai

texts.en:
Vhenekai is 35 years old and married with two children. She is currently residing in the rural Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. As a committed volunteer in her community, Vhenekai actively helps to keep children in school through life-skills development classes because she believes that they have a chance in life when they make informed choices. 

Using her previous $500 loan, Vhenekai expanded her poultry business. She repaid her loan on time and she hopes to receive another Kiva loan so that she can further expand her poultry business. Vhenekai’s chicken business is doing very well.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and vaccines.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and a mother of two. Fatma worked in the private sector for long years, but because of the company's financial crisis she had to leave.  

She started making bags from felt at home. She sold them and made a contribution to the family budget. 

With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy felt, make more bags, and gain money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.
Fatma hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Fatma hanım uzun yılar  özel sektörde çalışmış çalıştığı firma ekonomik krize girmiş ve işten ayrılmak durumunda kalmış.  Evde yaptığı keçe işlerini geliştirerek çantalar yapmaya başlamış.  Satarak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlar hale gelmiş.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile keçe malzemesi alarak üretip satarak para kazanmayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy felt

loans.name: Kürcan

texts.en:
Kürcan is divorced and living with her three children.  She is running a Turkish pastry(börek) shop.  Her children are going to school and also helping her at the shop.  She opened her shop after the divorce.  With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulk of flour, butter, oil and eggs.  She aims to make more pastry, gain more money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Kürcan hanım eşinden ayrı üç çocuğu var.  Börekçi dükkanı işletiyor çocukları okuyor ve Kürcan hanıma dükkanda çocukları yardımcı oluyor.  Kürcan hanım dükkanı eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra açmış.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile dükkana malzeme almak istiyor un, yağ, şeker, yumurta vs. gibi. Ürünleri işleyerek satışını yaparak para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy bulk of flour, butter, oil and eggs

loans.name: Zemine

texts.en:
Zemine is married and a mother of two.  Her husband works in construction.  She makes pastries and apple pies at home and sells them to make contributions to the family budget.  With the help of the loan she will buy bulk of flour, butter, oil and eggs. She will sell her products, make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zemine hanım evli iki çocuk annesi eşi inşaat işçisi.  Zemine hanım börek ve elmalı kurabiye yapıp, evden sipariş alarak satış yapıyor ve aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile un, yağ, yumurta alarak üreterek ve satarak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy bulk of flour, butter, oil and eggs

loans.name: Manolito

texts.en:
Manolito is 55 years old, married and blessed with five children. Farming has been his family's main source of income. 

In order to be able to have additional income and sustain their children's allowances in attending school, Manolito’s wife is engaged in a retailing business. They sell various grocery items within their village. With regard to their farming business, Manolito wanted to borrow a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides for their rice crops. 

Manolito will ensure his crops are productive to harvest and earn a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides for his rice crops.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 46 years old and married with 12 children. With four children in school, Antonieta works very hard to provide for them.

Antonieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, eggs, home-care products, and other groceries.

Antonieta has been in this business for seven years now. 

In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, eggs, home-care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 36-year-old married woman with seven children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She deals in the tailoring of clothes, and she makes money out of this business. She is very hardworking, and this is why her business keeps growing steadily. 

She has a cocoa garden as another source of income. She hopes to build a permanent house for her family, though she is faced with high competition. Grace will use the loan to buy more cloth material for sewing, and this is the same purpose for which she used the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more cloth material for sewing.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara, de 64 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya se acompañaron.

Genara, se dedica a cultivar frijol y maíz, aprendió de sus padres que al igual que ella se dedican a la agricultura, debido a la necesidad de salir a delante empezaron a cultivar la tierra y el lugar donde trabaja está a 1 kilómetro de distancia desde su casa y se desplaza a pie.

Genara, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes y foliares para mejorar sus cultivos, porque mejora el rendimiento de las cosechas y obtendrá más quintales por metro cuadrado.  

Los sueños de Genara son, poder comprar un par de cerditos para poderlos engordar y venderlos y comprar una ternera.
texts.en:
Genara, 64 years old, studied until the third grade. She is in a relationship, and her partner makes a living from sowing basic grains. She has 3 children who are already in relationships.

Genara makes a living from growing beans and corn. She learned from her parents who also make a living from agriculture. Owing to the necessity of getting ahead, they began to cultivate the land and the place where she works is 1 kilometer away from her home, which she travels on foot.

Genara needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and other plant fertilizers absorbed through the leaves to improve her crops, because this will improve the yield of the harvests and she will obtain more weight per square meter.

Genara’s dreams are to be able to purchase a pair of piglets to be able to fatten and sell, and to purchase a calf.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and other plant fertilizers absorbed through the leaves to improve her crops.

loans.name: Independencia Group

texts.es:
En una de las comunidades vecinas del estado de Veracruz se integró el grupo llamado Independencia. El recorrido en la región es una grata experiencia visual pues los cerros y cañales ofrecen un colorido paisaje junto con el contraste de dos grandes ríos donde se dan cita familias enteras para poder refrescarse y convivir. 
   El nombre del grupo surgió debido a que los integrantes siempre han trabajado por ser independientes económicamente. Ellos son: Laura quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes, sabanas y agua purificada; Teresa, postres y bisutería; Juana, artesanías y bolsas de mano; Pablo, abarrotes y Rogelio, comida. Por su lado Francisco maneja un negocio de carpintería y Bertoldo, uno de plantas de ornato.
   Francisco es un joven que cuenta con una pequeña familia integrada por Diana, su esposa, y una bebe de 5 meses. Todos lo conocen como “Chico” en la comunidad, él desde niño se apasiono por la carpintería pues observaba a su padre mientras éste elaboraba distintos muebles. De igual modo aprendió a lijar, cortar, pulir, pintar, barnizar  y se convirtió en maestro por lo que pudo expandir la carpintería e involucrar a sus dos hermanos más chicos, por lo tanto la carpintería es un negocio familiar.
   Chico mantiene otra actividad de lunes a viernes así que después de cumplir con su jornada laborar se dirige a su negocio donde trabaja por las tardes y los fines de semana, “es bonito ser carpintero y más ahora que mis dos hermanos están aprendiendo a ganarse la vida de manera honrada y productiva” comenta satisfecho. Con la oportunidad del préstamo podrá comprar madera, barniz, brochas, clavos y lijas para mantener la calidad que lo caracteriza.
   Los integrantes de Independecia agradecen por los beneficios otorgados ya que ahora el sueño de tener un negocio propio puede ser realidad. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque de la comunidad, Chico es quien viste playera café.
texts.en:
The group called "Independencia" [Independence] merged in one of the neighboring communities of the Veracruz state. Travel in the region is a pleasant viewing experience, for the hills and sugarcane enclosures offer a colorful landscape with the contrast of two great rivers where entire families gather to be able to cool off and coexist.

The group's name came about because the members have always worked to be economically independent. They are: Laura, who sells perfume, linens, and purified water; Teresa, desserts and jewelry; Juana, crafts and handbags; Paul, groceries, and Rogelio, food. Francisco, on his side, runs a carpentry business and Bertoldo, one of ornamental plants.

Francisco is a young man who has a small family composed of his wife Diana and a 5-month-old baby. Everyone knows him as "Chico" in the community. Since childhood, he became passionate about woodwork since he watched his father as he elaborated various types of furniture. Likewise, he learned sanding, cutting, polishing, painting, and varnishing and became a teacher, so he was able to expand the carpentry and involve his two younger siblings. Therefore, carpentry is a family business.

Chico keeps another business from Monday to Friday, so after completing his workday, he heads to his business where he works in the afternoons and on weekends. "It's nice to be a carpenter, and moreover now that my two brothers are learning earn a living honestly and productively", he says, satisfied. 

With the loan's opportunity, he will be able to buy wood, varnish, brushes, nails, and sandpaper to maintain the quality that characterizes him. Independencia's members give thanks for the benefits granted since now the dream of owning their own businesses can be a reality.

*The photograph was taken at the community park. Chico is the one who is wearing a brown shirt.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, brushes, nails, and sandpaper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rice, source pun, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Maivasse

texts.pt:
Mavaisse de 39 anos de idade, nasceu na cidade de maputo, actualmente residindo em Magude na casa propria, casado e pai de 2 filhos menores, além dos filhos tem na sua responsabilidade a sua mãe e seu sobrinho que vivem com ele. 
Com o presente financiamento de 15.000 irá comprar cimento, chapas e blocos para dar continuidade a sua obra de construção de uma residência.
Tem como sonhos concluir a sua obra e reabilitar a casa dos seus pais em Maputo para aluguer.
Tem como dificuldades a insuficiência de fundos, mas tem recorrido ao trabalho e ao crédito para suprir suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Maivasse is 39 years old. He comes from the town of Maputo and currently lives in Magude in a house that he owns. He's married and has two underage children. Aside from his children he's responsible for his mother and nephew who live with him.
With the current loan for 15,000mts he'll purchase cement, metal plates and bricks in order to continue building a house.
Maivasse's dream is to finish the construction work and repair his parents' house in Maputo so he can put it up for rent.
He struggles with the lack of funds, but he's been turning to his work and credit as a way to get his needs met.

loans.use: to purchase cement, metal plates and bricks so he can continue building a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy aluminum sheeting and wood to replace his roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more t-shirts and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is 41 years old; he is married with three children who are ages between 3-14 years. He is married to a businesswoman and he has been in this business (a general store) for the past 15 years.

Aaron owns a general store. He will use the loan to buy different products for resale, such as rice, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, salt and soft drinks. 

With the profits, Aaron wishes to renovate a house and buy food for his entire family.

loans.use: To buy different products such as rice, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, salt and soft drinks.

loans.name: Paula Isabel

texts.es:
Paula, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja es empleado de una alcaldía.

Paula, se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 4 años, decidió dedicarse a este negocio luego de quedarse sin empleo cuando hubo recorte de personal en donde trabajaba; debido a eso aprendió a hacer pupusas, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y se involucran sus dos hijos después que salen de clases. 

Paula, necesita el crédito para comprar una plancha nueva para hacer pupusas, ya que con la que cuenta en este momento está un poco dañada; además comprara materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas. 

Los sueños de Paula son, poder ampliar más el negocio y poder emplear a dos familiares de ella que en este momento están sin trabajo.
texts.en:
Paula, 28 years old, attended school through high school and has two children ages 7 and 9. She is married and her partner works for the municipality. 

Paula has made a living selling pupusas for the last four years. She decided to start the business after being laid off from her work. As a result, she learned to make pupusas out of her home and enlists her two children to help out after school.

Paula needs the loan to buy a new griddle to make pupusas, as the one she uses currently is a bit damaged. She also will buy materials to make pupusas.  

Paula's dreams are to expand her business and employ two relatives of hers that are currently unemployed.

loans.use: to buy a new griddle to make pupusas

loans.name: La Unión 2 Group

texts.es:
Para una comunidad oaxaqueña es tradicional la temporada de zafra, es decir, la producción de azúcar. No es raro observar en la carretera los carros cañeros, las alzadoras, los tractores, las camionetas o motos que llevan almuerzos a las cuadrillas de cortadores de la caña. Una vez terminada la temporada, la región festeja con un gran baile donde la entrada es gratuita para las mujeres.
   El grupo La Unión debe el nombre al dicho de que “la unión hace la fuerza” pues todos llevan una fuerte relación de amistad y desean proyectar su éxito a todas las actividades que realizan. Ellos son: María O. quien vende refrescos; María N., pollos asados; Irayda, piñatas y cosméticos; Leidy, ropa y comida; Laura, comida; Martin, pollo rostizado y Vicente que brinda servicios de albañilería.
   Irayda  es una mujer muy comprometida y segura de sí misma, es madre soltera de una pequeña de  6 años de edad. La “Tota”, como es mejor conocida, tiene el propósito fundamental de ofrecer lo mejor a su pequeña y por ello decidió iniciar con la venta de cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 5 años. Al inicio sólo era ayudante pero gracias a su esfuerzo ahora es vendedora directa.
   De igual forma durante su tiempo libre se dedica hacer piñatas de toda forma y color dependiendo del gusto de sus clientes. En el mes de octubre, en cambio, inicia con la elaboración de coronas florales para los funerales. Con las ganancias obtenidas de todas sus actividades solventa los gastos del hogar e invierte en nuevas labores como la venta de naranjas y plátanos dependiendo de la temporada.
   Esta vez el préstamo lo empleara en la compra de globos, papel crepe, china, celofán, papel periódico, además en la compra de cosméticos tales como: delineadores, rímel, sombras, cremas y labiales. “Gracias a la inversión de los préstamos a mi niña y a mí no nos falta nada” son sus palabras.
   El grupo La Unión está agradecido con VisionFund y sus colaboradores por hacer posible tener nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento.
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Laura, La Tota es quien viste blusa rosa.
texts.en:
In a community in Oaxaca, the zafra, that is, the sugar production, season is traditional. It is not rare to see cane trucks, cane lifters, tractors, and trucks or motorcycles that bring lunch to the cane-cutting crews on the highway. Once the season is over, the region celebrates with a great dance to which the entry is free for women.

The group La Unión owes its name to the saying that “unity makes strength” since all have a strong friendship and they wish to extend their success to all of the activities that they carry out. They are: María O. who sells soft drinks; María N., grilled chicken; Irayda, piñatas and cosmetics; Leidy, clothing and food; Laura, food; Martin, roast chicken; and Vincent, who provides bricklaying services.

Irayda is a very committed and self-assured. She is a single mother of a little girl who is 6 years old. “Tota,” as she is better-known, has the fundamental intention of offering the best to her daughter and because of this she decided to begin selling cosmetics by catalog 5 years ago. In the beginning, she was only an assistant, but thanks to her effort, she is now a direct seller.

Also, during her free time, she makes a living making piñatas in all forms and colors depending on her customers’ taste. In the month of October, however, she begins the production of floral crowns for funerals. With the profits obtained from all of her activities she pays her home expenses and invests in new work such as the sale of oranges and bananas, depending on the season.

This time, she will employ the loan in the purchase of balloons, crepe paper, china, cellophane, newspaper, as well as in the purchase of cosmetics such as: eyeliners, mascara, eye shadows, creams, and lipsticks. “Thanks to the investment of the loans my daughter and I lack nothing,” are her words.

The group La Unión is thankful to VisionFund and its contributors for making it possible for it to have new growth opportunities.

*The photograph was taken in Laura’s house, and Tota is wearing a pink blouse.

loans.use: to purchase: balloons, crepe paper, china, cellophane, newspaper, eyeliners, mascara, eye shadows, creams, and lipstick.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

She successfully repaid her loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to fund her general store business.

Nancy dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Sujey

texts.es: Doña Sandra se dedica a la cría de cerdos para la ceba y venta de los mismos. Solicita un préstamo de $250, con este dinero comprará tres cerditos para su engorde y posterior venta. De esta manera incrementa sus ingresos y mejora su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Sandra makes a living raising pigs for fattening and selling. She is requesting a loan of $250. With this money she will buy three young pigs for fattening and for selling later. This way she can increase her income and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en:
Sarem is a 28-year-old married resident with two children. She lives in the Siem Reap province in Cambodia. One of her two children is lame but also attends school. She and her husband, 39 years old, have worked as construction workers since 2000, earning $15 each day.

Sarem has decided to take out a loan because she needs finances to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work. This loan will help her afford a motorcycle and reduce traveling expenses.

In the future, she wants to sell groceries at home so she will have more time to take care of her children, and support her children to go through high school. She also wants to save money to build a new house because her present one is old.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child still in school.

Ellen has an auto repair shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more spare parts and maintenance for her business.

Ellen has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Aminata. She is married and has two children aged five and seven. In 1991, Aminata established her rice business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of their home. Her business is located at the city centre and her main customers are the public. Working 6 days a week and 6 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy 40 more bags of rice for resale.

Aminata was unable to meet her previous plan to assist her husband in completing the house but was able to pay fees for her children. She hopes that this loan will continue to support her to pay fees and manage her home. In the future, Aminata plans to buy a car for commercial purposes as a way of income for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 40 bags of rice, water, mega cola drinks and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es: Liseth tiene 35 años de edad, es madre jefa de hogar. Se destaca como una mujer luchadora y con deseos de salir adelante junto con su hijo, el cual tiene 13 años de edad. Ella anteriormente alquilaba unas cabinas en San Vito centro, para poder alquilar habitaciones a los agentes que llegaban a la zona, los alquileres disminuyeron ya que los agentes no llegaban con la misma frecuencia de antes, debido a lo sucedido decide pasarse a vivir a otra zona, ahí está trabajando en un hotel como mucama y hace dos meses está alquilando una casa con 7 habitaciones ubicada en una zona adecuada para este negocio, la cual ya se encuentra operando, pero necesita este crédito para poder traerse el equipo que tiene en las cabinas y que todas las habitaciones estén disponibles. Esta actividad ya tiene 20 años de operar, a pesar de los cambios que ha sufrido Liseth insiste en que es lo que le gusta y desea continuar con esta actividad, la cual indica es más estable que cualquier otra, ya que en estos momentos espera brindarle este servicio a estudiantes y continuar con agentes de venta.
texts.en: Liseth, 35, is a mother and head of household. She is a hardworking woman with a desire to make things better for herself and her son, age 13. Previously she had some rooms in the center of San Vito that she could rent out to salesmen traveling in the area. The number of renters decreased since the salesmen are not traveling with the same frequency. Because of this, she decided to go live in another region, where she is working as a maid in a hotel. For two months she has been renting a 7-room home in a more prosperous area, which is now up and running, but she needs a loan to move her furniture from the old rooms and get all the rooms ready to rent. She has been in this business for 20 years, and in spite of the changes she insists that she enjoys her work and wants to continue in this field. She feels that it is more stable than other types of work, and currently she hopes to rent rooms to students as well as salesmen.

loans.use: to move furniture for her business.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María  de 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada nació en  Saquisilí cantón perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi,  lugar muy conocido por sus habitantes que son comerciantes de granos secos , tiene  su casa propia que está ubicada en el cantón Saquisilí en una zona rural, vive ahí junto con su esposo e hijos, la casa fue  construida con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos pollos borregos  al por menor en las diferentes ferias de la localidad, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre y familiares quienes se dedican a esto desde hace mucho tiempo , dedica mas de cuatro horas, la mayor dificultad que tiene  es que no cuenta con mas capital para su trabajo razón por la cual solicita un crédito para la compra de alimento  para sus animales.
María solo pudo culminar sus estudios primarios ya que sus padres no contaban con el dinero suficiente para su educación .
María y su esposo quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and married in a civil union. She was born in the canton of Saquisilí in the province of Cotopaxi, a place known for its commerce in dried grains. She lives with her spouse and kids in her own home in rural part of Saquisilí, which was built with much effort and dedication.

María makes a living raising and selling young animals such as pigs, chickens and lambs in the various local markets. She learned the business from her mother and relatives who have dedicated their lives to the practice. 

Her biggest difficulty is that she doesn't have enough capital which is why she is requesting the loan to buy feed for her animals. 
María was only able to finish primary school as her parents did not have enough money for her education. María and her spouse would like to extend their sincere thanks to Kiva for making their economic and personal growth possible.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Stalin Javier

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de Pichincha en San Miguel de los Bancos un lugar con gente muy unida y trabajadora vive Stalin un joven muy trabajador que vive en unión libre desde hace un año no tiene hijos porque busca primero asegurar el futuro de su esposa por la cual trabaja día a día con mucha dedicación, a pesar de ser muy jóvenes son personas maduras que solo buscan salir adelante vienen de familias muy humildes las cuales les enseñaron buenos principios, son jóvenes con ejemplo a seguir. 
En su vida ha tenido varios obstáculos uno de ellos fue no poder continuar sus estudios superiores debido a que en su actual trabajo los horarios son distintos por falta de recursos económicos debido a que su Padre se dedica a labores de campo y su madre se dedica cuidar a sus hermanos menores motivo por el cual los ingresos son mínimos.
Tiene muchos sueños que quisiera concretarlos uno de ellos es dar a su esposa lo necesario y poder tener hijos que no tengan que pasar ninguna necesidad.
El negocio que desea emprender es la compra de cerdas madres para poder vender lechones le dedicarán un promedio de 3 horas diarias, tiene mucho conocimiento en esta actividad  ya que su Padre también se dedica a este negocio cuenta también con el apoyo de los mismos quienes están preocupados por su hogar está convencido que sus ingresos mejorarán por el bienestar de su hogar. 
Stalin agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder pronto cumplir con sus sueños está convencido que esta oportunidad que se le presenta debe aprovecharla al máximo.
texts.en:
Stalin lives in the northwest of Pichincha province, in San Miguel de los Bancos, where the people are hard-working and united. Stalin is a young, hard-working man, who has been living with his partner for a year. They don't have children yet, as he wants to ensure a decent future for his wife, and for this reason he works hard every day. Although the couple are very young, they are mature, and are trying to get ahead. Both come from humble families who have taught them good principles, and the young couple are an example to all. 

Stalin has faced many obstacles in his life, one of which was being unable to continue his studies owing to his working hours as well as the lack of financial resources. His father works in the fields, his mother looks after his younger siblings, and they have a very limited income. Stalin has many dreams, including being able to provide for his wife, and to be able to have children who won't want for any necessity.

He wants to start a business buying sows in order to sell the piglets. He will dedicate three hours daily to this work, and has a lot of experience in the area, as his father is also in the same business. He also has the support of his family, who believe that his increased earnings will improve the welfare of the household. 

Stalin is grateful to the Fundación Alternative and to Kiva for their support, and for the opportunity they have given him to improve his quality of life and to be able to fulfill his dreams quickly. He believes that he must make the most of this opportunity.

loans.use: to start a pig-rearing business.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice was born in Homabay, Kenya, and moved to Nairobi, the capital city, in 2007 in search of a job. He settled in the informal settlement of Kiambiu. He currently owns several businesses (cereals, outside catering and rentals) and intends to venture in the sanitation sector. 

Maurice has nine rental houses in Kiambiu and wish to install one Fresh Life Toilet in order to provide accessible and hygienic sanitation to his tenants. He hopes his tenants will have an opportunity to live a better life and this will lead to high tenant retention rates.

loans.use: to pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 30 years old, and married. She is blessed with one child who is now going to school. Ma. Cristina’s husband is in the army. They help each other in providing a better way of life for their child.

In order to have earnings, Ma. Cristina is engaged in a retail business. She sells various grocery items in her village. Ma. Cristina wants to extend the products she sells so that she can better serve her regular customers. She wants her retail business to become a one stop shop. Thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy rice, hog feed, and groceries to sell.

She knows that in this way she can help her husband, even in a simple way.

loans.use: to buy  rice, hog feed, and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Riwena

texts.en:
Armed with her dream of improving their house and having professional children, Riwena is working really hard to enhance her business. She knows that the income derived from her canteen varies from time to time. It is affected by customers’ satisfaction and preferences. This is the reason why Riwena plans to renovate her canteen in order to make it more desirable to customers. She will buy additional cooking and eating utensils and plans to cook more recipes and snacks.

She prays for a financial assistance from you amounting to 15,000 PHP. She is positive that she can pay it back with the help of her supportive husband Jesse, a regular employee. They are preparing for the future of their children through proper education and sufficient provision of their needs. They live in Davao City in the Mindanao region of the Philippines.

Riwena draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional cooking and eating utensils and to pay for the renovation of her canteen.

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Siony requested a 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Siony is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jazmín Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 43 años de edad, esta soltera, se destaca como una mujer muy luchadora ya que debió asumir desde muy joven el rol de madre, desde el momento que su mamá falleció, ella tomo la responsabilidad de brindarle un correcto desarrollo a su hermana que en ese entonces tenía 11 años. Han logrado salir adelante con apoyo mutuo, su hermana ya es licenciada en relaciones públicas, se destaca como una joven con buenas notas y que representa nacionalmente a Costa Rica en baile Folclórico, con mucho esfuerzo de ambas hoy ven los frutos de tanto esfuerzo. Marcela desde muy joven posee la habilidad de dedicarse a la encuadernación, empezó con tesis para estudiantes universitarios, actualmente trabaja encuadernando para empresas.
La clienta cuenta con un taller de encuadernación valorado en 700,000 colones, donde tiene una empastadora valorada en 70,000 colones, Cizolla valorada en 40,000 colones y una Guillotina valorada en 70,000 colones. Trabaja 6 horas al día, algunas veces debe trabajar mayor tiempo, depende de la cantidad que deba entregar en la semana. Necesita este crédito para mejorar el mobiliario del taller y tener materia prima disponible.
texts.en:
Marcela, age 43, is single.  She stands out as being a very tenacious woman.  When her mother died, she had to assume the role of being a mother when she was very young.  She took on the responsibility of providing her sister, who was then 11 years old, a proper upbringing.  

They have managed to get ahead with mutual support.  Her sister has a degree in public relations.  She stands out as being a young woman with good grades, and she represents Costa Rica nationally in Folclórico dance.  With great effort from both of them, they now see the fruits of so much effort.  

Ever since she was a very young woman Marcela has had the ability to work at bookbinding.  She started with theses for university students.  She now works binding for companies.

She has a bookbinding shop valued at 700,000 colones where she has a binding machine valued at 70,000 colones, a precision rotary cutter valued at 40,000 colones, and a  paper cutter valued at 70,000 colones.

She works six hours a day, and sometimes she needs to work longer, depending on the amount she needs to deliver in the week.

She needs this loan to improve the furniture in her shop and to have raw material available.

loans.use: to buy raw material and to remodel the furniture.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 22 years old now.

Margie has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Margie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Margie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Emily is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more seafood like crabs, shrimps, oysters and other seafood.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood like crabs, shrimps, oysters and other foods.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, ha decido solicitar un nuevo crédito para mantener la continuidad de su negocio y por los resultados positivos que le dan, en esta oportunidad lo utilizara para comparar variedad de fruta fresca, aceite, azúcar, maíz, para preparar la venta de fruta picada y antojitos, además invertirá en una mesa para exhibir su venta y una hielera para mantener fresca la mercadería.
Con el crédito anterior ha progresado mucho con su negocio, la familia se mantiene, se siente feliz de tener mejores circunstancias económicas ya que su hijos continúan estudiando y puede cuidar mejor de su padre brindándole mejor alimentación y sus medicamentos.
texts.en:
Maria has decided to request a new loan to maintain the consistency of her business and for the positive results that they give her. This time she will use the loan to buy a variety of fresh fruit, oil, sugar and corn to prepare chopped fruit and snacks to sell. In addition, she will buy a table to display her product and a cooler to keep the merchandise fresh.

With the previous loan, she has made a lot of progress with her business. Her family is supported and she feels happy under better financial circumstances. Her children continue attending school and she can take better care of her father by providing him with a better diet and medication.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fruit, oil, sugar and corn to prepare chopped fruit and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Stalyn Jesus

texts.es:
Stalyn es un joven Ecuatoriano, nació en Mulaló, parroquia rural de la ciudad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi, vive en un sector rural de la ciudad, donde su población se caracteriza por la crianza de animales, donde existe un clima frio. Stalyn tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, y tiene un hermoso hijo, vive en la casa de sus padres. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres culminó sus estudios hasta la primaria. Trabaja en la crianza de cerdos desde hace un año, lo que le permite llevar los recursos económicos para su hijo. 
Stalyn usará el crédito solicitado para la compra de más cerdos y alimento para los mismos. Stalyn espera con este crédito mejorar sus ingresos. Stalyn agradece a Kiva y Fundación Alternativa por ayudarle a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Stalyn is a young Ecuadorian man, he was born in Mulaló, a rural district of the city of Latacunga, Cotopaxi province, he lives in a rural sector of the city, where its population is characterized by the raising of animals, where there is a cold climate. 

Stalyn is 21 years old, he is single, and he has a beautiful son, he lives in his parents’ house. Thanks to his parents’ efforts he finished primary school. He has worked raising pigs for a year, which allows him to bring in economic resources for his son. 

Stalyn will use the requested loan to buy and feed pigs. He hopes with this loan to increase his income. Stalyn thanks Kiva and the Fundación Alternativa (Alternative Foundation) for helping him fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and food in order to improve production and and support his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor José nació en un lugar llamado San Francisco los cedros en el año de 1990 en este lugar vivió hasta la edad de 5 años, en la escuela de su comunidad empezó a estudiar pero solo llego hasta segundo grado, dejó de asistir a las clases para ir a trabajar con su padre y sus hermanos. Luego de un tiempo él y sus padres se trasladaron a un lugar llamado la Unión en donde el Señor José trabaja en la siembra de granos básicos, tiene sembrado café en una propiedad que compro.Hace un año aproximadamente se casó pero todavía no tiene hijos. En esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica y en los tiempos de corte de café le agarra la noche despulpando y se tiene que estar alumbrando con foco y en las madrugadas la madre de él también se tiene que alumbrar con foco para hacer el desayuno de los trabajadores para el tiempo de corte de café, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación este sistema será de gran beneficio para los miembros del hogar y será un gran cambio en la vida del núcleo familiar, el señor José estaría agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en: Jose was born in a place called San Francisco los Cedros in the year 1990. In this place he lived until the age of 5. He started school in his community, but only made it to second grade, he would leave his classes to work with his father and brothers. After some time, his parents moved him to a place called Union, where Jose works farming staple grains. He has farmed coffee in a property that he bought. Approximately one year ago he married, but still hasn’t had children, he says further on children will come. In this community of Union there is no electricity, and during the time of the coffee harvest, night will come upon him when he is removing pulp and he has to use a lantern to get light. In the early morning, his mother also has to use a lantern to make breakfast for the workers in the time of the harvest. This is why he asking for a loan, to purchase a solar system which will be installed in his house. This system will greatly benefit the members of his home, and will be a great change in the life of his family. Jose will be very grateful if he gets the opportunity of this loan to purchase this solar system.

loans.use: to buy a solar system of 100 watts with 4 installed lights.

loans.name: La Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.en:
The three women of this group live in Santa María de Jesús, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. This town is located on the flanks of the beautiful Agua Volcano and the town is well known as it is on the route one takes to reach the crater of the volcano.  The town has very strong Mayan roots and 90% of the women wear the traditional Mayan clothing typical of this region.  The women range in age from 27 to 66.  One of them is illiterate and of the others only one finished primary school. Their businesses include two small stores, a tortilleria and the sale of traditional clothing, bedding and women’s underwear. The women are all eager to work with Namaste to increase their sales. Namaste will provide them with basic financial training, a business advisor to help them develop and follow a business plan, and a small loan.  They are very hopeful that these tools will make a difference in their business and their profits.
Doña Eulalia is 41 years old and married with two children.  She is a strong, determined woman. As an adult she completed primary school.  This was something that was very important to her so she could read and write to succeed in her business and provide support for her children, who are still in school. She has a small store where she sells groceries and household items. Her goal is to continue to grow her business and she will use her loan for more items to stock her store.
Her current monthly net profit is 1598 Guatemalan Quetzales and she hopes to increase this by 50% over the nine-month loan cycle with Namaste.

loans.use: to buy more items to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick, sand, cement, metal sheeting and rocks.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marita has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shirts, etc.

Marita has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like shirts, etc.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is 30 years old and married with one child.

Glory works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Glory has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Glory aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 30 years old and married with two children.

Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fishing.

Jonalyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with seven children. She is 42 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mary Ann has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Mary Ann requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Franklin Rigoberto

texts.es:
Franklin  joven  ecuatoriano de 18 años de edad, nació en Latacunga  en una zona rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi vive en casa de sus padres terminó sus estudios primarios con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio de ellos, y al no poder  seguir dándole para que siga estudiando   tuvo que buscar primeramente trabajo 
Actualmente trabaja como ayudante  de albañil  desde hace algún tiempo atrás, además ayuda a sus padres a la crianza y cuidado de animales , y con esta experiencia que ha tenido él desea tener sus propios animales, por lo cual está solicitando un crédito para emprender su negocio, el   mayor obstáculo en la vida ha sido que por su corta edad nunca le han podido dar un crédito para emprender  su pequeño negocio,
Franklin es  quien ha dado todo el apoyo económico a su familia, es por esto que su madre siempre le apoya en cualquier decisión que tome. Al ver la situación económica de su hogar a más de seguir trabajando se hará cargo de su propio negocio, y luego contará la ayuda de uno de sus hermanos,  y un amigo por el momento no cuenta con el apoyo de ninguna entidad financiera, vino a Fundacion Alternativa ya que su madre es una cliente nuestra. 
Hace llegar un cordial y efusivo  agradecimiento a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal ya que con el dinero que le financiemos podrá cumplir con uno de sus mayores sueños.
texts.en:
Franklin, a young Ecuadorian of 18 years, was born in Latacunga in the rural area of the Cotopaxi province.  He lives in his parents' home.  He finished primary school with much effort and sacrifice from his parents, and when they were not able to continue giving this so that he could continue studying, he had to find his first job.  

He currently works as a bricklayer assistant.  For some time, he also has helped his parents with rearing and caring for animals, and with this experience that he has had, he wants to have his own animals.  For this, he is requesting a loan to start his business.  The greatest obstacle in his life has been that due to his young age he has never been able to receive a loan to start his small business.

Franklin has been providing all the economic support for his family.  It is because of this that his mother always supports him in whatever decision he makes.  Having seen the economic situation of his home, more than continuing to work, he will take charge of his own business.  Later, he will have the help of one of his siblings, and a friend who at the moment does not have the support of any financial organization.  He came to Fundaction Alternativa since his mother is a client of theirs.  

He gives a warm and effusive thanks to Kiva for making the growth of his work and personal life possible.  With the money that we fund him, he will be able to achieve one of his greatest dreams.

loans.use: to start his business of animal breeding and to support his parents with this income.

loans.name: Justa

texts.en:
Justa is 58 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Justa is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Justa has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: İsmahan

texts.en:
İsmahan is a mother of five, and her husband is deceased. Four of her children are married. Her smallest son goes to medical university. His expenses are high, so she makes Turkish ravioli and pasta at home and sells them.

With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy flour, butter, oil, and meat in bulk to produce more and gain more.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
İsmahan hanım beş çocuk annesi, eşi vefat etmiş. Dört çocuğu evli, küçük oğlu tıp okuyor masrafları çok olduğu için İsmahan hanım evden mantı ve makarna siparişi alarak satış yapıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile mantı malzemesi, un, yağ, et alarak üreterek satarak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, oil, and meat in bulk.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a businesswoman based in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. She owns rental houses and a chain of social amenities in the expansive and informal urban settlements of Mukuru. She learned about the Fresh Life Toilet from a friend and decided to buy two because it is easier to maintain than a conventional toilet.

Margret is thus applying for a loan to buy two Fresh Life Toilets. She wants to install the toilet so that her tenants can have access to a better and clean sanitation facility. Rental income will be used both to repay her loan, keep diversifying her businesses and create employment opportunities in her community.

Margret hopes to see a cleaner environment in her community so that her businesses will thrive and help her to lead a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for Two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Vastina

texts.en:
Vastina is a 35-year-old female Ugandan who is married to Geofrey, with whom she has five children aged between 16 and 5, only four of whom attend school.

Vastina is a farmer and her major crops are maize and beans but she also grows coffee and cocoa. She has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 which she wants to invest in farming activities by buying farm inputs in the form of seeds and fertilizers and hiring labour. This will boost her production and income. She will repay using proceeds from the farming.

Her dream for the future is to acquire more land and educate all her children. She is hardworking and focused.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Elzara

texts.en:
Elzara is a capable student. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is living in a small city near the reservoir. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a second-year student.

She studies and works at the same time. She works for the government. Her colleagues and employer are satisfied to have such a responsible and capable employee. She likes her job and studies.

Unfortunately, she does not have money to pay her tuition fee for her studies. She is asking for financial support from Kiva and IMON to pay higher education costs. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Tem 56 anos de idade, vive maritalmente tem 7 filhos maiores de idade 4 dos quais ainda na sua responsabilidade e a estudarem, ela estudou ate 3ª classe, vive de negócio a muitos anos, tem uma mercearia dentro do mercado e emprega 2 trabalhadores que lhe ajudam, esta a repetir pela 7ª vez o credito, com anteriores investiu no aumento do seu stock,  aquisição de bens de consumo para sua casa e na compra de gado bovino para criação. É uma senhora bastante batalhadora, que mesmo enfrentando dificuldades sempre luta para vencer e honrar com seus compromissos e sente que os créditos tem lhe ajudado no melhoramento da  condição de vida.
Com presente emprestimo pretende comprar: farinha, açúcar, feijão, manteiga, arroz, óleo, palones, yougurts, queijo, refrescos, sumos, vinhos, cervejas, etc, para aumentar o seu stock.
Ela tem a esperança de poder aumentar o seu stock e adquirir uma viatura que lhe possa ajudar no transporte da sua mercadoria.
Seu maior desafio é o facto de as vezes o seu negocio não ter muita saída como ela deseja, mas mesmo assim tem se esforçado bastante para ter sucesso.
texts.en:
Lidia is 56 years old and in a common law marriage. She has seven adult children, four of whom are still in school and under her responsibility. She completed 3rd grade. She's been doing business for a living for several years. She owns a grocery store inside the market and she employs two workers for help. This is her 7th loan. She used the previous loans to stock up, buy consumer goods for her house and cattle for raising. She's a very hardworking lady who faces struggles and yet always strives to overcome them and honor her commitments. She feels that the loans have helped her to improve her living conditions.
With the current loan she intends to purchase flour, sugar, beans, butter, rice, cooking oil, bologna, yogurt, cheese, refreshments, juice, wine, beer, etc. in order to stock up.
She hopes to be able to stock up and buy a vehicle to help her transport her merchandise.
Her biggest challenge is the fact that sometimes her business doesn't get as much turnover as she'd like, but nevertheless she's been making a great effort to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, beans, butter, rice, cooking oil, bologna, yogurt, cheese, refreshments, juice, wine, beer, etc. in order to stock up.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Pai de 3 filhos, 2 a estudarem e 1 ainda sem idade escolar, vive maritalmente à base de negocio, tem carteira de motorista mas actualmente está desempregado, tem nível primário. Esta a tomar o credito pela primeira vez e com o mesmo pretende ampliar o seu negocio de venda de produtos alimentares que faz em sua casa todos os dias e por encomenda.
Pretende comprar: amendoim, óleo, farinha, feijão, ovos, refrescos, etc
Ele sonha em desenvolver melhor o seu negocio, criar seus filhos e construir uma casa condigna, uma vez que actualmente vive numa de material precário.
Sua dificuldade esta no transporte da sua mercadoria, o que reduz muito o seu rendimento.
texts.en:
Francisco has three children, two of whom are in school and one is below school age. He's in a common law marriage and does business for a living. He has a driver's license but he's currently unemployed. He finished primary school. This is his first loan and with it he intends to expand his business. He sells foodstuffs at his house on a daily basis. He also sells by order.
He intends to purchase peanuts, cooking oil, flour, beans, eggs, refreshments, etc.
Francisco's dream is to further develop his business and raise his children. He also dreams of building a decent house, since he currently lives in a house that's poorly built.
He struggles to transport his merchandise, which greatly reduces his profits.
