La señora María Izolda es la representante del grupo, estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria, está casada con don Roque con quien ha procreado un niño que estudia en la escuela de la comunidad, a ella todos la conocen como Izolda, su carácter le ha permitido ser considerada como un buen líder para los integrantes del grupo.
Doña Izolda ha dedicado 8 años de su vida a la venta de ropa casual para dama y caballero, de igual manera a vender cosméticos por catalogo de diferentes marcas, hace 4 meses que recibió su primer préstamo decidió iniciar con la venta de tacos de cueritos, chicharrón, lengua, barbacoa y pibil. Comenta que espera aprender a prepararlos para que de esta manera las ganancias obtenidas sean mayores, su puesto se encuentra ubicado en la calle principal bajo un pequeño techo que es donde coloca tres mesas para sus clientes y en otra coloca la nevera con los tacos, la salsa, pico de gallo, rábanos, pepinos, limón, sal servilletas, palillos, platos y gel anti bacterial. Las mesas del pequeño puesto están lista a partir de las 8 de la mañana que es cuando llegan los tacos y termina de vender hasta las 2 de la tarde para regresar a casa, realizar los quehaceres y visitar a sus clientes mostrando la ropa y levantando pedido sus pedidos.
“Estoy feliz con mis actividades y sé que prosperaré como hasta ahora lo he logrado poco a poco” con las ganancias apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa reinvierte en la compra de refresco, ropa y  cosméticos, esta vez el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  cremas, lociones, labiales, sombras, mascarillas, rímel y pantalones para dama puesto que sus clientas se los han solicitado.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el puesto de tacos, doña Izolda es quien viste playera amarilla y está en medio de sus dos compañeras que visten blusa blanca.
texts.en:
In a community of Oaxaca, the principal attraction is the offer of work for many inhabitants who are involved in the fishing and sale of bream in the local area. As the group name suggests (it means "Entrepreneurs"), being entrepreneurs is the main characteristic of every member of the group. They have all set up a business on their own with the firm goal of providing the best they can for their families. The members and their business areas are as follows: Santa (tailoring), María Izolda (selling clothes, cosmetics and tacos), Juan (accounting), María (selling clothes and shoes), Emma (selling clothes), Joel (selling chicken) and Maritza (selling snacks).

María Izolda is the group's representative. She studied up to the third year of secondary school. She is married to Roque, with whom she has a son who goes to the local school. Everyone knows her as Izolda, and it is because of her character that the members consider her a good group leader.

Izolda has spent 8 years of her life selling casual clothes for both men and women. She also sells various brands of cosmetics by catalogue. She received her first loan 4 months ago and decided to set up selling tacos made of pork rind, pork crackling, pork tongue, barbecued pork and "pibil" (seasoned pork). She says that she hopes to learn to prepare them so that in this way she can increase her profit. She has a stall located in the main street underneath a small awning, where she places three tables for her customers and on another she sets up the fridge with the tacos, salsa sauce, "pico de gallo" salsa sauce, radishes, peppers, lemon, salt, napkins, cocktail sticks, plates and anti-bacterial gel. The tables of the small stall are ready from 8 am, which is when the tacos arrive, and she finishes selling at 2 pm to return home, carry out her household chores, and visit her customers to display her clothing items and handle orders.

“I enjoy my work and I know that I can prosper, just like I have done up until now, little by little". She uses her profit to help her husband cover the household expenses. She re-invests into her business by buying snacks, clothing and cosmetics.

This time she is asking for a loan to buy creams, lotions, lipsticks, eye-shadows, face-masks, mascara and ladies' trousers. These are all items that her customers have requested.

*The photo was taken at the tacos stall. Izolda is wearing a yellow T-shirt and is standing between two companions who are wearing white tops.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, lipsticks, eye-shadows, face-masks, mascara and ladies' trousers.

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
María, de 63 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos y trabaja junto a ellos en diversas actividades y tiene un puesto de ventas en el parque municipal de su pueblo.

María, se ha dedicado a la venta de refrescos desde hace más de 20 años y ya es muy conocida en su pueblo por esta actividad. 

María, necesita el dinero para invertir en su negocio de venta de refrescos y el la venta de sorbetes.

Ella, sueña con tener su propio local, para vender más tranquilamente y no tener que ser afectada por el invierno.
texts.en:
María, age 63, is married and has three children.  She works together with them in various jobs.  She has a sales stall in the city park of her town.

María has worked selling drinks for more than 20 years and she is very well known for this in her town.

María needs this money to invest in her business selling drinks and frozen desserts.

She dreams of having her own store so that she can make her sales in a calmer environment and doesn’t have to be affected by the winter.

loans.use: to invest in her business selling drinks and frozen desserts

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio; está en su ciclo número  12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, es un grupo bastante numeroso, donde todas luchan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elsa quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la costura que viene haciendo, tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Elsa es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza cada día para poder crecer y mejorar en el emprendimiento que hace.
La Sra. Elsa pide este préstamo para la compra de tejidos, hilos, y todo tipo de insumos que ella necesita para cumplir con  sus clientes; comenta que su objetivo es aumentar su la cantidad de máquinas y trabajadores a su cargo, tener mayor variedad y calidad para poder mantener su clientela y ganar clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group is in its 12th cycle of the committee of women program, where all members work and help each other succeed. It is quite a large group, where all fight to improve their living conditions and that of their families. One of the members is Elsa who through her effort, continuous work, and through the sewing that she does, has the means to help her family and her loved ones. Elsa is a very hard-working person who strives every day to grow and improve in the business that she does. 
Elsa requests this loan to buy fabrics, threads, and all types of supplies that she needs to satisfy her customers. She says that her objective is to increase her number of machines and workers in charge and to have more variety and quality in order to maintain her customer base and gain new customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, and all types of supplies for production.

loans.name: Henry Balmore

texts.es: Henry  de 22 años de edad, vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad. El trabaja en un taller de estructura metálica  situado cerca a su comunidad, hace puertas, balcones, portones y todo lo que pidan sus clientes en metal, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues su trabajo es de muy buena calidad y todo a excelentes precios, además su servicio es inigualable.  Henry es un hombre con grandes expectativas y con muchos sueños por realizar es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de independizarse laboralmente pero no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para realizar su trabajo y menos con un capital para alquiler de un local,  eso es lo que lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para la construcción de una galera en su casa de habitación la cual pueda ocupar como su lugar de trabajo y al mismo tiempo estar de esta forma más pendiente de su familia que es lo mas importante en su vida.  Henry  con el monto solicitado invertirá en: lámina, polines y madera, el tiene la esperanza que así obtendrá mejores ingresos y podrá darle a su familia una vida más digna y plena.
texts.en:
Henry is 22 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and his one-year-old son. He works in a metal shop located near his community. He makes metal doors, balconies, gates and everything his customers request. He has gained many customers recently because his work is of very good quality, everything is priced well, and he has unmatched service. 

Henry is a man with great expectations and many dreams to realize which is why he has decided to work independently but he doesn't have an adequate location to do his work or the resources to rent a shop. This is why he is requesting a loan with FUSAI to build a shed in his home which he can use as his work space. This will also allow him to look after his family which is what is most important in his life. With the loan requested, Henry will invest in sheet metal, beams and wood. He hopes that this will allow him to obtain a better income and he will be able to give his family a more dignified and fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, beams and wood.

loans.name: Aracelly Esther

texts.es: Aracelly cuenta con un local que ofrece en alquiler para actividades comerciales . Ella necesita hacer algunas mejoras al local como pintura y otros detalles, para seguir ofreciéndolo en alquiler. Solicita $500 para realizar este trabajo.
texts.en:
Aracelly owns a venue she rents out for commercial activities. She needs to do some improvements to the premises, such as painting it and other details, so she can continue renting it out.

She requests $500 dollars so she can do this work.

loans.use: to buy paint for the commercial venue she rents out.

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es:
Al igual que los antiguos pobladores de la civilización mazahua que habitaron las tierras del Estado de México, sus descendientes sienten un gran respeto por el campo que les otorga su alimento. Para ellos, cuidar los cultivos es cuidar sus propias raíces. 
   Dentro de una comunidad formada en dicha región se integró el grupo Sorpresa. El nombre fue elegido por Doña Leticia quien sintió tal emoción al saber que podría formar parte de un grupo para solicitar el beneficio financiero. 
   Doña Lety, como le llaman de cariño sus conocidos, está casada con el señor José y juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales dos continúan estudiando. Para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, Lety se dedica a la crianza de borregos; los compra desde muy pequeños para supervisar la calidad de su alimentación y una vez que se encuentran en óptimas condiciones los vende a personas que preparan deliciosos platillos con los ejemplares. Aunque la actividad ganadera es su principal fuente de ingresos, ella decidió complementarla realizando bordados como servilletas y manteles que sirven como recuerdos para algún de evento. "Desde pequeña me ha gustado elaborar este tipo de bordados mi mamá me enseñó y ahora yo les enseño a mis hijas" comento Doña Lety. 
   Por el momento, sus negocios se mantienen como uno de los más reconocidos en la comunidad a pesar de que  existe cierta competencia. En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para comprar agujas, telas, estambres etc. 
   Doña Lety se siente especialmente agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA ya que gracias a los créditos sus dos negocios mejoran gradualmente y así ha podido remodelar su vivienda y, por lo tanto, mejorar su calidad de vida. Su  única meta es continuar apoyando a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios. 
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Doña Adelina quien invertirá en bordados; Juana, Leticia, Hilaria y Juliana, en borregos y Mónica, en dulces.
texts.en:
Like the ancient settlers of the Mazahua civilization who inhabited the land of the Mexican State, their descendants feel a great sense of respect for the countryside that is the is their provider of nourishment. For them, taking care of the fields is taking care of their own roots. Inside of a community formed within this region the Sorpresa group was established. The name was chosen by Leticia who was so excited to learn she could join a group to request financial support. Lety, as she is known by those close to her, is married to Jose and together they have four children who are all in school. 

To help with expenses around the home, Lety earns a living raising sheep; she buys them young to supervise the quality of their feeding and once they are in optimal condition she sells them to people who prepare delicious dishes. Although livestock is her primary source of income, she decided to supplement by making embroidery such as napkins and tablecloths which serve as mementos from a certain event. "From a young age I've enjoyed creating this types of embroidery. My mother taught me and now I teach my kids" remarks Lety.

At the moment, her businesses are some of the most well recognized in the community because of her particular proficiency. On this occasion she requests a loan to purchase needles, fabric, yarn, etc...Lety feels especially grateful to VisionFund and Kiva because thanks to their loans two businesses are gradually improving which has allowed her to remodel her home, and therefore improve her quality of life. Her only goal is to continue supporting her children to finish school. The other members of the group are Adelina who invests in embroidery, Juana, Leticia, Hilaria, and Juliana in sheep, and Monica in sweets.

loans.use: to purchase needles, fabric, yarn, etc...

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luís, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al cuidado de su hijo de 3 años de edad.
 
Luís, es agricultor desde que tenia 13 años de edad, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a sus padres y decidió dedicarse a la agricultura, también realiza trabajos de carpintería; sus cultivos están a 3 kilómetros desde su casa, ellos se levantan a las 4:30 a.m. y su pareja se levanta para prepararle el desayuno.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y semilla de pasto para sembrar y darle a sus vacas.

Los sueños de Luís son, poder darle el estudio a su hijo y poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Luis, 50 years old, studied until the fourth grade. He has a partner who takes care of their 3-year-old son. 

Luis has been a farmer since he was 13 years old. He learned this trade thanks to his parents and he decided to work in agriculture. He also does carpentry work. His crops are 3 kilometers from his home. He and his partner get up at 4:30am, his partner gets up to prepare his breakfast. 

He needs this loan to buy fertilizers and grass seed to plant to give to his cows. Luis's dreams are to give his son an education and to be able to build his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and grass seed.

loans.name: Maria Noemy

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, dejo de ir a la escuela porque estaba muy lejos, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno está estudiando y los demás trabajan.

María, desde hace un año vende tortas, hamburguesas, comida y más; antes se dedicaba solo al cuidado de su familia y ayudaba a su esposo en la agricultura, pero luego decidió poner su negocio para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, porque la situación cada día es más difícil.- Ella también tiene el ingreso de un cyber que tienen sus hijos y su negocio lo tiene en su casa; ella comienzan sus labores a la 1:00 p.m. y termina a las 8:00 p.m 

El crédito lo necesita para compra 3 novillas de repasto para engordarlas, cuidarlas y venderlas.

Sus sueños son, es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y estudien una carrera universitaria, además desea que su negocio crezca y pueda emplear a más personas.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and has a sixth-grade education. She dropped out of school because it was very far away. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has three children, one of whom is in school. The other two work.

For the past year, Maria has been selling sandwiches, hamburgers, and other food. Before that, she only worked at home, caring for her family and helping her husband farm. Then she decided to start her own business in order to help her husband cover their household expenses because their financial situation was getting worse. She also gets income from an Internet cafe set up in her home. Her children run that business, while she works from 1:00 pm to 8:00 pm.
 
She needs this loan in order to buy three beef breed calves which she plans to fatten, care for, and sell.

Her dream is for her children to keep studying and go to college. She also wants her business to grow so that she can employ more people.

loans.use: to buy three heifers so that she can raise them, and sell them.

loans.name: Reinaldo De Jesus

texts.es:
Reinaldo, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado, tiene dos hijos que viven con él y están estudiando.

Reinaldo, tiene venta de verduras desde hace más de 10 años, este trabajo lo aprendió por si solo y se decidió porque es un negocio que le genera ganancias y su negocio está a dos kilómetros y el horario de atención es de 6:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar verduras, para surtir más el negocio y lo mejorara porque le dará más ganancia.

Reinaldo, sueña con darle estudio a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reinaldo, 52, has a 9th grade education and is married.  He has 2 children who live with him and who attend school.  

Reinaldo has had a business selling vegetables for more than 10 years.  He learned this business on his own, and he chose it because this is a business that generates profits.  His business is 2 kilometers away, and he tends to it from 6am until 3pm. 

Reinaldo needs this loan to buy vegetables to stock up his business and improve it, so that it will give him greater earnings.

Reinaldo dreams of providing his children with an education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johanna vive en una población donde hay serios problemas de abastecimiento de agua potable , por esta razón debe almacenarla en un tanque para reserva de agua, por lo cual solicita un préstamo de $ 500 para comprar este artículo
texts.en: Johanna lives in a location where there are serious problems with the potable water supply. For this reason, she would like to purchase a water tank, so she has requested a loan for $500.

loans.use: to purchase a water reserve tank.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 56 years old, from Ozurgeti. He lives with his sister, Makvala. 

Vazha is unemployed at the moment. He wants to open a bakery and he has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo, enables him to get a loan for purchasing all the needed equipment for his bakery. He will also purchase a stock of flour and will bake Georgian bread to sell. 

Vazha has been working for years as a baker and he is experienced in this field. Vazha hopes that the business will be profitable and he awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 55 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Maria lleva 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa de toda clase para mujer, hombres y ropa interior. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante,  por encargos y entrega a domicilio. Doña María ha obtenido varios prestamos para su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar blusas y camisas usadas para vender y obtener mas ingresos.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo como comerciante y darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 55 and lives with her common law husband. She has two children and lives in a neighborhood in Quimistán municipality, Santa Barbara.  For the last six years Maria has made a living selling all types of clothing for women and men as well as underwear. She sells this clothing on the street, by order and by home delivery. Maria has gotten several loans for her business and now she is requesting another loan for 5,000 Lempiras to buy used shirts and blouses to sell and earn more income. Her dream is to keep growing as a saleswoman and give a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothing such as shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Maria Purificacion

texts.es:
María, de 69 años de edad, es comerciante, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, es madre de dos hijos y su pareja se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas. 

María, tiene más de 10 años de tener el cafetín en la escuela, de lo cual obtiene los ingresos para suplir sus necesidades.

El préstamo lo utilizara para surtir el cafetín con más producto. 

Ella sueña con hacerle mejoras a su casa, ya que le faltan varias cosas para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
María, aged 69, is in business. She studied as far as her high school diploma and is in a relationship. She is the mother of two children and her partner makes a living doing agricultural work. 

For more than 10 years María has had the small snack bar in the primary school and from this she gets the income to meet her needs.

She will use the loan to stock the snack bar with more products. Her dream is to make improvements to her house, because she still needs several things so that her family can live better.

loans.use: to stock the small snack bar with more products.

loans.name: Alcira Johana

texts.en: Alcira is 25 years old and has been running a beauty salon since 2007 from her home town of Turbo, situated in the west of Antioquia. She is incredibly dedicated to improving her salon. That is why she works every day to attract new customers and expand her business. Given the high price of beauty items, she would like to take out a loan so she can purchase extra products as well as replace the seats used for her customers in the hair salon.She dreams of improving her living conditions and providing herself with a brighter future. With her hard work and your assistance, Alcira can make this dream true!

loans.use: purchase extra products as well as replace the seats

loans.name: Eloy Spencer

texts.es: Don Eloy tiene un proyecto de cría de pollos necesita hacer un galerón moderno , eficiente y amplio para continuar con este trabajo , por lo cual necesita un crédito de $ 500 para comprar materiales y construir el local.
texts.en: Eloy has a chicken farm business. He needs to build a modern, efficient, and large pen in order to continue with his work. He needs a $500 loan to purchase materials and construct the building.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a pen on his chicken farm.

loans.name: Karin Nehariyen

texts.es:
Karin tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su cónyugue y sus dos menores hijos; vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, contando con servicios de agua y luz, dicho distrito pertenece a la provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Karin es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo,cuenta con buenas referencia personales y labores; el destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar su stock de su negocio, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Karin is 38 years old and lives with her partner and two minor children. She lives in the rural part of the Pucará district, relying on water and light services. This district is part of the Jaén Province in the Cajamarca Region of Peru's northern Sierra.

Karin's business is selling beauty products from a catalog. She counts on good personal references and good work. The use of the loan will be to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of merchandise in order to increase her business's stock. This will generate more income for her and she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise in order to increase her business's stock.

loans.name: Iwaoga Salamata

texts.fr:
Mme IWAOGA SALAMATA  est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 09personnes en charge.
Mme transforme et vend de la patte d’arachide et du soumbala depuis 24ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 03sacs d’arachides et 02sacs de graines de néré pour la transformation en patte d’arachide et en soumbala.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité et pouvoir diversifier. Mme ambitionne acheter assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iwaoga Salamata is married and the mother of five children, the eldest of whom is 30 years old and the youngest of whom is 13. Three [of the children] attend school. Mrs. Iwaoga Salamata has nine people in her care.

Mrs. Iwaoga Salamata has been making and selling ground nut paste and soumbala for 24 years. She gets her supplies in nearby villages. She wants to purchase three sacks of ground nuts and two sacks of néré seeds [from the African locust tree] to make into ground nut paste and soumbala[, respectively]. She wants to use her profits to reinvest in her business and be able to diversify. Mrs. Iwaoga Salamata's goal is to ensure [that she can] pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of ground nuts and two sacks of néré seeds [from the African locust tree] to make into ground nut paste and soumbala.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr: Malien, Salifou est âgé de 30 ans. Il n’a pas eu l’occasion d’aller à l’école. Marié, il est père de 3 enfants tous des garçons. Salifou a pu s’acheter un bœuf avec ses économies des prêts passés son rêve est de s’acheter un autre bœuf et une charrue pour faciliter son activité d’agriculture pour l’avenir. Son espoir est d’avoir un prêt conséquent au R M C R pour le développement son activité. C’est l’homme qui tient la corde du bœuf sur la photo. Il prend le prêt au RMCR pour acheter des bœufs pour l’élevage. Il s’approvisionne au marché environnant et vend au même marché après l’engraissement. Le bénéfice récolté sur la vente des bœufs lui permet de prendre en charge : la santé, la nourriture et l’habillement de ses enfants ; cela pour un bénéfice moyen de 7500f fcfa par mois. Salifou n’a pas eu de problème avec le prêt du RMCR. Il compte s’encourager dans son activité d’élevage et faciliter l’agriculture afin de satisfaire suffisamment besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salifou is from Mali and is 30 years old. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He is married and the father of three children, all boys. Salifou was able to purchase a steer with his savings from previous loans; his dream is to purchase another steer and a plow to facilitate his farming business in the future. He thus hopes to have a loan from RMCR for the development of his business.

Salifou is the man holding the steer's lead in the photo. He his taking this loan from RMCR to purchase cattle to raise. He gets his supplies from nearby markets and sells in the same market after fattening [the cattle]. The profit collected on the sale of the cattle allows him to see to health, food, and clothing [costs] for his children for an average monthly profit of 7,500 CFA francs.

Salifou has had no problems with the loan from RMCR. It will support his cattle-raising business and facilitate [his] farming in order to sufficiently meet his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows for his barn to resell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother and takes care of one additional family member. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and utilities.

She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years and works seven days a week. Her major challenge is seasonality of fruits and vegetables. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

Sandra has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy passion fruits, pineapples, oranges and tomatoes. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and to buy a van to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy passion fruits, pineapples, oranges and tomatoes

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen, 45, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ailen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Ailen requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other supplies to use in her business.

In the future, Ailen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other supplies

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en: Rafik is 47 years old and lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Rafik lives with his wife, two sons and a daughter. Rafik has a specialty of hairdressing and has worked for many years in this specialty. He has his own small space providing hair cutting services for men. He has a lot of regular customers and among them are his friends, neighbors, relatives and ordinary citizens. They like Rafik’s work and won't visit another hairdresser. Rafik’s elder son also is a hairdresser. This loan of 250,000 Armenian drams will allow Rafik to make cosmetic repairs at his workplace so it is more comfortable and attractive for his customers.

loans.use: to make cosmetic repairs at his workplace so it ist more comfortable and attractive for his customers

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene la edad  de 30 años, está en unión libre y vive con el esposo  y dos hijos actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que a recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Maritza is 30 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two of their children. She plans to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay for labor to help her with her coffee.  With these improvements to her crops, she hopes to increase her earnings and improve her family's living conditions.  

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. Prior to this, she had never had a loan through a conventional bank, but FUDECOSUR has given her the opportunity to get a loan easily and with a low interest rate.

loans.use: purchase supplies to grow coffee.

loans.name: Bitaliana

texts.es: Bitaliana es una mujer de 33 años que vive en la localidad rural de Cotahuasi, en el centro poblado de Quillunza junto a su esposo Leonardo. Leonardo trabaja en la agricultura y Bitaliana se dedica a la ganadería, ella solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar una vaca orgánica, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. Bitiliana siempre se ha preocupado por comer saludablemente es por eso que apuesta por lo orgánico. En el futuro espera poder mejorar su casa para que viva cómodamente junto a su esposo, logren tener estabilidad económica y sobre todo gocen de una buena salud.
texts.en: Bitaliana is a 33 year old woman who lives in the rural community of Cotahuasi in the city of Quillunza with her husband, Leonardo. Leonardo works in agriculture and Bitaliana works raising livestock.  She is seeking a micro loan to purchase an organic cow. She hopes to be able to sell the milk at a better price because it is organic.  Bitaliana has always been concerned with eating healthily, which is why she is committed to eating organically.  In the future, she hopes to improve her home so that she can live more comfortably with her husband, to become financially stable, and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: purchase an organic cow.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en: Munavar is a careful mother. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1961. She is living in one of biggest districts with her family. She is a divorced mother of one child. She does business in the domestic market, selling women's and men's clothing and underwear. She has 18 years of experience in this field of business. Munavar got sick and needs hospital treatment. She is asking for financial support from Kiva and IMON to be treated in the hospital. She needs to continue her business to support her family. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to receive hospital treatment.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children who all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a beauty salon. She has been in this business for the last 16 years, working seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling used clothes. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair relaxing,treatments, weaves and braids. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a refrigerator to start selling cold drinks. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy hair relaxing,treatments, weaves and braids

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario  tiene la edad de 48 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y tres hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mario is 48 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their three children.  He plans to use this loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for the coffee plantation that he plans on starting.  He hopes to properly care for his crops so that he can have a good yield and increase his earnings.  He hopes that in the future he will be able to give his family a better quality of life and more financial stability, and that he can continue to grow professionally and personally. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. Prior to this loan, he had never had a loan with a traditional bank, but FUDECOSUR gave him the opportunity to get a loan easily and with a low interest rate.

loans.use: purchase supplies to make coffee.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Karine is a pedagogue and she graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute's school of mathematics and Informatics. Karine now works at the school as a teacher of mathematics. She is a greatly respected and beloved teacher. Karine has three sons. The eldest is busy with his small trading business and her second eldest and youngest son are still students. Karine asks for this loan to buy a computer, accessories for the computer and also some professional literature. She needs these all for her teaching to be up to date an all the innovations in the pedagogical field.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for the computer and also some professional literature

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan  tiene la edad de 29  años, está en unión libre   y vive con  la esposa actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca de leche   .El espera poder obtener más leche y queso para vender a los negocios y vecinos y engordar las crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 29 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and currently lives with his wife. 

Jonathan wants the loan in order to buy a milk cow. He hopes to be able to obtain more milk and cheese to sell to businesses and neighbors and to fatten the calves to sell at the ideal weight; that way, he will have a greater income. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans through state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mürüvet Fatma

texts.en:
Mürüvet is married and a mother of two.  Her husband lost his job and she had to do something to make a living so she opened a small millinery store.  She heard about the Tupperware products and started selling them.  Now she runs the two businesses together.  She says that she did not bow down to poverty, she worked hard and beat it.  With the help of the loan she is going to buy Tupperware products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Mürüvet Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Eşinin işsiz kalması ile  bir şeyler yapmak ve evin geçimini sağlamak için küçük bir tuhafiye dükkanı açıyor.  O sırada Tupperware ürünleri ile de  tanışıyor ve bu işi de yapmaya başlıyor.  Şuan da iki işi birlik de yürütüyor.  Yoksulluğa boyun eğmediğini  hiç yılmadan mücAdele ettiğini  ve onu yendiğini söylüyor.  Aldığı  kredi ile Tupperware ürünleri alacak.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products for resale

loans.name: Yolando

texts.en:
Yolando is 21 years old. She is single with no child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Yolando has requested a loan to buy shopping bags, cooking oil, sugar, yeast, etc. She joined SPBD in June 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Yolando will save her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy yeast, corn flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sanabar

texts.en:
Sanabar is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is living in a village far from the city with her family. She is married and has four children. Her husband is in construction. She is a teacher. She has taught students for about four years at secondary school. Her children are going to school and university. She and her husband are trying to feed and ensure their children are well provided for.

This year because of a financial crisis they could not pay University tuition fees for her child. She appealed to IMON and KIVA to get a loan to pay her child’s higher education costs. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay her child’s University fees.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur lives with his family in Geghamavan, a village in the Gegharkunik region. Khachatur has higher juridical education, and for many years he worked in his specialty. Today he combines his work of being a lawyer with his farming activities very successfully.

Khachatur has not a small farm where he takes care of cows, calves, a heifer, bulls, pigs, sheep, lambs, chickens and also a lot of bee colonies. He is simply a master in farming activities, and he manages his farm very well.

On his plot of land he also cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, greens and peppers. Khachatur’s wife sells these vegetables, along with his farm products such as milk, cheese, meat (beef, mutton, pork and poultry), eggs and honey, at the city’s wholesale market.

Khachatur has two sons, and both them have chosen their father’s specialty. Both of them work in that sphere, and they also are very good farmers already. Khachatur is very proud of them both. 

Khachatur is asking for this loan of 700,000 AMD (Armenian drams) because he needs to purchase wax papers for his bees, diesel fuel, and animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase wax papers for his bees, diesel fuel, and animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Vrezh

texts.en: Vrezh is 31 years old and lives with his mother and school-age sister in the frontier village of Aghavnavank in the Tavush region. His brother now is in the Russian Federation for work abroad and from there he greatly helps his family with finances. In his native village, Vrezh is engaged in farming. Here he has cows, sheep and chickens. Vrezh also cultivates vegetables and fruits on his land and uses the harvest for his family's needs. Vrezh sells farm products such as milk, beef, mutton and eggs right from his farm to his regular customers. Vrezh finds sheep breeding for his family very profitable and with this Kiva loan he wants to buy sheep and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy sheep and fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is a 37-year-old female married with five children and living in Kasese, Uganda. For more than 10 years, Marion has been operating a general merchandise retail shop to earn a living. With her previous loan Marion's profits increased from UGX 150,000 to UGX 200,000 thanks to Kiva. She also deals in livestock and crop farming alongside a motorcycle transport business for additional income.

Marion has a dream of educating her children and expanding her business. However, she is faced with the challenge of limited capital that hinders her dream. Marion intends to use the loan to buy maize flour, millet flour, rice and other merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, millet flour, rice and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, opta por un nuevo crédito por la facilidad de pago y porque así puede reactivar su negocio con rapidez, invertirá en semilla de marañón para procesarla y abastecer a sus clientes, espera de esta manera seguir teniendo su fuente de ingresos.
Con el uso de créditos ha podido superar dificultades que antes tenía para que su negocio fuera creciendo, cuenta con mucho más clientes satisfechos, tiene buen record crediticio y brinda a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
María has chosen to request a new loan because she can repay in installments and it will allow her to boost her business quickly. She will buy cashew nuts that she will process and supply to her customers. In this way, she expects to continue having a source of income.

Through the use of credit, she has been able to overcome difficulties that she had in the past so that her business can grow. She has many more satisfied customers, has a good credit history, and provides a more comfortable style of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts that she will process and supply to her customers.

loans.name: Songteelgo De Koanga Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOHAMADI Joanny est responsable du groupe  SONGTEELGO DE KOANGA. Marié il est père de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé à 25 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école.
Monsieur fait l’élevage depuis 16ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il veut s’acheter  04 porcs et 23 poules.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour accroitre son activité. Il ambitionne être plus tard un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
M. Mohamadi Joanny is the leader of the Songteelgo De Koanga group. Married, he is the father of eight children, of whom the eldest is 25 years old and the youngest is two years old. Three of the children go to school.

M. Mohamadi Joanny has been raising livestock for 16 years. He procures his stock in the surrounding markets. 

With the money received, he wants to buy four pigs and 23 chickens.

He wants to use his earnings to increase his business. 

M. Mohamadi Joanny hopes to later become a large livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and 23 chickens

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en: Leonia lives in Atsabe. She is married and has one child. She is applying for a $1000 loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a clothes shop and is also selling in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to purchase more clothes, such as short sleeves, shorts, shirts, underwear, etc., to sell. Leonia has been involved in business activities since 2007. She started with her own working capital of $1000. She is earning a good income from selling clothes as many people like to buy them. She is still happy to be doing her business. She also has animals like pigs.

loans.use: to purchase short sleeves, shorts, shirts, underwear and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
A $1000.00 loan is offered to Isabel to repair  her house. Isabel started construction of her house but she was not able to finish because of the lack of money to buy materials such as cement, stone, sand and other items.

Now she is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to help her finishing off her house. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone and sand to finish her house construction

loans.name: Elsalina

texts.en: This loan of $1,000 will allow Elsalina to send her son  to post-secondary school. She will use the loan to pay for tuition and school supplies.Elsalina loves her son very much and hopes that further education will help her to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy tuition and school supplies.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: A loan of $800 will help Julio to send his youngest daughter  to secondary school.Julio hopes that by continuing his youngest daughter’s education, they will have more opportunities and a better life. The money will be used to cover educational costs including textbooks and a backpack for his youngest daughter.

loans.use: to buy textbooks and a backpack.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio built his house in 2003, but he didn't have enough money to buy more material to complete it. 

Therefore he is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete his house. With the loan he wants to buy more material such as wood, sand, stone, iron, cement, nails, zinc and other materials to use. 

Antonio is very happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin, and that because of it he can now complete his house.

loans.use: To buy wood, sand, stone, iron, cement, nails, zinc and other materials to use.

loans.name: Allah Kademe Group

texts.fr:
Mme GOMPOKO MARIE CLAIRE représente le groupe ALLAH KADEME. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 43ans et le moins âgé de 20ans. 02 vont à l’école et  elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme vend des bijoux et pagnes depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne  dans les marché environnants. 
Elle veut s’acheter 10complets pagnes.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans l'activité. Mme ambitionne toujours acheter des parcelles  pour ses  enfants.
texts.en: Ms. GOMPOKO MARIE CLAIRE represents the group ALLAH KADEME. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 43, and the youngest is 20. Two are going to school. She has six persons to support. This lady has been selling jewelry and traditional clothing for eleven years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. She wants to purchase 10 ‘pagne’ cloth outfits. With the profits, she wants to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is still to buy parcels of land for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 10 'pagne' cloth outfits

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 33 years old. He lives in Zugdidi with his pensioner mother. Ramaz has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood. His parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family.

Sadly, due to lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Ramaz was unable to study for a professional career. He works hard on the family-owned agricultural land, growing vegetables. He always has high quality products which are sold to local retailers for a good price.

Ramaz requested a loan to buy a tractor and cultivate his land. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for purchasing a tractor. Once the tractor is purchased, Ramaz will be able to cultivate his land, decrease his expenses and increase his income. He will also rent the tractor to his fellow villagers to get additional income.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Romualdo

texts.en: This loan of $1000 will allow Roumaldo to send his youngest daughter to post-secondary school.He will use the loan to pay for tuition and school supplies. Roumaldo loves his daughter very much and hopes that further education will help her to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To pay for tuition and school supplies.

loans.name: Abdul's Group

texts.en:
Abdul is a 44 year old farmer and he supports a family of seven. He lives in a village called Ghumanwala in Gujranwala District in Pakistan. He is standing in the middle in the picture by holding a register in his hand. He works in his fields to earn the family's livings with plenty of activities including cultivating rice, wheat and vegetables in his farm house. 
He wants to be able to make improvements to his house, which is currently with mud walls. He also wants his children to study in good educational institutes and be able to have better living conditions.
He is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs like quality seeds, fertilizer & pesticides for his rice crop. His family’s living standard will be improved after utilizing this loan. He promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Rat

texts.en:
Rat is a 32-year-old mother of three children who are all in school, living in Kampong Cham province. The sources of her family’s income are from growing cassava and cashew for fourteen years. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely paid back the loan. Her family’s living condition has improved, and her family members are having a better health because of the previous loan. 

Unfortunately, her family is now facing a difficulty. Because of the depreciation of the cassava’s price Rat doesn't have enough funds to do farming again. To overcome this hardship, she is now applying for a new loan via VisionFund with the will to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee to increase productivity of her crop. 

She hopes to earn more money to expand her farming area and ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee to increase productivity of her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde tiene 60 años de edad, vive con su hijo en casa propia de material rústico ubicada en el caserio Frayle que pertenece al distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Clotilde se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, adicionalmente cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, platano, vituca). Cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 04 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Clotilde espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 60 years old. She lives with her son in a house that she owns built from rustic materials. Her house is located in the Frayle community, which is part of the district of Santo Tomás, in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains. Life in this district is peaceful, and the residents earn their livings primarily in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Clotilde works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee. In addition, she raises young animals (hens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and grows staple products (yucca, plantains, and taro). She has four years of experience in the field and very good personal and work-related references in her area. 

She will use the loan that is being granted to purchase soil amendments and fertilizers to properly maintain her coffee crop, as well as to contract manual labor for the harvest season. With this, Clotilde expects to offer a higher quality coffee to her customers, which will have a positive impact on her income level, thereby improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizers in order to properly maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Abid's Group

texts.en:
Abid is a hardworking 25-year-old young farmer living in “Ghoga”, a village in district Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is raising his hand in this photo. He has been in the farming business for many years, mainly growing wheat and rice in his farm. He began the business to earn a living and support his family.
He is requesting a loan to buy quality seeds, fertilizers, fuel and pesticides for his rice crop. He is the leader of group where group guarantor ship is practiced.
He will be grateful for loan and promises to repay the loan without any delay.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, with her retired mother, lives in the Khachardzan frontier village of the Tavush region. 

Maria has no higher education and with the help of her mother, she manages farming. On the farm, Maria has cows, pigs, sheep, chickens, and bee families. Maria sells very tasty farm products, such as milk, cheese, meat, honey, and eggs. She sells these products to her neighbors, with the help of her mother. She also has a cute vegetable and fruit garden, the harvest of which is small. They use it for their own food. 

With hope of better living conditions, Maria asks for this loan since she wants to enlarge the assortment of her farm cattle, add several bee families and several piglets, and buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to enlarge the assortment of her farm cattle, add several bee families and several piglets, and buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Minandra

texts.en:
What you can see in the picture are just some of the favorite snacks of Filipino people. They are called banana cue and turon (both are fried banana sweets but turon is wrapped).

Behind is Minandra, a 35-year-old mother to three kids. Her husband, Alvar, is working overseas. Finding a way to help her partner, she tries to busy herself today by managing her small business at Intramuros, Manila. It isn't easy to be working and a full-time mother simultaneously. But, Minandra finds comfort and encouragement from the people that surround her. Especially now that she is active in attending a regular weekly fellowship in her area where they gather to share their stories, inspire each other and study the word of God.

Sometimes, Minandra comes to a point that she wants to quit, especially when her income isn't sufficient for her family's needs. It was a sad thing. However, she perseveres and moves forward.

In fact, today she would like to ask for a loan. She wants to continue operations of her business. If you would allow, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 that she would use to purchase additional raw ingredients for cooking and selling her main courses: turon and banana cue. It would really be a big help, not just to her but also to her family.

Someday, she dreams her children will finish their studies (for future security of course) and she will grow her inventory, which will help her eventually to succeed in life.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for cooking and selling her main courses, turon and banana cue.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 49 years old and has a live-in partner with two children. 

Ester is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ester requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ester has been raising pigs for three years now.

Ester would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto works hard to support his family. He is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Roberto requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in his general store.

Roberto has been in this business for 20 years now.

Roberto would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Aman's Group

texts.en:
Aman is raising his hand in this photo. He is a 37-year-old farmer from Pakistan. He has 5 family members. He has completed 3 successful loan cycles with his lender JWS with good repayment history.
He is in the profession of farming for last many years. He cultivates rice, wheat & vegetables to feed his family. He is  the group leader and there are 5 members in his group. They are requesting a loan to purchase agri inputs like quality seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for their rice crop.  This loan will enable them to purchase agriculture inputs from open market on discounted rates. They are committed to repay their loan. They are grateful to kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Edda Katherine

texts.es:
Edda Katherine tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa familiar con su abuela y hermana en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, galletas, entre otros, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 04 años. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, juguetes, entre otros para implemetar su negocio. Con esto Edda Katherine espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos lo que le reportará mayores niveles de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edda Katherine is 27 years old. She is single and lives in her family's house with her grandmother and sister in the district of Zaña, located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. She lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and the raising of livestock.

Edda earns a living from the sale of groceries such as rice, sugar, candies, crackers and cookies among other things and she has been in this business for more than four years. She has experience in the business and steady clients who give her very good personal and work references. This loan will be used for the purchase of a larger amount of products such as rice, sugar, oil, toys and other things to sell in her enterprise. With these purchases, she hopes to offer a greater variety of products which will bring her higher levels of sales and will permit her to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy the items she needs to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Aqeel's Group

texts.en:
Aqeel is a 51-year-old married man who is raising his hand in the photo. He is an honest farmer living in a backward village of Gujranwala district of Pakistan. He has 7 family members. He grows wheat and rice in his farms to feed his family. 
He is requesting a loan to buy agri inputs like 2 sacks of quality seeds, 15 sacks of fertilizer and herbicides for his rice crop. He believes that this loan will help him to increase his income and enable him to meet his family's needs. He wants to have better housing, food, and education for his children. He and his group members are grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Irfan's Group

texts.en:
Irfan has over 20 years of experience in rice farming. His parents passed it down to him. Despite his limited income, the profit from the business enables him to respond part of his family needs. He intends to do a lot more work to have a good harvest, enabling him to improve his day-to-day life. He is the leader of the group and he is holding a booklet in the photo.
He is requesting loan to buy agri inputs like quality seeds, fertilizer & pesticides for their rice crop. This loan shall increase his income and improve the lifestyle of his family. He is committed to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is the man raising his hand in the photo. He is a 36-year-old farmer from Pakistan. He has 11 family members. He has completed two successful loan cycles with his lender JWS with good repayment history.
He has been farming for seven years. He cultivates rice, wheat and vegetables in his farm. He is using modern agri techniques to increase his yield. He has taken a series of training on crop management from the platform of his lender. He is the group leader and there are 4 members in his group. They are requesting a loan to purchase agriculture inputs such as quality seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for their rice crop. This loan will enable them to increase their yield. They are committed to send their children in school.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad (standing in the middle and raising his hand) is a 35-year-old married farmer with 8 family members. He is a resident of “Mari Thakran” village in the tehsil kamoke of Pakistan. He is a farmer who grows wheat, rice, vegetables in his farm. 

He mobilized his village farmers to form a group and take benefit from JWS’s farmers’ development program. The group members acquired training on crop management, soil testing and water testing from their lender to improve crop output.
Now he and his group need a loan to buy farm inputs, such as quality seeds, sprayers, herbicides, and fertilizers, to improve their agricultural productivity. They plan to repay this loan through the sale of their production.

His dream is to improve his farming business. He is confident that, with the training organized by local lender and startup capital, his dream will be realized.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Maravilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARAVILLA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mochilas, venta de tenis, venta de fruta, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de artefactos, venta de accesorios de celular.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tenis; da a conocer que este negocio lo  aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de tenis para damas por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Maravilla Communal Association is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional hub. This group is composed of nine members and is directed by a board of directors of which señora Sandra is president. The businesses that the members have are varied; among them the sale of tennis shoes, fruit, shawls, food, artisan objects, and cell phone accessories. The loan that they are taking out will benefit the microentrepreneurs like Sandra.  She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer due to the invitation of a friend who is a member of the [Pro Mujer] institution. 
Señora Sandra has a business selling tennis shoes. She learned the ropes of this business on her own initiative several years ago. The loan that she will receive will serve to increase her inventory (she will buy women's sneakers at wholesale prices) that she will acquire from wholesale dealers in the city of La Paz; later she will sell them in her sales location {in El Alto]. This kind of work allows her to generate income to help her family economically since she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she is pleased with its health program and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy women's tennis shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand in the photo is Muhammad from village Ghumanwala. He is 33 years old, married, and has 3 family members. He practices vegetables, rice and wheat farming. Having undergone hand in hand training on crop and financial management, he learnt how to draw his budget and plan well for the future for better output of his land.
He is requesting a loan from kiva and its lender, with which he intends to purchase fertilizer and quality seeds for his rice crop. This loan will help to expand his farming activities and increase his earnings to support his family. He is very grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Mohammad's Group

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 36-year-old poor farmer. He lives in Mari Thakran, a village in district Gujranwala, Pakistan. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily in his farm house to earn a income for his family. 
He mobilized his village farmers to form a group of three, took benefit from JWS’s training's program of crop management. They are now ready to apply the knowledge and skills they've acquired. This is his 3rd loan with local lender.
He and his group members are requesting a small loan to buy farm inputs such as 5 sacks of quality seeds and 30 sacks of fertilizers. This loan shall enable them to improve their yield. They plan to repay this loan through the sale of their production.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start her business buying two dairy cows and support her children's education with income from this business.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad (raising hand) is a 51 years old married man. He has 11 dependents in his family, living in “Dera Bee wali”, a village in district Gujranwala, Pakistan. To overcome his family’s hardship, he grows wheat and rice as the main sources of his family’s income. He has been involved in farming for twenty years.
This is the 5th loan for Muhammad with JWS. He is raising his hand in this photo. He is the group leader and his group has obtained successful training on crop management from the platform of local lender to enhance his agri yield. He is requesting a loan to buy quality seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor and plowing fees to support his farming business. He hopes this loan will help him to earn more income to expand his farmland and improve his ability to keep sending his children to school.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Shoaib's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of Punjab province, Pakistan, Shoaib is a 25 years old young farmer and he is married. He is raising his hand in this photo. He is the leader of his group and there are 4 farmers in his group. He earns his living through farming wheat and rice in his land. He has been a client of JWS for a year. His group has taken out a loan in the amount of PKR 380,000 in total. With this loan, he purchased pesticide, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to support his rice farming. He believes that with the help of this loan, he can increase his income and improve the living standard of his family. He is grateful to acquire this loan.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuels

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is a 31-year-old, married woman. She lives in Kobuleti with her husband, Koba, her school-aged sister, and her parents. Koba works at a local petrol station and gets a small monthly income. Rusudan's father is an artisan and repairs cars to generate income. 

Rusudan is unemployed and wants to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo, enables her to get a loan to start a trading business. 

She will purchase linens to resell at a higher price. This will increase her income and she will be able to financially help her family members. 

Rusudan is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin selling linens.

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EL BUEN SAMARITANO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de ropa, salón de peinado, venta de pescado, venta de pan, venta de mantas, servicio de construcción, venta de artefactos.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artefactos da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace quince años trabajando como ayudante y con el poco ahorro que tenía decidió emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licuadoras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The Buen Samaritano Communal Association is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional hub. This group is composed of 10 members and it is directed by a board of directors of which señora Elena is the president. The businesses of the members of this communal association are varied and include the sale of shawls, clothing, fish, bread and small appliances as well as construction service and a beauty shop. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the group of microentrepreneurs of which señora Elena is a member. She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer due to the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Señora Elena has a business selling small appliances. She says that she learned this business fifteen years ago working as a helper and, with the small savings that she had, she decided to begin her own business. The loan that she will take out will go toward the purchase of blenders at wholesale prices that she will buy from wholesale dealers in the city of La Paz and later sell in markets in the city of El Alto. This kind of work enables her to generate income to help her family economically since she is married and has four children. When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she is pleased with the health program that it offers.

loans.use: to buy electric blenders at wholesale prices

loans.name: Amanat's Group

texts.en:
Amanat is the leader of his group of three and he is raising his hand in photo. He is married with seven children. The eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is eight years old. Two of the children are in school.

He has been farming for 20 years. He grows rice and wheat in his land to feed his family and meet day to day expenses.

With this loan, he plans to buy 18 sacks of fertilizer, 3 sacks of seeds and pesticides for his rice crop. He wants to use his earnings from the production to reinvest in his business and to help his family. He dreams of becoming a large farmer.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a hardworking 28-year-old young farmer living in Qila Bhattian, District Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is raising his hand in the photo. He is the representative of the four-member group. For last seven years, he has been in the farming business growing wheat and rice in his farm. He began the business to earn a living and support his family.
He is requesting a loan to buy quality seeds, fertilizers, fuel and pesticides for his rice crop. The loan will enable  him to purchase agriculture inputs from open market at discounted rates. His yield shall improve and he will be able to support his family. He will be grateful to KIVA and he promises to repay the loan without any delay.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Ghulam's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam, 34 years old, did not have the opportunity to go to school. His parents didn't send him to school because they believed it wasn't necessary. Now he is married and he has 6 dependents. Ghulam works in agriculture to earn income for his family. 

He has worked in agriculture since he was 18 years old, a job he learned from his parents. He works in this business because it was the most viable way to earn income. The place he cultivates is close to his house in village and he goes by foot from his home.

This loan is necessary to purchase 15 sacks of fertilizers, prepare the land, and pay the fee for his rice crop.

His dream is to have a brick house and he hopes to manage it with work and dedication.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Javeed's Group

texts.en:
Javeed is the man standing in the middle of the photo. He is a 30-year-old farmer from Pakistan with 4 family members. He has completed one successful loan cycles with his lender JWS with good repayment history.
He has been in the farming business for 10 years. He cultivates rice, wheat, vegetables and fodder in his farm. He has taken training on crop management from the platform of his lender. He has gone through soil testing, water testing & laser leveling in his fields.
He is the group leader and there are 3 members in his group. They are requesting a loan to purchase agri inputs like quality seeds, fuel, fertilizer and pesticides for their rice crop. This loan enables them to sell their ripe crop in open market to gain better income. Their children will get better food and good education.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUAYNA POTOSI” iniciará el vigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Abigail es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de carne, venta de comida, venta de condimentos, venta de plásticos, confección y venta de prendas de vestir.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Abigail es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que forma parte de la asociación comunal.
En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio confección y venta trajes para dama, da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los créditos que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Huayna Potosi” will begin its twenty-eighth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Office of German Busch. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a governing board of which Abigail is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them exist: cosmetics sales, meat sales, food sales, condiment sales, plastic sales, and the manufacture and sale of articles of clothing.
