The loan that they will take out will benefit small-business entrepreneurs of which Abigail is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining through the invitation from a neighbor who is part of the communal bank.

Currently, she has a business manufacturing and selling women’s suits. She makes it known that she learned this business from her sister-in-law many years ago.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase in capital (to purchase cloth wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz which, after manufacturing, she will sell in her store. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is single.

When she is consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase cloth wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
María Alejandra tiene 38 años de edad, madre soltera vive con sus tres hijos dependientes,en casa propia en el caserio del Tingo- Distrito de San Felipe,que pertenece a la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú. Es una comunidad pequeña que se dedica básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería, comercio, entre otros.

María Alejandra la actividad que realiza María Alejandra es la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños; por reparto, recorre los caserios cercanos de su zona para realizar la venta, además se dedica al cultivo de lima, con más de 06 años de experiencia en el rubro, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales,el préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería para aumentar el stock de su negocio con esto tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y obtener mejores utilidades y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Alejandra is a 38 year old single mother who lives with her three dependent children in a house of her own in the village of Tingo in the district of San Felipe, Jaen Province in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern Sierra. Tingo is a small community where people earn their living in agriculture, the raising of livestock, commerce and so on.

María Alejandra's business is the sale of clothing for women, men and children. She visits nearby villages in her area to deliver her goods. In addition, she cultivates lima beans. She has more than six years of experience in her business and has very good personal references. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to increase the stock of her clothing business and with this will have the possibility of increasing her sales and better profits. In this way, she will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase her stock.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is 32 years old young farmer from Pakistan, he is raising his hand in the photo. He is married with 10 dependents. he is in the agriculture business to earn a income for his family’s day to day expenses. He grows rice and wheat in his land. He requested a loan to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for his rice crop. He will pay school fee of his children and feed them better.
In the future, he would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a resident of Ghoga village in tehsil Kamonki, District Gujranwala. He is a group leader of two and holding a register in the photo. He is the head of his family and he looks after the subsistence needs of his family. He is a farmer by occupation and cultivates rice and wheat on his small land.
He and his group member face problems to secure required agricultural inputs in a timely manner due to poor economic conditions. They either end up using less or substandard quality of inputs resulting in lower yield per acre. 
Both group members hope that the required loan facility shall help them to procure agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, seeds and fuel in timely manner. They are committed to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Ben Be Se Kola Group

texts.fr:
SIDI, c’est l’homme qui tient la corde du bœuf sur la photo. Âgé de 56 ans, Marié, sa femme est ménagère. Sidi à fréquenté l’école et il fut l’un des premiers secrétaires d’AV de leur village. Il est père de 11 enfants dont cinq (5) garçons sont scolarisés, et sont âgés de 07 à 21 ans.
Il fait cette activité d’embouche bovine depuis plus de 09 ans, il s’approvisionne dans les marchés d’environnants. SIDI est un client de RMCR depuis 2013 et il est à son quatrième cycle, selon lui, il apprécie beaucoup les services de RMCR. Après la vente son bénéfice peut varier entre 50 000 f à 75 000 f CFA. Avec ses profits il parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille : comme en  couver-ture sanitaire, habillements, et alimentaires SIDI souhaite dans l’avenir avoir plus de fonds afin de pouvoir développer son activité, avoir plus de l’aliment bétail pour les animaux.
texts.en:
SIDI is the man who is holding the cow rope in the photo.  He is 56 years old and married, his wife is a housewife.  Sidi has been to school and was one of the first AV secretaries in their village.  He is a father of 11 children, of which five boys are educated and they are between the ages of 7 and 21.  

He has been doing his cattle business for more than nine years now; he buys his stock from surrounding markets. SIDI has been an RMCR (Malian Microfinance Institution) customer since 2013 and he is in his 4th cycle.  According to him, he appreciates many of RMCR's services.  

After selling the livestock his profits can range from 50 000f to 75 000f CFA.  With the profits he be able to support his family with their needs.  For example, with health insurance, clothing and foodstuffs.  SIDI wishes to have more funds in the future so he can develop his business, and have more food for the animals.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Khalid's Group

texts.en:
Khalid is resident of Dera Cheema, a remote village in tehsil Kamonki, District Gujranwala. He is the group leader of three members and he is holding a register in the photo. He is the sole bread earner of his family and cultivates rice and wheat crops in seasonal manner. 
He and his group members are poor farmers and always struggle to finance their agricultural inputs in timely manner. With the proposed credit facility, the group members can finance their inputs for rice crop in timely manner and ensure a better yield. Group members are committed to be responsible borrowers.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into a family of farmers. She is living in a village with her own family now. She is married and has five children. She has been a teacher of Tajik language and literature for about five years, and she cares about each of her students. Gulnora is gentle, polite and a responsible person. Gulnora wants to obtain higher education, but she needs money to enter the university. She is asking for a loan to pay her tuition fees. She hopes that KIVA lenders will support her and she can work on her self-development. She awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fee.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a Kiva borrower. She has one child. She describes herself as being ambitious. 

Christine operates a retail business, where she sells green vegetables. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as ambitious. For five years, she has operate a retail business selling vegetables. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as being patient. 

Asha operates a retail business, where she sells green vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Rupali

texts.en:
Rupali is a mother of two daughters. She is a 36-year-old woman who hails from Kandi. Her husband runs a hardware shop. Their elder daughter is now married, and the younger one reads in grade six. They live in their own small house at Kandi in Murshidabad district.

As the earning of Rupali's husband is inconsistent, she earns a living for the family by rearing cattle. Rupali wants her family to be happy and to have a good life. She has been involved in animal husbandry for a long time. Every morning, she milks the cows and then sells their milk at the market where the demand is high. She derives a good income from this activity.

She now wants to increase her cattle to earn more to cope with the growing price of essential commodities, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. This is the reason why she has asked Kiva's partner BJS for financial assistance. She will use the loan amount to buy another cow for her milk selling business. She will also use the loan to purchase fodder for her cows.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow to expand her business.

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 26 años, vive en unión libre en casa de su suegra. Vive con su esposa de 21 años y su pequeña hija que ahora tiene 3 años, ella asiste a la guardería, es un servicio gratuito que ofrece el gobierno. Carlos se lleva muy bien con su suegra y en el hogar existe un buen ambiente familiar ya que su esposa está bien enterada  sobre el emprendimiento que Carlos desea iniciar. Su esposa en ocasiones también borda camisas indígenas para después venderlas y ayudar con un poco para los gastos del hogar. 
Viven en Santa Isabel de Pilascacho que pertenece a Andrade Marín de Atuntaqui. En el lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura, al cuidado de animales y a la confección de camisas de indumentaria indígena. 
Carlos trabaja desde hace 7 años en un taller de enderezada y pintura, y ahora ya adquirido mucha experiencia en el negocio, es por eso que quiere emprender su propio taller de enderezada y pintura. Él ahora cuenta con algunas máquinas que le servirán en su futuro negocio, pero le hacen falta otras, es por eso que solicita el crédito. Va a invertir en la compra de un tecle, una suelda autógena, un porto y una máquina para pulir. Para empezar contara con la ayuda de su esposa que actualmente no trabaja y se encarga únicamente del cuidado de su hija.
Carlos desea independizarse y aumentar sus ingresos para invertir en una buena educación para su hija. Y además en un futuro tener su casa propia. Agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 26-year-old young man. He is in a common-law marriage and lives in his mother-in-law’s house with his 21-year-old wife and their little 3-year-old daughter. His daughter attends the nursery, which is a free service provided by the government.

Carlos gets along very well with his mother-in-law, and their home has a warm, family atmosphere, so his wife is well-informed of the undertaking Carlos wishes to begin. His wife sometimes also embroiders and sells indigenous shirts in order to help a bit with the household expenses.

They live in Santa Isabel de Pilascacho, which is a part of Andrade Marín de Atuntaqui. The people who inhabit this place work in agriculture, ranching, and production of indigenous clothing.

Carlos has worked for 7 years in a bodywork and painting workshop. He has acquired much experience in this business, and so now he wants to open his own bodywork and painting workshop. He already has some of the machines that he will need for his future business, but he lacks others, and so he is requesting a loan for them. He will invest in a block and tackle, oxygen-acetylene welding equipment, a tool kit, and a polishing machine. At the beginning he will rely on help from his wife, who currently does not work and only takes care of their daughter.

Carlos wishes to become independent and increase his income, so he can invest in a good education for his daughter and also in his own house in the future. He is thankful to Kiva for the help provided.

loans.use: to open his own bodywork and painting workshop, which will provide resources to invest in his daughter's education.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Iliassa cultivateur malien est âgé de 43 ans. Il n’a pas été à l’école. Marié, sa femme est une ménagère. Père de 4 enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles. Les 4 enfants (filles et garçons) sont tous scolarisés. Il cultive les calebasses, le mil (sorgho et petit mil), arachide, …etc. C’est l’homme qui donne l’aliment bétail aux moutons et qui tient leurs cordes sur la photo. Il prend le prêt au RMCR pour acheter des moutons pour l’embouche. Il fait ses achats au marché  environnant. Après l’engraissement il les revend  chez lui-même et a d’autre marché. Le bénéfice récolté sur la vente des moutons lui permet de prendre en charge : la santé, la scolarité et l’habillement de ses enfants. Il déclare n’avoir pas eu de problème avec le prêt du RMCR. Son rêve pour l’avenir est d’avoir un prêt conséquent pour développer son activité d’élevage et faciliter l’agriculture afin de satisfaire suffisamment à aux besoins de sa
texts.en:
Iliassa is a 43 year old Malian farmer.  He has not been to school.  He is married  and his wife is a housewife.  He is a father of four children, two boys and two girls.  The children are all educated.  He grows calabash, millet (sorghum and little millet) and peanuts etc. He is the man who is feeding the sheep and holding the sheep rope in the photo.  

He will take the loan to RMCR to buy sheep to fatten.  He buys the livestock from the nearby market.  After he has fattened them, he keeps some and sells the others to another market.  The profits will allow him to pay for healthcare, schooling and clothing for his children. He states that he has never had a problem with a loan from RMCR.  

His dream for the future is to be able to have a another loan to develop his breeding business and to facilitate his agricultural business so he can sufficiently meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy sheep to sell

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is a 50-year-old humble and hardworking woman from Kandi, India. Her family comprises her husband and five children. Her three daughters are married, and her two sons are engaged in cultivation and milk businesses respectively. She and her husband both are uneducated and can sign their names only.

They both have been involved with a milk selling business for many years. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for the last few years. They started their business with the purchase of one cow. They supply milk to their neighborhood and earn revenue for their family.

Now, this business is the sole source of income for the family and a strong financial support to the family. As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, they have to work hard so that they can be able to generate more income. She has decided to purchase one more cow and expand her business.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to be able to purchase a dairy cow, which will help her in terms of supplying more milk. She dreams to purchase two more cows in the future and save more for her old age.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Artan

texts.en:
Artan a father of three young children bought a pregnant milk cow from some other villagers with the promise that he would pay the amount of 250,000 Albanian Lek for it someday soon.  This is the reason why is requesting this loan from you.  The plans are that he expand on cows and sells raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. 

Artan is 44 years old and his focus has always been on agriculture/livestock type of activity and the only source of income for the family. In the photograph he is with an agricultural tractor because he offers agro services with it to villages around. He also has a sow from which he sells about 10 piglets a year. His wife is involved in the activities as she has no activity of her own.

loans.use: to pay for a pregnant milk cow he bought from some villagers, with the promise to pay back soon

loans.name: Musafak

texts.en: Musafak lives in Kudus, which is a nine-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Musafak is happily married, and together with his wife, they have one cute daughter. Musafak sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He is hoping to get a loan from Kiva to process more mobile airtime credits for his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Musafak improve his business and his community, which needs access to communication services. In the photo, Musafak is sitting in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi est une femme mariée âgée de 54 ans ayant trois enfants à charge et habitant à Soviépé. Essi vend de la pâte bandée préparée à base du maïs à sa devanture. Essi achète ses denrées alimentaires deux fois par mois. Essi sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de maïs et des condiments. Avec le profit qui en résultera, Essi compte investir cela dans la scolarisation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Essi, age 54, is married with three dependent children, and she lives in Soviépé. She sells a type of dough made from maize, and she conducts her sales in front of her house. She buys ingredients twice per month. 

Essi is seeking this loan to buy sacks of maize and condiments. She will use her profits to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize and some spices.

loans.name: Asaf Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde viven los integrantes del grupo Asaf es de origen mazahua por lo tanto algunas personas aún conservan y practican su lengua materna aunque desgraciadamente se ha ido perdiendo gradualmente. Gran parte de la población se dedica al cultivo de maíz y al comercio; todas las familias cuentan con un negocio, algunos adquieren su mercancía en las mismas tiendas de la comunidad para salir a vender a otras.
   Doña Agustina es una persona muy trabajadora y especialmente amable, su familia está integrada por su esposo Juan y sus 10 hijos de los cuales ya solo dos dependen de la pareja. Los dos estudian uno la preparatoria y otro la educación secundaria. Siempre ha apoyado en los gastos de su hogar, desde hace 40 años se dedica a la venta de jarciería o productos para limpieza. En un inicio vendía los artículos de comunidad en comunidad cargando los productos sobre sus brazos, afortunadamente la situación ha cambiado y ahora tiene puestos bien establecidos.
   En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para comprar vasos de licuadora, cuchillos, tijeras, lasos para tendedero, guantes, cubetas cepillos, etc. Doña Agustina ha sabido salir adelante no obstante los obstáculos que se le puedan presentar, la actitud positiva y el sueño de tener una mejor calidad de vida la motivan a no darse por vencida. Por ahora su principal meta es que sus hijas ejerzan una carrera profesional.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo Asaf son: Raquel quien invertirá en vasos de licuadora; María Angélica, en controles y vasos de licuadoras; Felisa, lonas de diferentes tamaños y colores; Emma, en mercería y Norma, en vasos de licuadoras y mercería. Todas ellas comparten su gratitud y alegría por el beneficio del crédito.
    * La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Doña Agustina es quien viste un mandil rosa y un suéter café*
texts.en:
The community where the members of the Asaf group live is of Mazahua origin. Some people still maintain and use their mother tongue, although sadly the language is gradually being lost. A large portion of the population work in trade and maize cultivation. All families depend on some type of trade, and some people travel to other communities and sell merchandise. 

Doña Agustina is a very hard working and endearing person. Her family consists of her husband Juan and their 10 children, of which only two are dependent of the couple. Both of them are in school, one in high school and the other in secondary school.  Doña Agustina has always supported the household's living expenses. 

For 40 years she has been selling household supplies. In the beginning, she used to sell within the community by carrying the products in her arms. Thankfully, the situation has changed and now she has well-established sales posts. 

At this time, she is requesting the loan to buy blender pitchers, knives, scissors, clothesline, gloves, buckets, scrub brushes, etc. Doña Agustina  has learned to move forward despite the obstacle that could come up. This positive attitude and her dream of a better quality of life motivate her to not give up. Right now, her main goal is to have her daughters start professional careers.

The other members of the Asaf group are: Raquel who will invest in blender pitchers, María Angélica in blender bases and pitchers, Felisa in tarps of different sizes and colors, Emma in haberdashery, and Norma in blenders and haberdashery. All of the women share their gratitude and happiness for the loan.   *The photo was taken on the steps of the municipal kiosk. Doña Agustina is the one dressed in pink apron and coffee colored jacket*

loans.use: to purchase household supplies such as blender pitchers, knives, scissors, clothesline, gloves, buckets, scrub brushes, etc.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a happy woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She is living in a big city with her family. She is divorced and has two children. 

Since 2012 Nasiba has been working at a kindergarten. She is a responsible, careful, hardworking and honest person. She likes children and her work. 

Nasiba has an old and sick mother. Her heart is constantly in excitement because her mother is sick. She wants to treat her in a medical clinic, but she does not have money to pay for the treatment. Nasiba is requesting a loan to treat her mother in a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits KIVA lenders compassion.

loans.use: pay her mother's medical treatment

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

Ali operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all kinds. 

Ali will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. Esther operates a retail business where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. 

Esther will use this KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is 45 years old, resident of Harpoke village in tehsil Kamonki, District Gujranwala. He is the head of his family and looks after the subsistence needs of seven family members. He is a farmer by occupation and cultivates rice and wheat on his small land holding. He is a group leader of three and he is holding a register in the photo.
He and his group members are facing problems to secure required agricultural inputs in timely manner due to limited or no savings. They therefore have to rely on informal sources of credit that cost them a lot and also take away their right to sell their crops on market rates. 
This loan enables them to purchase agricultural inputs from open market at discounted rates. They hopes their yield will  improve so they can send their children to better schools. They are committed to be responsible borrowers.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es:
Cuando Ciriaco estudiaba la primaria, recuerda que tenía que salir al campo con su padre a cultivar maíz y trigo, pues era la única fuente de ingresos de su hogar. Fue cuando este agricultor que ahora tiene 39 años de edad, aprendió lo que tiempo después se iba a convertir en su trabajo para poder sustentar a sus cuatro hijos y a su esposa. Ahora tiene más de 25 años de experiencia sembrando frijoles, maíz y trigo, siendo los últimos dos cultivos solo para el consumo del hogar y el primero solo para la venta. 
Ciriaco cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposa, sin embargo, también viaja en verano al país vecino para conseguir otros ingresos. Por esta razón, para aprovechar que el tiempo de invierno está mojando el campo, solicita un préstamo para comprar un quintal de semillas de frijoles, una caja de glifosato, seis litros de herbicidas y para pagar a veinte trabajadores que lo apoyan en su cultivo. Con esto podrá mejorar la calidad de su siembra e incrementar la cantidad de clientes. En sus planes está, comprar una vaca para ingresar a la ganadería y un terreno para seguir cultivando.
texts.en:
When Ciriaco studied in primary school, he remembers that he had to go to the field with his father to cultivate corn and wheat, which was the only source of income for his home. This was when this farmer who now is 39 years old learned what later would become his work to be able to support his four children and his wife. Now, he has more than 25 years of experience sowing beans, corn, and wheat, the last two crops being only for the home consumption and the first only for selling.

Ciriaco has the support of his children and his wife. Nevertheless, he also travels in the summer to the neighboring country to make an additional income. For this reason, to take advantage of the winter, he is wetting the land. He is requesting a loan to purchase a quintal (46 kg) of bean seed, a box of weed killer, six liters of herbicide, and to pay twenty workers to support him in his farming. With this, he will be able to improve the quality of his crops and increase the quantity of his customers. Among his plans are to purchase a cow to add to his livestock and land to continue cultivating.

loans.use: to purchase a quintal (46 kg) of bean seed, a box of weed killer, six liters of herbicides, and to pay twenty workers.

loans.name: Greyton Daniel

texts.es:
Muchos piensan que el negocio de los camiones es solo para hombres, sin embargo, Greyton, un hombre de 31 años de edad, incursionó en este ambiente con la ayuda de su abuela, quien poseía un camión. A medida que pasaron los años, este hombre trabajador conoció todo sobre esta área laboral gracias su abuela, hasta que decidió independizarse con la ayuda de su madre, quien compró un camión, y ahora ya tiene cuatro años como comerciante de materiales de construcción, es padre de dos hijos de doce y otro de seis años y tiene una esposa que lo apoya en todo. 
Ahora Greyton es dueño total del camión y sabe que es fuerte el trabajo de mantenerlo. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar arena, piedras canterías, entre otros materiales de construcción para poder obtener el dinero necesario para sustentar a su familia. En sus planes de largo plazo está comprar una camioneta, para tener un automóvil de uso personal y también laboral.
texts.en:
Many people think that the trucking business is only for men, however Greyton, a 31 year old man, started in this line of work with the help of his grandmother, who owned a truck.  As the years passed, this hardworking man learned everything about this type of work from his grandmother, until he decided to become independent.  With the help of his mother, who bought a truck, he now has worked selling construction materials for four years.  He is the father of two children who are 12 and six years old and he has a wife who supports him in everything.

Now, Greyton is the sole owner of the truck and knows that it is important to his work to maintain it.  For this reason, he is requesting this loan to purchase sand, cut stone, and other construction materials so he can earn the necessary money to support his family.  His long term plans include purchasing a pickup truck so he can have a vehicle for both work and personal use.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cut stones, and other items.

loans.name: Unión Y Libertad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNION Y LIBERTAD” lleva treinta y cinco ciclos en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lilia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de regalos y juguetes, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte, venta de computadoras, venta de pasteles, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lilia es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente  de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de juguetes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace varios años.

El préstamo que sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de juguetes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas del departamento de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Sonia porque después del desembolso se tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Unión y libertad" ["Unity and Liberty"] has been in Pro Mujer for 35 loan cycles, as part of the Santiago Regional Hub II. It is made up of 8 members, and it is directed by an executive board of which Lilia is the treasurer. There is variety among the businesses that the association's members carry out. Among them are gift and toy sales, clothing sales, transportation services, computer sales, pastry sales, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they took out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, including Lilia. She says that she became part of Pro Mujer ten years ago, joining because of the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling toys. She relates that she learned the business from her mom several years ago.

The loan that she will take out will be to increase her capital (to buy toys in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers from the department of Oruro. Later she will sell it from her sales kiosk. This manner of working enables her to generate enough resources to support her family economically. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health center offered by the institution.

The group member Sonia is not in the photo because after the disbursement, she had to go to the location she sells from.

loans.use: to buy toys in bulk

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regulars. 

Sabina will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a bigger boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a food vendor who has been selling tomatoes for the last 4 years. She is 44 years old, widowed, and has six children. She works hard to give basic needs to her children and has a dream of expanding her business into a big grocery in her area. However, limited capital and lack of a preservative machine to keep her products fresh are challenges she faces. Margret is requesting a loan to buy more tomatoes for selling.

loans.use: buy tomatoes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be reliable. 

Josephine operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

Josephine will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy sewing materials

loans.name: Sulainah

texts.en:
Sulainah is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She used her previous loan to buy more shoes to sell. She still sells second-hand shoes and that is her major source of income although she also practices farming. She started this business to earn herself a living. She still dreams of becoming a prominent business woman though she faces a problem of inadequate capital.
 
Sulainah intends to use this loan to buy more second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.use: buy second-hand shoes

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is a Kiva borrower. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be risk taker. 

Mathias operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 9 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are regulars. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the shortage of water. 

Mathias will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy a water tank for water storage. His goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Beatriz Aracelys

texts.es:
Beatriz es una joven de veintiséis años de edad, con muchos deseos de superación, siempre ha sido muy emprendedora, cuenta con el gran apoyo de su madre, ella inicio un pequeño negocio con un capital que su mamá le regalo, con este compro un poco de ropa, pantalones, carteras y otros accesorios para mujeres, vendiéndolos de forma ambulante, al cabo de un tiempo su negocio se ha ido convirtiendo en más rentable. 
En la actualidad, esta mujer luchadora, necesita, crecer y refozar su negocio, es por eso que ha recurrido a MiCrédito junto a Kiva, para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar mercadería, como pantalones, camisas, shorts, joyería, perfumes, entre otros. En un futuro se ve teniendo su propia boutique.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 26 years old and wants to succeed.  She has always been very enterprising.  With the help of money from her mother, she started a small business.  She purchased a small amount of clothing, pants, wallets, and other accessories for women and sold them as a street vendor.  In time, her business has become profitable.

Currently, this hardworking woman needs to grow and strengthen her business.  She has come to MiCrédito together with Kiva to request a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise like pants, shirts, shorts, jewelry, perfumes, and other items.  In the future, she would like to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, jewelry, perfumes, and other items.

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILLIMANI” iniciarán el vigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jimena es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de galletas, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte, venta de abarrotes, tienda de barrio, confección y venta de prendas de vestir.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jimena es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que  integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de  su esposo hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de una maquina recta que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto, esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar su capital ya que, con la ayuda de sus hijos, podrá  realizar más prendas de vestir. Para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Illimani" communal bank will begin its 23rd loan cycle under Pro Mujer program, through the German Busch regional office. it is led by an 8-member Board of Directors, of which Jimena is the secretary. 

The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include selling cookies, selling clothing, taxi service, selling groceries, neighborhood store, dressmaking and the sale of articles of clothing. The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners like Jimena. She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for five years, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.

Currently she has a business making and selling clothing. She says she learned this business several years ago from her husband. The loan that she will take out now is to purchase an upright sewing machine that she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto. This investment will help her to increase her working capital, and with her children's help, enable her to make more articles of clothing to later sell at her stall. This type of work will help her to generate resources for supporting her family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training workshops, and the health clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy an upright sewing machine.

loans.name: Bonchete Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde viven los integrantes del grupo es una comunidad mazahua donde aún conservan su lengua materna,son personas muy amables y trabajadoras, gran parte de la población se dedica a la cría y engorda de animales o cultivo de maíz, es un lugar que se caracteriza por los grandes árboles que hay en el lugar.
 Don Lucas es un hombre de campo muy trabajador, tiene 37 años de edad y vive en unión libre desde hace 19 años con la señora Felicitas ambos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos, dos de ellos estudian su educación secundaria, uno la primaria y otro el preescolar.
  Desde hace 15 años don Lucas se ha dedicado a la cría y engorda de animales, su negocio lo inició para aprovechar los pastizales de la comunidad donde vive y poder alimentar a los animales. Esto le permite ahorrar un poco al no invertir grandes cantidades en alimento. Ya que algunos primos de Lucas desempeñan esta actividad, también tenía la ventaja de contar con el apoyo y experiencia de su familia. Regularmente don Lucas compra sus becerros y los conserva de 6 a 8 a personas de la misma comunidad.
  Por el momento Lucas necesita un préstamo ya que salió a trabajar por un periodo a la capital del país y su esposa, quien se quedó a cargo de los animales, no tiene la oportunidad de sacar a pastar a los animales con tanta frecuencia y decidieron que sería mejor comprar un poco de alimento y zacate para los tres becerros que tiene en casa.
  "Estoy muy agradecido con el préstamo porque realmente ha sido de gran ayuda para hacer crecer mi negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de mis hijos porque ahora podemos solventar los gastos de su educación" comentó Lucas. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio para poder obtener todas las ganancias posibles para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y no tener que trabajar en la capital dejando a su familia por varios días. 
Los integrantes del grupo son Hilaria y Anafer quienes invertirán en borregos y Gilberto, en reces.

*La fotografia fue tomada en las escaleras del kiosco del municipio, Don Lucas es quien tiene la chamarra blanca con roja además los clientes muestran las tradicionales artesanías bordadas que la mayoría de los habitantes también elaboran y venden para tener un ingreso extra*
texts.en:
The community where the members of the group live is a mazahua community where they still preserve their mother tongue. They are very kind and hard-working people. A large part of the population makes a living from breeding and fattening animals or cultivating corn. It is a place that is characterized by its large trees that are in the area.

Lucas is a very hard-working man of the land. He is 37 years old and has lived in a common-law marriage for 19 years with Felicitas. The two of them have formed a family with four children. Two of them study in secondary school, one in primary school, and the other in preschool.

For 15 years Lucas has made a living from breeding and fattening animals. He began his business to take advantage of the community’s pasture where he lives and to be able to feed the animals. This allows him to save a little by not investing large quantities of money in feed. Since some of Lucas’s cousins carry out this activity, he also has the advantage of having the support and experience of his family. Lucas regularly purchases his bull calves and 6 to 8 people from the same community keep them. 

For the moment, Lucas needs a loan since he left to work for a time to the country’s capital. His wife, who stayed to care for the animals, does not have the opportunity to take the animals out to pasture as often, and they decided that it would be better to purchase a little feed and hay for the three bull calves that he has at home.

“I am very thankful for the loan because it really has been a great help to make my business grow and to improve my children’s quality of life because now we are able to pay their educational expenses,” Lucas commented. His dream is to make his business grow to be able to obtain all of the all of the profits possible to be able to pay his home expenses and not have to work in the capital, leaving his family for many days.
The members of the group are Hilaria and Anafer, who will invest in sheep, and Gilbert, in steer.
*The photograph was taken on the steps of the kiosk of the municipality. Lucas is the one who has the white and red coat. Furthermore, the clients show the traditional embroidered crafts that the majority of the inhabitants also produce and sell to have an extra income.*

loans.use: to purchase feed and hay for his animals.

location.town: San Jeronimo Bonchete, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Edison Alexander

texts.es: Edison es un joven  de 26 años de edad,   el vive con su madre y una tia que trabajan al jornal. Edison es un joven nacido en Colombia y comenta que son 7 años que ya vive en Ecuador, Edison en estudios apenas pudo terminar la primaria, ya que a su madre no le alcanzaban los recursos económicos para los gastos diarios. Edison se dedica a trabajar de ayudante de albañil y también cría animales menores. Edison esta muy contento de que nuestra institución y KIVA le puedan otorgar el crédito que esta destinado para la compra de chanchos. Edison comenta que él es el hombre de la casa y que se siente responsable para que haya lo mas necesario en su hogar y para eso espera mejorar su negocio y que siga siendo rentable.
texts.en: Edison is a 26-year-old young man. He lives with his mother and an aunt who work as day laborers. Edison was born in Colombia and says he's been living in Ecuador for seven years. Edison was barely able to finish his primary education because his mother didn't have enough financial resources for the daily expenses. Edison works as a bricklayer's assistant and also raises small animals. Edison is very happy that the field partner and KIVA can grant this loan which he intends to use to buy pigs. Edison says that he is the man of the house and that he feels responsible for providing the necessities of the home, to do this he hopes to improve his business and that it remains profitable.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Nelly Graciela

texts.es: Graciela es una señora de 35 años, ella es madre soltera y se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y  al  jornal de trabajos de agricultura, Graciela tiene 2 hijas de las edades de 11 y 13 años que asisten a la escuela. Graciela  vive  en una casa muy humilde por la que paga arriendo, Graciela tiene espíritu de emprendimiento y necesita que se le otorgue el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos que comenta que los cria en chancheras, Graciela trabaja duro ya que sola tiene que sacar adelante  a sus hijas, Graciela espera continuar con su negocio y al comprar mas cantidad de chanchos  y al momento de comercializarlos le quede buena rentabilidad  para dividirlo en gastos que tiene con sus hijas y otra parte seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Graciela is a 35 year old woman. She is a single mother and works raising small animals and as a day laborer in agriculture. Graciela has two daughters, 11 and 13, who attend school. Graciela lives in a very humble rented house. Graciela has an enterprising spirit and she needs to receive the loan to invest it in buying pigs, which as she comments, she raises in a hog farm. Graciela works hard, because she must support her daughters on her own. Graciela hopes to continue with her business, and that by buying more pigs and selling them, she can get good profits that she can divide to use in part to pay for expenses she has with her daughters, and also to keep investing in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gloria Barbarita

texts.es: A sus 58 años Gloria es una señora que vive en el campo y que desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, el esposo de gloria se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales. Gloria tiene 10 hijos pero de ellos son 3 que viven aun con ella ya que los demás ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con Gloria viven sus 3 hijos de 13, 19 y 21 años de edad de los cuales el menor esta estudiando, Gloria desea seguir incrementando su negocio por este motivo solicita el crédito para comprar abono y fungicidas que son necesarios para tener un buen cultivo, Gloria espera   sembrar en mayor cantidad ya que es de este negocio y de la crianza de animales como pudo darles a sus 10 hijos por lo menos lo mas necesario.Gloria desea que su hijo siga estudiando.
texts.en: At her 58 years, Gloria is a woman that lives in the countryside. From a young age she has been working in agriculture. Gloria's husband works in agriculture and raising animals. Gloria has 10 children but only three still live with her, the rest are older and independent. The three children that live with her are 13, 19, and 21 years old. The youngest is still in school. Gloria wants to keep growing her business which is why she is requesting a loan to buy manure and fungicides which are necessary for a good harvest. Gloria hopes to plant larger quantities since from this business and from raising animals she was able to give her 10 children at least the bare necessities. Gloria hopes that her son will continue going to school.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicides.

loans.name: Veronica Soledad

texts.es: Soledad vive en el campo junto a sus padres y sus 2  hermanos que asisten al colegio, Soledad aprendió a la actividad de agricultura debido a que su padre siempre se ha dedicado a sembrar, Soledad se dedica a sembrar a medias con su padre y para esto solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fungicidas, abono y pago de mano de obra tener en buen estado sus cultivos. Soledad aparte de la agricultura también se dedica a cuidar un niño para obtener otro ingreso, Soledad espera seguir desempeñando sus actividades, cuidar cada día mejor sus cultivos para que su negocio sea mas rentable y de esta manera pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y tratar cada día de mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Soledad lives in the countryside along with her parents and her two siblings who are in school. Soledad learned to work in agriculture because her father has always worked planting crops. Soledad  splits the planting with her father this is why she is requesting a loan to invest in buying fungicides, manure and pay for labor to keep her crops in good condition. In addition to agriculture, Soledad also works caring for a child to make additional income. Soledad hopes to keep working, taking better care of her crops every day so that her business will be more profitable so that she can be punctual in making her loan payments and every day improve her quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a 54-year-old hardworking man, a farmer who also has a maize store and owns a maize milling machine that enables him to generate income and satisfy his family needs.

He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda, and plans to expand his business into bigger markets in the near future. He complains of inadequate capital, price fluctuations of the goods he sells, and pests and diseases that attack his crops.

He is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize to mill and sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to mill and sell.

loans.name: Olga Abelina

texts.es: Olga tiene 37 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en Guadalajara, su principal motivación para seguir adelante son sus 3 hijos, ella quieres ser un ejemplo a seguir para ellos.  Es una mujer emprendedora que siempre quiso ser su propia jefa y tener independencia económica, razón por la cual estudio administración de empresas, ella actualmente tiene un negocio de autotransportes con el cual ofrece servicios de: transporte local, transporte foráneo y paquetería, su principal dificultad son las descomposturas mecánicas de los camiones. Ella solicita un préstamo de  MXN 12,000 para poder darle mantenimiento a su camión así como hacerle cambio de ruedas y baterías. Olga en su tiempo libre gusta de hacer manualidades y dibujos, le gustaría aprender más sobre recursos humanos y su mayor sueño es estar satisfecha con su familia y trabajo, Olga agradece demasiado a todas las personas que la apoyen con la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is 37 years old, married, has three children, and lives in Guadalajara. Her three children are her main motivation; she wants to be an example for them to follow. She is an entrepreneurial woman who always wanted to be her own boss and to be financially independent. This is why she studied business administration. 

Currently, she has an transportation business, where she offers services such as: local transportation, foreign transportation, and shipping. Her main obstacle is buses breaking down. 

She asks for a loan of MXN 12,000 in order to give maintenance to her bus as well as to change the wheels and batteries.

In her free time, Olga likes to do crafts and draw. She would like to learn more about human resources, and her biggest dream is to be satisfied with her family and her work. Olga is extremely grateful for everyone who is helping her with the continuation of her business.

loans.use: to maintain her bus and change the wheels and batteries.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married and has two daughters. He works as a manager in a local agricultural company. He also has his own small business.

Vasil grows grain crops, berries, melons, etc. He owns three plots of land. Vasil is a very hardworking person. He loves working with the land!

Vasil is asking for a loan of 60,000 UAH to build a new greenhouse. The loan will help him to start growing early vegetables and increase his income in the next year.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 31 years old and lives in Stepanavan city of Lori region. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver.

Edita has worked 10 years at a school as a teacher of English Language and Literature. She has a higher pedagogical education, and in the school where she works, she is greatly beloved and respected. She also gives paid private courses at her house in a separate room, preparing a group of pupils to pass entrance exams.

Edita likes her profession and is happy to see that her efforts to teach properly are not in vain -- she sees it in the successes of her pupils in school or during entrance exams.

She asks for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to purchase a computer and also some professional literature, some new English Language training books, and etc.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and also some professional literature, some new English Language training books, and etc.

loans.name: Anastasiya

texts.en:
Anastasiya is married and has a 12-year-old daughter. Anastasiya has her own business. She has been growing early vegetables in greenhouses for 15 years. Mostly she grows cucumbers and tomatoes.

Anastasiya is a purposeful and hardworking person. She wants to develop her business further.

Anastasiya is asking for a loan of 100,000 UAH to build a new greenhouse and install a heating system. She needs to buy an additional boiler for heating.

Through this Kiva loan, Anastasiya will receive a bigger income and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse with a heating system

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a Kiva borrower. He has one child. He describes himself to be energetic.

Julius operates a retail business where he sells spare auto parts. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a marketable place, and his primary customers are regular.

Julius will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more spare parts for motorcycles.

His business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Ummi

texts.en:
Ummi, a mother of five, describes herself as a risk taker. She has been operating a retail business selling wheat flour, salt, beans and other items for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are regulars. 

Her previous loan with SMEP Microfinance bank repaid, Ummi will use this Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of flour, salt, soap, etc. Her goal is to have a bigger business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, salt, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
Sérgio de 35 anos de idade, nasceu e reside no distrito de Magude na casa própria, casado e pai de 3 filhos menores de idade.
Com o presente financiamento de 20.000 irá comprar chapas de zinco para fazer um armazem na sua olaria.
Tem como sonhos ampliar a sua casa e construir um muro de vedação.
Tem como dificuldades a insuficiência de fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio, trabalho e ao crédito para a solução dos seus pendentes
texts.en:
Sérgio is 35 years old. He comes from the district of Magude and lives there in a house that he owns. He's married and has three underage children.
With the current loan for 20,000mts he'll purchase zinc plates so he can set up a warehouse at his brickyard.
His dream is to enlarge his house and build a fence wall.
He struggles with the lack of funds, but he's been turning to his business, work and credit in order to settle his affairs.

loans.use: to purchase zinc plates to set up a warehouse at his brickyard.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Don Emiliano es originario de una comunidad mexiquense muy tranquila, allí todas las personas son amables y siempre están dispuestas ayudar a quien lo necesite. Él es muy amigable pues siempre está de muy buen humor; tiene una linda familia formada por su esposa Azucena y sus tres hijos quienes estudian la universidad, preparatoria y primaria respectivamente.
   Emiliano trabajó durante 16 años como asistente en una imprenta lo que le permitió adquirir suficiente experiencia y confianza para hacer su propio camino, "me cansé de trabajar como empleado, sabía que yo podía emprender una imprenta aunque fuera difícil" comentó. Ya son 9 años los que Emiliano lleva a cargo de su negocio pero no siempre fue tan sencillo pues al inicio sólo diseñaba algunos logotipos debido a la falta de maquinaria adecuada, no obstante con las ganancias obtenidas pudo adquirir el equipo necesario. Hoy en día elabora candelarios, recetarios, invitaciones, propagandas, estampados en playeras, etc. La mejor temporada para Emiliano es cuando se realizan las graduaciones porque las escuelas del municipio le solicitan que realice folders impresos para las ceremonias y entregas de certificados.  En esta ocasión 11 escuelas requieren sus servicios, por lo tanto necesita el préstamo para comprar carpetas, pinturas y folders.
   Emiliano se muestra muy agradecido con los préstamos anteriores pues adquirió de forma inmediata maquinaria sofisticada como plotters, un equipo de cómputo y otro de sublimación, lo que se traduce en un mejor servicio a sus clientes. No obstante aún desea superarse pues refiere que "con un equipo más grande podría producir el trabajo de dos municipios más" y espera lograrlo algún día. Además, gracias a las ganancias, Emiliano ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida desde alimentación y calzado hasta remodelar su vivienda; de igual forma sus hijos continúan los estudios. 
*La foto fue tomada en el negocio Don Emiliano*
texts.en:
Emiliano is from a very peaceful Mexican community. There, everyone is friendly, and they are always ready to help anyone who needs it. He is very friendly, since he is always in a good mood. He has a beautiful family, which includes his wife, Azucena, and their three children, who are studying in the university, high school, and primary school, respectively.

Emiliano worked for 16 years as an assistant in a printing business. This allowed him to acquire enough experience and confidence to go out on his own path. He said that he was tired of working as an employee, and he know that he could start a printing business even though it would be difficult. Now, it has been 9 years since Emiliano starting running his business, but it wasn’t always easy. At the beginning, he only had designed some logos, because he didn’t have the right machines. Nonetheless, with his earnings, he was able to get the needed equipment. 

Now, he makes calendars, cookbooks, invitations, advertisements, printed t-shirts, etc. The best season for Emiliano is when people graduate from the schools in the city. They ask him for printed booklets for the ceremonies and shipments of certificates. For this year’s event, 11 schools need his services, so he needs the loan to buy folders, paint, and booklets. 

Emiliano is very thankful for the previous loans, since he was able to get sophisticated machinery, like plotters, computing equipment, and a dye-sublimation printer, immediately. These investments translated into better service for his clients. Nonetheless, he wants to improve, so he says that with bigger equipment, he would be able to do work for two more cities. He hopes to succeed in doing that someday. In addition, thanks to his earnings, Emiliano has been able to improve his quality of life, from food and shoes to remodeling his house. Also, his children continue with their education.

* The photo was taken in Emiliano’s business.

loans.use: to buy folders, paint, and booklets.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself as a risk-taker. For the past five years, Jane has operated a retail business where she sells clothes. Her primary customers are regular customers. Jane describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

Jane will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes to sell. She hopes that, in the future, she will create employment for others. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosa Erminia

texts.es: Rosa es una señora de 52 años de edad, ella ha vivido siempre en el campo y tiene mucha experiencia en la ganadería y agricultura. Rosa vive con su esposo y 5 hijos  que tiene 10, 11, 12, 15 y 16 años de edad, Rosa comenta que todos sus hijos están estudiando y que es muy duro pagar los gastos de educación de todos, Rosa ha demostrado ser una señora muy responsable en su negocio y con su familia, por este motivo el dinero que solicita es para comprar una vaca para ordeñarla y mediante la venta de la leche tener sus ingresos que le permitan pagar la educación de sus hijos, Rosa vive junto a su familia en una pequeña  casa que la obtuvo donada del bono que le otorgo el gobierno nacional, Rosa desea que su negocio siga para adelante y asi que sus hijos sigan asistiendo a algún centro educativo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 52-year-old woman. She has always lived on a farm, and she has a lot of experience in livestock and agriculture. Rosa lives with her husband and 5 children, who are 10, 11, 12, 15, and 16 years old. Rosa says that all of her children are studying and that it is very hard to pay for the education expenses for all of them. 

Rosa has demonstrated that she is a very responsible woman in her business and with her family. For this reason, the money she requests is to buy a cow to milk; by selling the milk, she will have the income she needs to pay for her children’s education. 

Rosa lives with her family in a small house that was awarded to them by the national government. Rosa wants her business to continue going forward, so that her children can continue going to school.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man who has six children. He operates a dairy farm and describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

James will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a cow and animal feed. He hopes that, in the future, he will create employment for others. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank: his previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a cow and animal feed

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Vilma, la socia sigue dedicándose a alquilar habitaciones para familia o estudiantes quienes le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo continuando con su  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicito el crédito para pintar uno de los cuartos. 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Virgen Purificada” (“Purified Virgin”) communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Mrs. Vilma. She continues renting out rooms for families or students who seek her out. She is a responsible and diligent person. She brings a good attitude to continuing with her business, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it day after day. She wants to be able to continue working, since this is how she can continue supporting her family. She is thankful to those that are part of this dream by supporting her, and she promises to make the loan repayments according to the established schedule.

She requests the loan to paint one of the rooms. 

The other members are dedicated to a bookstore business, a business selling clothing, a grocery store business, and a taxi business.

loans.use: to paint one of her rooms.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man who has two children. He operates a retail business where he sells bags. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

Godfrey will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bags to sell. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber to make more furniture.

loans.name: Abasi

texts.en:
Abasi, aged 32, is a hard-working married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is farming where he mainly grows coffee. He started this business to earn more money and to develop his family. Despite having a vision of increased crop output, he faces the hardships of pests and diseases such as coffee berry disease that affects his coffee farm. 

Abasi is requesting a loan to buy more seedlings and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Rudito

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rudito, a Ruma agent. He is happily married and lives in Kudus, located east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, and a nine-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital of Indonesia.

Rudito owns a stall where he sell mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories. As the business is growing, Rudito is applying for a 12,000,000 IDR loan from Ruma, Kiva's field partner. He will use the loan to process more mobile airtime credits for his communities.

This loan will not only help Rudito improve his business but will also result in important access services for his community. He would be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with two children who describes herself as energetic. For the past four years she has sold omena, a small, ray-finned fish found in Lake Victoria. Her business is in a good location and she has regular customers. Not having sufficient fish to sell is a problem for her.

Florence has taken out and successfully repaid three prior loans through Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank. She is now applying for an 80,000 KES loan to buy more omena.

Florence is working toward having a wholesale business within the next five years. She hopes that she will enjoy better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: buy more omena to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as dedicated. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, soap, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to service and maintain his tuk tuk. His business goal is to have a taxi within five years.

loans.use: to service and maintain his tuk tuk

loans.name: Mayra Paola

texts.es: Paola es una señora que ha demostrado tener mucho interés en su negocio, ya que mediante este es como obtiene un ingreso más para ayudarse en los gastos de su hogar, Paola esta casada con un señor que se dedica a trabajar al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, Paola tiene  sus 2 hijos de 4 y 7 años de los cuales el mayor esta estudiando, Paola  vive en el campo y se dedica a  la crianza de animales y las tardes sale a un puesto donde pone una carpa para vender alas asadas , Paola solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos. Paola espera poder mejorar su negocio y de esta manera que sus ingresos sean mayores para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paola is a woman who has showed much interest in her business, because it's how she obtains an income to help her with her household needs. Paola is married to a man who makes his living in agriculture. She has two children of 4 and 7 years, of whom the older is studying. Paola lives in the countryside and makes a living raising animals, while in the evening she goes to a stall where she puts up a tent to sell roasted wings. 

Paola asks for this loaned money to invest it in the purchase of pigs. Paola hopes to be able to improve her business so that her profits will increase and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Brayan Andres

texts.es: Brayan Andrey, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos,  los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena germinación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones de materia orgánica del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y durante el desarrollo y cosecha, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la erosión, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Brayan Andrey, 20, is single and lives with his parents and siblings who are his major priority.  
With his loan, he intends to buy bean seeds of good quality, which has a good germination, and organic fertilizers which will help to improve the condition of the organic material in the soil and other products to apply to the planting and during the growing and harvest, as well as pay for the labor in the work of preparing the land and the work that will help so that the rainwater doesn't cause damage due to erosion, and also for the application of the products and assistance to the crop once it develops, and in this way assure the achievement of a good job.  He intends to take advantage of the good climatic conditions and soil which this zone has for this crop. and also to put into practice several years of experience in the handling of basic grains.  In addition, he wants to be able to buy the best products of the best quality so that his crop has good development and health as well as an adequate harvest and to have an important production in short order.
With the income from the harvest he hopes to obtain, he wants to use it for the well-being and studies of his family, to fulfill some family goals and to continue investing in his crops.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR .  He has not previously had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with great facility and at a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Twanzane Trader Group

texts.en: Amis is 50 years old and married with five children, all of whom attend school. They live in Kasese, Uganda. He is a trusted member of Twanzane Trader  Group. He began business by borrowing 50,000 UGX, but now his business has grown, and he borrows up to 1000,000 UGX. Amis deals in crude salt and earns his side income from rentals. He works 10 hours a day, 6 days a week. He needs a loan to buy crude salt for selling. He is a hardworking and honest man but faces a challenge of weather changes. He has desires to educate his children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Unversal Group

texts.en:
These three women are from the Universal Group. They are in the trade of plantain, porridge and doughnuts, grocery and soft drinks. The average age of these ladies is 38 years. They have two children and are living in the same neighborhood.
Borkor is the group representative. She is 43 years old and sells plantain. She has been doing this work for 10 years, and sells from door-to-door. The customers find her hardworking. She needs the addition of a loan to increase her capital. This is her 10th loan cycle from ID-Ghana and the Teshie branch, which makes her very experienced and loyal. She has repaid the previous loans without problems, and believes she will make a good profit from this loan.
The group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more plantain and sell to customers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane  is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon comes from Nyakayonga. He is a widower with seven children. He lost his wife. He is a farmer who also deals in selling agricultural produce as a major source of income. He also sells waragi as a secondary source. He looks after all of his children and they all go to school. He requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to assist him in buying more stock of beans and maize which are being harvested. He is assured of a market from schools and also the eaters. He has hopes of expanding his shop by buying 200 bags of produce. The challenge is the price fluctuation in the produce market.

loans.use: To boost his produce business by buying more stock

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en: Adolf is 42 years old and married with six children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling crude salt for 14 years. He faces a challenge of weather change which affects his production. He is a hardworking and honest man who desires to educate his children, and build his family a dream house. He requests a loan to buy construction materials, like cement and sand, to build his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, like cement and sand, to build his house.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO,la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de textiles, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo  su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan en las diferentes ferias que se realizan por la zona, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, mantas entre otros.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO.  The partner makes a living in the business of buying and selling textiles.  She is responsible and determined.  She continues selling her merchandise to her customers who request it in different fairs that happen around the area, this being the way that the partner moves her family forward.
The partner is requesting a loan to buy sweaters and blankets amongst other things.
