The partner is grateful for the loan and promises to follow through with the repayments according the schedule.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and blankets amongst other things.

loans.name: Evaket

texts.en: Evaket lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and is a 38-year-old hardworking woman dealing in cocoa buying and selling. She got involved in the business to earn income and meet increasing family demands. She has a cocoa garden and fish selling where she gets additional income. She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her businesses.  Evaket has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa and fish for resale. She is a mother of seven children, three of whom attend school.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa and fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire cocoa gardens for harvesting and selling to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Javira

texts.en: Javira is 29 years old and married with two children, one of whom attends school. They live in Kasese, Uganda. He has a retail shop which he operates for his family's wellbeing, Javira also earns side income from rentals. He needs money to buy soap, salt, sugar, bread, among others, to sell. He is hardworking and honest, but faces a challenge of market competition.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt, sugar, bread, among others, to sell

loans.name: Erikana,

texts.en: Erikana is 52 years old, single, and has two children who live in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in crude salt for the last 10 years. Erikana does this business for his children's welfare. He has a desire to grow his business into new markets that are offering attractive prices. However, he is faced with a challenge of unpredictable weather changes. He is requesting a loan to buy more crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy more crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Imeda

texts.en: Imeda is 44 years old and from Akhmeta, in the Kakheti region. Imeda is unemployed and wants to open a small market and generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to purchase products. He will rent a commercial space and will open a small market. Imeda is very motivated and thinks that the business will be profitable. He will work hard to generate stable income.

loans.use: to open a small market

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 43-year-old man with five children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He sells new clothes to the people around his hometown and has been in business for six years. He is a hardworking man looking after his children. He gets additional income from coffee selling. He faces hardships of competition and limited capital to meet all his personal and business expectations. His business dream is to complete his rentals. He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Awa est membre du groupe Benkadi, marié et mère de  3 enfants âgé de 7 à 21 ans,  ses trois enfants fréquentent l’école, elle-même est analphabète, elle réside  au Mali avec son mari, elle est âgée de 41 ans, c’est elle qui a la main sur le  sac. Elle fait le commerce des arachides. Elle fait le commerce d’arachide décortiqué il y a 6 ans de cela, Les rêves et les espoirs de  Awa est d’avoir plus d’argent pour augmenter son stock d’arachide, enfin  de tirer plus de bénéfice pour subvenir aux besoins familiale. Par manque de moyen financier elle fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir mener son activité. Elle s’approvisionne et vends ses produits dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Elle  gagne comme bénéfice 15 000 FCFA par mois. Le prêt apportera une amélioration aux besoins de sa famille : santé, nourriture etc.
texts.en:
Awa is a member of the Benkadi group. She is married and has three children ranging from 7 to 21 years of age. Her children attend school. Awa is illiterate. She lives in Mali with her husband. She is 41 years old. [In the photo], she is the one holding a  bag. Awa sells peanuts. She has been selling shelled peanuts for six years. Her goal is to have more capital to increase her stock of peanuts and earn a higher revenue in order to provide for family needs. 

Due to lack of funds, she has reached out to RMCR to be able to continue her business. She buys and resells at the weekly markets of her region. Her revenue is 15,000 West African Francs (FCFA) per month. This loan will improve  her family's quality of life as concerns healthcare, food, etc.

loans.use: to buy bags of peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Inácio

texts.pt:
O senhor Inácio de 54 anos de idade é pensionista e agricultor casado, pai de 7 filhos dos quais 02 já maiores 05 ainda a estudar, sustenta 1 neto que vive com ele na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, pedra, areia, varões para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa tipo 2 ampliando-a.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar e adquirir uma motobomba para irrigação da sua machamba e que com os empréstimos anteriores aumentou alguns bens como cama, congelador estante e melhorou o chão de sua casa..
Diz que a insuficiência de fundos para superá-los, faz pequenas poupancas e tem machambas onde produz para o sustento familiar diz que ira solicitar mais crédito .
texts.en:
Inácio is 54 years old and married. He's a pensioner and a farmer. He has seven children, two of whom are already adults and five are still in school. He supports a grandson who lives with him in a house that he owns.
He states that with this loan he'll purchase cement, rocks, sand and rods so that he can continue to build and enlarge his two-bedroom house.
Inácio's dream is to finish the construction work, furnish the house and buy a water pump to irrigate his farm. He also states that with the previous loans he acquired some goods such as a bed, a freezer and a shelf, and he improved the flooring in his house.
He states that he lacks funds. In order to overcome that, he saves small amounts and owns farms where he grows produce to support his family. He states that he'll apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks, sand and rods.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.pt:
Zaida de 51 anos de idade, nasceu em Inhambane, é residente de Magude na casa própria, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais 3 são maiores de idade, dos 3, dois são independentes. vive com apenas os dois mais novos.
Com o presente financiamento de 15.000 irá comprar cimento para a produção de blocos.
Tem como sonhos terminar a sua casa e mobiliar. Suas dificuldades residem na insuficiência de fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio e ao crédito para a solução dos seus pendentes
texts.en:
Zaida is 51 years old. She comes from Inhambane and lives in Magude in a house that she owns. She's a widow and has four children. Three of her children are adults, and two of those three are independent. Only her two younger children live with her.
With the current loan for 15,000mts she'll purchase cement in order to make bricks.
Her dream is to finish her house and furnish it. She struggles with the lack of funds, but she has been turning to her business and to credit as a way to settle her affairs.

loans.use: to purchase cement.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 30-year-old female Ugandan who is a single mother of two children. She is a repeat customer whose previous loan was funded by Kiva lenders. She is appreciative of the financial support because her business expanded and so did her sales and profit. She was able to buy stock of the items needed by her customers and also expand into a beauty salon. This helped her to beat competition and also raise her profit.

This has helped her to pay her child's school fees and also buy other necessities. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 from UGAFODE to buy stock of cosmetics. She dreams of expanding her business and building a family house.

loans.use: To boost her business by buying more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, beams and rods.

loans.name: Rodrigues

texts.pt:
O senhor  Rodrigues tem 62 anos idade, é casado pai  de 08 filhos dos quais 04 já maiores de idade 1 deles já sua casa os restantes 04 a estudarem, não sustenta mais ninguém e vive na casa própria. Além da pensão tem um mini bus que faz transporte de pessageiros.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, blocos,  areia, varões, chapas, barrotes, para dar continuidade a sua obra que nao esta acabada.
Diz que seu sonho é terminar a sua obra, mobilar o quarto de seus filhos, e criar frangos na sua casa e adquirir outra viatura para transporte de passageiros.
O seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos  e que com os empréstimos anteriores conseguiumelhorar as condições de sua viatura comprando novos pneus e vidros e que ira solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Rodrigues is 62 years old and married. He has eight children. Four of his children are already adults and one of those already lives alone. The other four children are in school. He lives in a house that he owns and doesn't support anyone else. Aside from being a pensioner, he owns a minibus that provides passenger transportation.
He states that with this loan he'll purchase cement, bricks, sand, rods, metal plates and beams so that he can continue his construction work which is not yet finished.
Rodrigues states that his dream is to finish the construction work, furnish his children's bedrooms, raise chickens at his house and buy another vehicle for passenger transportation.
His biggest challenge is the lack of funds, With the previous loans he was able to improve the conditions of his vehicle by buying new tires. He states that he'll apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, rods, metal plates and beams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, metal plates and beams.

loans.name: Segundo Miguel

texts.es: Segundo vive en un lugar muy alejado de la ciudad donde las actividades a las que se puede dedicar es la agricultura y ganadería, Segundo viven junto a su esposa,  sus 4 hijos y una nieta. Segundo y  su esposa se dedica al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, a ordeñar vacas y a cuidar animales menores. Segundo solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar vaconas que las tiene en potreros por los que paga arriendo por la hierba, Segundo lucha cada dia por mejorar su negocio y asi tener mas ingresos para apoyarse en el pago de los estudios de sus 2 hijos que en la actualidad se encuentran estudiando.
texts.en:
Segundo lives in a place isolated from the city, where one can make a living either in agriculture or livestock. Segundo lives together with his wife, his four children, and a granddaughter. Segundo and his wife work in agriculture, milking cows and taking care of young animals. 

Segundo asks for a loan to buy female cows in pastures, which pay for the lease on the land. Segundo fights every day to improve his business and thus increase his profits and support himself in paying for the studies for two of his children, who are currently in school.

loans.use: to buy female cows.

loans.name: Parmenides Rene

texts.es: A sus 19 años de edad Rene  vive con sus hermanos en una casa que les presta un amigo, Rene se dedica al trabajo del jornal y también es un año que empezó con la crianza del ganado, Rene comenta que espera comprar mas terneros para criarlos y cuando ya estén grandes venderlos para obtener sus ganancias. Rene solicita el dinero del crédito para destinarlo en la compra de terneros, Rene trabaja en el campo y esta contento de que se le apoye con el crédito y para mejorar y seguir trabajando como todo un joven responsable.
texts.en:
At his 19 years of age, Rene lives with his two brothers at a house loaned by a friend. Rene is a day laborer and a year ago he started raising cattle. Rene says that he hopes to buy more calves to raise them and then sell them when they reach certain size.

Rene is requesting the loan to buy calves. He works at the fields and is happy to get support with this loan, which will allow him to improve and keep working as a responsible young man.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Rebati

texts.en:
Rebati is a 40-year-old, married woman from Kandi. She is a homemaker and is blessed with two sons. She completed her education till grade 6 and her husband till grade 8. They live at a small village in Kandi, Murshidabad district of West Bengal. 

One of her son reads in grade 10 and the other one works in a small company.

Rebati's husband is a farmer by profession. He has been working on his own land for many years. He learned his profession from his parents. He mainly grows paddy, along with other seasonal vegetables. Rebati looks after her animal husbandry, and after that, she helps her husband in his activities. As a farmer, he has a great passion for his profession all day long; without regard to climate, he goes to look after his crops. 

The couple works tirelessly to provide financial sustenance to their family. They gained many good customers for their polite and simple behavior and good quality crops at a cheaper rate. Like the other farmers, they also dream of extending and improving their production.

That is why Rebati is requesting a loan for the purchase of good quality paddy seeds, compost and fertilizers. This loan amount will be a great help because it will allow her to maintain a work rhythm and ensure a vigorous crop, so that she can give a good wellbeing to her family.

She is very much thankful to her generous lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year old Malati is a married woman and a mother of two daughters. Two of her daughters are married. She lives with her husband in a remote village, Tilipara in Kandi.  

Malati's husband is a farmer who has agricultural land where he grows different types of crops and vegetables. He grows good quality crops, as he has many years of experience in this line. He sells good quality crops at a cheaper price compared to other sellers; that's why his customers demand his crops greatly. 

Malati, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Now they want to cultivate paddy because the climate and soil are perfectly suitable for paddy cultivation. 

Malati applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies to grow good quality paddy so that their products will be the best quality, and therefore, they can satisfy their valued customers. This will enable them to generate more income and better profits so that they can improve the quality of life of their family.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 29-year-old woman married to Mursed. They live in Kandi. She is blessed with two daughters and a son. All of them read in different grades. In spite of having limited education, the couple has a keen interest to give education to their children. 

Rina is busy in housekeeping, while her husband runs a small masonry business. He makes foundations (centering) for houses in their rural area. Centering is a temporary structure upon which bamboo, rods, and planks are laid during construction. 

The profit that comes from this business is not sufficient for them to cover their family expenses along with their children’s education. This business is the only source of income for the family of five, and they need to earn sufficient income to make both the ends meet. They think it will be possible only with financial help because they have no capital.

Rina always takes care of her family’s wellbeing and so decided to give financial support to her husband by taking the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) so that her husband can buy more necessary supplies like wood, bamboo, straw, ropes, and tools for making firm foundations for houses. She hopes to provide her children’s best education to establish them. 
 
She is very much obliged to Kiva and BJS, as they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: to purchase necessary resources like wood, bamboo, ropes and tools for her husband’s mason work.

loans.name: Pampy

texts.en:
Pampy is a 27-year-old widow from Lahiripara, Kandi, which is located in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. She is very unfortunate in that she lost her husband at a very tender age and was burdened with her one daughter. She is an energetic and hardworking lady. After her husband's death, she decided to start a modest grocery shop from her house. Pampy has a secondary level education, but she is determined that her daughter will attend a good school and receive the quality education that she deserves.

She has great determination inside herself to go ahead and does not surrender easily to her obstacles and problems. As a result, she decided to continue to run the business selling groceries and goods to her villagers. As the source of income for her family, Pampy sells everyday necessities like oil, sugar, wheat flour, salt, biscuits, etc. 

Pampy is keen on growing her business with the infusion of a little loan capital. This will help her to purchase additional quantities of items she already stocks. The loan amount will be helpful because Pampy has little savings to reinvest in her business at present, and she cannot purchase items on credit from the wholesalers. 

To further develop her business, Pampy has turned to BJS (Kiva's partner). She is requesting a loan to buy stock of grocery items for the store in order to meet all the demand from her customers. The loan will help her business to grow and fulfill her desires.

She appreciates the help of her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a 50-year-old, energetic, rural housewife. She lives in the village of Raychenga in Falakata with her husband and three sons. One of them works in a job consultancy and other two are running lottery and bookbinding businesses. 

Her husband, Ajay, has been associated with a kerosene (a type of fuel used for cooking) supplying business. Though being a housewife, Anjana helps her husband financially by running her sari business. She purchases a variety of saris from the wholesale market and sells to her neighborhood and local market. A sari is a traditional dress worn by Indian women, consisting of a long piece of cotton or silk wrapped around the body. 

According to festivals and occasions she sells her saris as per the customers’ demand. The local rural people and neighbors are her main customers. Together, the couple earns barely enough to cover all the household expenses. To increase the income, Anjana needs to increase her stock of collection. That is why she needs capital to buy varieties of good quality saris. For this reason, Anjana has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She hopes the loan amount will help her to buy more stock of varieties of saris to sell, which will take care of her financial expenses for the rest of the year. Her main desire is to expand the business, and in the future, she dreams to open a sari shop in her local area. 

Anjana is thanking her lenders.

loans.use: to increase the stock of saris for enhancing her business.

loans.name: Las Coquetas Group

texts.es:
El crecimiento de cierta ciudad veracruzana ha sido consecuencia de la amplia infraestructura que llegó junto con las empresas e industrias. Sin embargo muchos habitantes continúan con los oficios tradicionales ya que les representan ingresos estables además de realizar lo que más les apasiona. Por lo tanto es común observar talleres mecánicos, cocinas económicas, zapaterías, papelerías y panificadoras entre otras.
   Las Coquetas es un grupo conformado por personas sumamente responsables y trabajadoras, el nombre lo eligieron pues todos los integrantes se consideran coquetos entre sí.  Ellos son: Ana y Juana quienes venden antojitos típicos; Arianna, abarrotes; Candy, ropa; Juan, queso; Isaías, carne de cerdo; Yeni, calzado por catálogo; Celia, carne y ropa; Veronica, medicina naturista; María, bisutería; Osiris, bisutería y comida; María C. repostería y comida; Gladys, ropa además de manejar un taller mecánico. Por su parte Epifanio se dedica a la albañilería y Santiago a la herrería. 
   Juan es un hombre responsable y emprendedor, todos sus conocidos lo llaman Juancho, es padre soltero de dos niños uno de 6 años y otro de 3. Desde hace 7 años comenzó con la venta de queso y carne de cerdo para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. De lunes a sábado se dedica a recorrer las comunidades vecinas ya que sus clientes principales son dueños de tiendas de abarrotes. En un inicio sólo revendía el queso pero actualmente él mismo lo prepara; todos los días, al regresar de la venta, elabora “bolas” de producto y las envuelve en hojas de plátano para que tengan un sabor especial. Con las ganancias obtenidas, además de  solventarlos gastos de su hogar, apoya económicamente a su madre ya que ella lo apoya con el cuidado de sus hijos mientras él trabaja.
   En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y en la compra de suero, cuajo y leche de vaca para producir más quesos. “Para poder hacer mi sueño realidad y tener mi propia quesería me dedicare a la cría de cerdos” comentó Don Juan.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de Arianna, Juancho es quien viste playera color rojo.
texts.en:
The growth of the city of Veracruz has been a consequence of the increased infrastructure that arrived along with businesses and industry. However, many residents continue with traditional professions since they represent stable income in addition to carrying out what inspires them most. For that reason, it is common to observe mechanic shops, food shops, shoe stores, stationery shops, and bakeries.

Las Coquetas is a group formed by extremely responsible and hardworking people. They chose the name because all of the members consider themselves charming. They are: Ana and Juana who sell traditional snacks; Arianna, grocery sales; Candy, clothing; Juan, cheese; Isaías, pork sales; Yeni, footwear by catalog; Celia, meat and clothing; Veronica, natural medicine; María, costume jewelry; Osiris, costume jewelry and food; María C., baked goods and food; Gladys, clothing and managing a mechanic shop. For his part, Epifanio works in construction and Santiago is a blacksmith.

Juan is a responsible and enterprising man. Everyone who knows him calls him Juancho. He is a single father to two children, ages 6 and 3. Seven years ago he started selling cheese and pork in order to meet the needs of his family. From Monday to Saturday he works going around the neighboring communities, since his main customers are owners of grocery stores. In the beginning he only resold cheese, but currently he makes it himself. Everyday, upon returning home from selling, he makes “balls” and wraps them in plantain leaves so they have a special flavor. With the obtained earnings, besides covering the expenses of his home, he financially supports his mother since she helps him care for his children while he works.

On this occasion, he will invest the loan into buying pigs, whey, curdling agent, and cow’s milk in order to produce more cheese. “To make my dream a reality and have my own cheese shop, I will work raising pigs,” said Juan.

*The photo was taken in Arianna’s store. Juan is the one dressed in a red shirt.

loans.use: to buy: pigs, whey, curdling agent, and cow’s milk.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
Ella inicio su actividad hace 10 años, se nota su gran habilidad y creatividad con las manualidades. Actualmente tiene como clientela 4 escuelas privadas, 3 públicas y las sodas, quienes le encargan todo tipo de decoración en foam y fofuchas. Estos meses son época alta ya que las educadoras solicitan todas las efemérides del próximo año, recuerdos de graduación y cajas navideñas para la fiesta de los estudiantes, por tal motivo necesita mayor materia prima para poder cumplir con los pedidos, por tal motivo solicita esta financiamiento. 
Doña Tatiana cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de su instructora en manualidades, en la visita realizada se verifica su gran creatividad y perfecto acabado en los trabajos realizados. Cuando Tatiana estaba en el colegio repitiendo por segunda vez el octavo nivel, una educadora le recomendó a su mamá que la sacara del colegio porque no le era posible aprender como los demás y que tenía otro don, fue ahí donde su mamá la matriculo, paso por diferentes cursos, pero cuando empezó a trabajar el foam le encanto y desde ese momento lo utiliza para sus diferentes trabajos.
Es importante recalcar que Tatiana necesita préstamo para esta temporada, ya que va a realizar murales y pedidos para el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Tatiana started her business 10 years ago. Her great skill and creativity in handicrafts is obvious. Currently she has as customers 4 private schools, 3 public schools and the snack bars  which order all sorts of foam decorations and Fofuchas from her. These months are the high season since the teachers order for all the next year's events, graduation mementos and Christmas boxes for the students' party. For this reason she needs more raw materials to be able to fulfil the orders, so she is asking for this loan. 

Tatiana has very good references from her craft teacher; in the visit that was made, her great creativity and perfect finish of the work she has done was verified. When Tatiana was in school, repeating the 8th grade for the second time, a teacher recommended that her mother take her out of school because it wasn't possible for her to learn like the others and that she had another gift. It was from there that her mother enrolled her in a professional institute. She took various classes, but when she began to work with the foam, she loved it and from that moment, she has used it for her different tasks. It is important to stress that Tatiana needs a loan for this season, as she is going to make murals and orders for Mother's Day.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa; La socia continua  dedicándose a  su negocio  de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz), la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo  a sus clientes que le solicitan, también  continua dedicándose a sus negocios de  venta de artesanía y  crianza de animales menores, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO” communal bank. The bank is located in Ccorao, which belongs to the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Teresa is still working in her business selling chicha (a corn-based drink). She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues selling to her customers who order from her and she also makes a living from her businesses selling handicrafts and raising small animals. This is how she brings her family up.

Teresa is asking for the loan to buy corn and other items. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to fulfil her repayment instalments.

loans.use: to buy corn and other items.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”,la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  también continua dedicándose a la crianza a de animales como para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the "Reynita de Belén Ccorao" communal bank. She continues to work at her business selling cereals. Hilda is responsible and persevering. She also continues to work at raising animals to sell to customers who request them at different local markets. This work allows Hilda to support her family.

Hilda is applying for a loan in order to buy wheat, corn and more.

Hilda is grateful for this loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and more.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco Tulio , tiene la edad  de 25 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona y de buena calidad y que tenga una buena germinación y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is 25 years old, single and lives with his siblings and parents, his biggest priority. 

Marco intends to use this loan to buy quality bean seeds that adapt well to local conditions and grow well. Marco will also buy fertilisers and other products for the crops. He will also pay labourers to apply to the seeds and to help the plants once they have developed. This will ensure that Marco can do a good job.

Marco intends to take advantage of the good local climate and soil conditions for these crops. Marco will also put his years of experience into looking after the basic grains.

As well as being able to buy the best, highest quality products so that his plants can develop well and healthily, Marco wants to have a good yield in the short term. With the income that Marco hopes to raise from the harvest, Marco wants to support his family's well-being and education, and achieve some family goals and continue investing in crops.

This is Marco's first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has had no loans from state banks and this loan has been provided under better conditions and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow beans.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia Teodora  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y papa y tambien la socia vende verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Teodora, works in agriculture and has cropland where she grows corn and potatoes.  She also sells vegetables and works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She has been in business for several years and it is going very well for her.

Her dream is to expand her agriculture business so she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila se sigue dedicando al negocio de criaza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Cirila continues her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She is a very hard worker who struggles by way of her business to provide for her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la eroción, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 50 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and children, who are his main priority. With the loan he hopes to buy good quality bean seeds which will germinate well, organic fertilizers which will help him to improve the condition of the soil, and other products to apply at sowing time. He will also pay for manual labour for the tasks of preparing the land and work which will help him to ensure the rain does not cause erosion damage, as well as the tasks of applying the products and tending the field once it has started to develop. In this way he can be sure of doing a good job.

What he hopes to do is to take advantage of the good soil and climatic conditions in the area for this crop and also put into practice several years' experience in the management of staple grains. He also wants to be able to buy the best, highest quality products so that his crop is healthy and develops well, as well as giving an adequate harvest, and to have a large production in the short term.

With the income from the harvest which he hopes to get he wants to provide for his family's wellbeing and education, achieve some of the family's goals and continue investing more in his crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not previously had other loans from State banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy beans to sow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia Alejandra se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia y su sueño es tener un local donde pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Alejandra continues working at the business of small animal raising like guinea pigs and hens.  She is a hard-working woman who provides for her family through her business.  Her dream is to have her own stand where she can sell the animals.  The loan she is requesting is to buy guinea pigs and hens.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La socia Trinidad se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leña, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de leña. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leña.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Trinidad is still selling firewood.  She is a hard-working woman who provides for her family through her business.  Her dream is to expand her firewood activity.  The loan she is requesting is to buy firewood.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia Eulogia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Eulogia works in the cattle raising business. Through this business she wants to improve her family's lives. Her dream is to expand her business selling cattle. She is applying for the loan to buy cattle.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Yajaira Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel  es una mujer joven ecuatoriana de 18 años de edad nació en Saquisili  perteneciente a la republica del ecuador, está actualmente soltera es estudiante, tiene ya su propio negocio , el mismo que se trata de una pequeña tienda , la falta de recursos económicos la a llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella no se negó a educarse a si misma y ha sido un apoyo importante para su familia . 
Maribel  en vista de la falta de recursos económicos en su hogar decidió dedicarse a tener su propio negocio y esto ha sido su gran aporte para su familia,  hoy está solicitando un  crédito para invertir en la tienda
Maribel  agradecen a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Maribel is a young 18-year-old Ecuadorian woman. She was born in Saquisili which belongs to the Republic of Ecuador. Currently she is single and is a student. She has her own business, which consists of a small shop. The lack of financial resources led her to work from a very young age in order to be able to meet her needs. In spite of having a job which demands a lot of her time and effort, she has not denied herself an education and has been an important support for her family. Maribel decided to devote herself to having her own business because of the lack of financial resources at home and this has been her great contribution to her family.

Today she is asking for a loan to invest in the shop. Maribel thanks Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making the growth in her work and personal life possible.

loans.use: to invest in the shop and make her business grow, with the income allowing her to support her family.

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, desde hace 25 años y tiene clientes fijos que la prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar más semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 41, lives in a house of her own with her family.
She has been selling roasted cashews for 25 years.
She has a solid customer base thanks to the quality and affordability of her product.
With the profits, she pays for part of the household expenses.
She asks for a loan in order to buy more cashew nuts wholesale, so as to keep her business going and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cashew nuts wholesale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Hello, lenders! Meet Susana, a youthful 56-year-old shosho (old mum), a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in Koibarak, a remote village in Kapsowar. She is happily married and is blessed with an adorable family. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling a different variety of food crops from her farmland and also keeps a dairy cow. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Kapsowar area has weather conditions that favor sheep farming. There is also a ready market for sheep meat and wool and therefore Susana, being an enterprising granny, would want to take advantage of the situation. She is respectfully seeking for a loan to buy sheep and capitalize on the ready market. Through the loan she will sell sheep meat (mutton) and wool, which fetch high prices both in the local and international markets. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and will permanently changing her living conditions and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Beqa

texts.en:
Beqa is 27 years old and is from the village of Shashiani, which is located in the Gurjaani district, Kakheti region. He lives with his mother, wife and 2 children (4 and 5 years old).

Beqa owns a small chemist and gets a monthly income. He also owns a small vineyard and seasonally produces wine to sell.  

Beqa requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the loan, he will start trading in seasonal fruits and vegetables. Beqa will buy fruits and vegetables from wholesalers and resell them with a price mark up in nearby towns with his minibus. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income.

This loan will be a great support for the family. Beqa is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him the chance to enhance the financial conditions for his family.

loans.use: to start trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Damazo

texts.en: Damazo is 56 years old and married with 6 children, one of whom is attending school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda where he owns rental houses and earns a side income from farming. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, like sand and bricks for building his rental houses. He is hardworking but faces the challenge of delayed payments from tenants. He has hopes of completing his rental houses so that he can get customers to rent them at attractive prices.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand and bricks for building his rental houses.

loans.name: Gidion

texts.en: Gidion is 41 years old and married with 5 children.  He is a resident of Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a boutique for the last 8 years.  Gidion started this business to generate income for his family and fight poverty as he did not have any formal employment. Gidion wants to educate his children and expand his business. However, limited capital is a challenge that hinders his dream. He will use the loan to buy clothes, bags, and suitcases to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bags, and suit cases to sell.

loans.name: Menoka

texts.en:
Menoka, 42, is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Kandi. She is married to Milan. They are blessed with two grown up sons and one grown up daughter who is already married. One of their sons is a driver by profession and  the other one is working in a small company. 

Menoka's husband is engaged in a wood business whose income is hardly sufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Menoka runs her own cattle-rearing business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she is able to earn and save for a secure future. However, this ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to further expand her business by selling more milk and milk products like cottage cheese, which is in high demand in her area. So Menoka seeks to take a loan from BJS to buy a new dairy cow. 

With the expansion of her business, she is expecting good revenue monthly and with the increased income and savings, Menoka will be able to improve her family’s financial condition.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Sanchita

texts.en:
Sanchita is a 27-year-old married woman from the small village of Bholanathpur in the small town of Kandi in the district of Murshidabad. Her family consists of her husband and her infant daughter. Sanchita and her husband, Tapas, both studied up to secondary level.

Sanchita is a housewife and her husband runs a cycle shop. Prior to having his own business, her husband was engaged in a cycle shop where he learned repairing work. Using that experience, he has opened his own shop where he sells bicycles and bicycle parts (like chains, tires, brakes, valves, etc.) and repairs cycles. But due to a competitive market, there are many other shops nearby, so it has become very difficult for them to run the business. For this reason, they need money to decorate the shop and to purchase many modern parts for cycles so that their shop will attract customers.

Sanchita requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s field partner) to decorate their shop and to purchase modern spare parts and tools to enhance their business. She dreams her daughter will lead a very successful life with a good education. She also hopes that she will be able to improve the lifestyle of her family.

Sanchita is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools for her husband's cycle shop.

loans.name: Ajima

texts.en:
Ajima is a 26-year-old active married lady of Kandi in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. Her family comprises her husband and one toddler son. 

The family income depends on her husband, who is a local driver. Her husband has been doing this work for a few years. Her husband is providing transportation service in the town nearest Kandi. He works for long hours each day and earns an average monthly income. With this income, Ajima manages her family expenses. 

According to Ajima, she needs to buy a new Toto van (a battery-operated van) for her husband to give transportation service to the local people. “Toto van” is a battery-operated cycle van that carries people and goods from place to place in rural areas. She hopes that with this new business they will earn the whole profit that generates from the business. Thus Ajima wants to avail a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). Ajima will use this loan for purchasing a new Toto van by adding some amount from her small savings. 

She hopes her husband will earn more than before and her family economy will improve with this new planning.

Ajima will be ever grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a Toto van (a battery-operated van) for her husband.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del grupo San Juan viven en una comunidad muy tranquila donde todos los habitantes se cuidan entre sí. Todos mantienen una relación de amistad y trabajo sobresaliente pues la mayoría son comerciantes. El nombre del grupo lo propuso doña Teresa, representante del mismo, pues siente una gran devoción por el santo.
   Doña Teresa es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora he de ahí el porqué de ser representante de San Juan. Está casada con el señor Santos y juntos formaron una familia de cinco hijas aunque actualmente sólo una de ellas depende económicamente de la pareja. 
   Teresa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes por catálogo y cuenta con más de 30 años de experiencia en ello. Inició dicha actividad ya que le gustaba mucho el trato con los clientes y los ingresos eran suficientes para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. De igual forma tiene una papelería desde hace seis años la cual le ha resultado muy provechosa. Por lo anterior solicita un crédito para comprar artículos de papelería como libretas, lápices, lapiceros, gomas, sacapuntas, hojas de colores y blancas etc. Esto le ayudara a tener una gran variedad de mercancía para cuando inicie el próximo ciclo escolar. 
    La meta de Doña Tere, como es mejor conocida, es ver graduada a su hija quien estudia una carrera universitaria. Aunque igualmente está muy orgullosa de todas sus hijas quienes la apoyan en todo momento. 
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Genizeht, Diana Laura y Erika quienes invertirán en ropa y zapatos; Fulgencia, en maíz para realizar tortillas; Ma. de Lourdes, en productos naturistas; Rocío Monserrat, en productos por catálogo y Anali, en zapatos y pan.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la papelería de Doña Tere, ella se encuentra tras el mostrador*
texts.en:
The members of the San Juan group live in a very peaceful community where all of the residents take care of each other. They all maintain a relationship of friendship and outstanding work, as most of them are merchants. The name of the group was proposed by Teresa, who is its representative. She feels a great devotion to the saint. 

Teresa is a very responsible and hardworking woman, and that is why she is the representative of San Juan. She is married to Santos and together they have a family of five daughters, only one of whom is financially dependent of the couple. 

Teresa sells cosmetics and perfume via catalog and has more than 30 years' experience in this. She started this activity because she really liked working with customers and the income was enough to support the household expenses. She also has had an office and school supplies store for six years which has been very beneficial for her. Because of this she is asking for a loan to buy office and school supplies items such as notebooks, pencils, pencil cases, erasers, pencil sharpeners and colored and white paper, etc. This will help her have a wide variety of merchandise for when the next school year starts.

Tere's goal, as a well known woman, is to see her daughter, who is in college, graduate. Although she is equally proud of all of her daughters who are supporting her at this time. 
 
The other members of the group are Genizeht, Diana Laura and Erika, who will invest in clothing and shoes; Fulgencia, in corn to make tortillas; Ma. de Lourdes, in natural products; Rocío Monserrat, in catalog products, and Anali, in shoes and bread. 

*The photo was taken in Tere's office and school supplies store. She is at the counter.*

loans.use: to buy school/office supplies such as notebooks, pencils, pencil cases, erasers, colored and white paper, etc.

loans.name: Sanchita

texts.en:
Sanchita is a rural woman of Gopinathpur village in Kandi, Murshidabad district. She is 24 years old and blessed with two children (a daughter and a son). One of them is a student of grade 2 and the other is below school-going age.

Sanchita and her husband run their fast food business to earn their livelihood since this is their sole source of income. They prepare various kinds of fast food like chicken, chops, savory puffed rice, chicken pakora, chow mien, etc. and sell these tasty items in the market by wandering through in a a cycle van. 

The couple work hard to run their business smoothly, but now they want to enhance the business for more income, so they need capital. To achieve the same, Sanchita seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more necessary ingredients so that they can make fast food in a large scale.

This will enable her to increase her income for her family’s well being. She hopes she can save for future to provide good education to her children.

Sanchita is thankful to BJS band Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for making fast food.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman of 23 years. She lives with her husband, Dipak, and two sons at their own small house in a small village Ramthenga of Falakata. She received education up to grade 7. Her one son is reading in grade 1 and the other one is too small to go to school.

Anita’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. After managing all household work, Anita assists her husband in his agricultural work. 

Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop that is profitable and in demand in all seasons. So they have decided to grow paddy rice on their farmland. Because of inadequate capital, they need some financial help. So Anita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

The requested loan amount will help Anita to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm resources for paddy cultivation. They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. It will greatly help this family to generate more income for the rest of the year. 

She dreams to purchase more farmlands in future to expand their agribusiness.  

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Shaharbanu

texts.en:
Shaharbanu, 50, lives in a small village in Kandi, Murshidabad district. She is blessed with four grown children (two sons and two daughters). Her two sons are masons and her two daughters are married. Shaharbanu has completed her primary education. 

Her husband is engaged in a wood-supply business. Her husband's income is insufficient for the family, so Shaharbanu rears goats. After they mature, she sells them in her village market or local meat shops at a profitable price to support her family financially. 

Initially, she started the business with a limited investment. Now she hopes to increase her business by purchasing more goat kids, but she lacks the capital. That's why she is asking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. 

She wants to use the loan amount to purchase some kid goats for her animal trading business. It will help her to generate more income to meet her household needs.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase goat kids for her goat-selling business.

loans.name: Jhuma

texts.en:
Jhuma, 20 years old, is a hardworking housewife from the small town of Kandi in Murshidabad District. She studied up to grade 10. She lives with her husband and one toddler son. Jhuma's husband is involved in a business of painting colors on houses, and Jhuma looks after her household and her husband and son.

He paints colors on the houses of their locality, and he is famous for his efficiency in this field. Being the only source of income for the family, he strives hard to make the business successful. 

Of late, they are facing financial problems. They need to invest money to expand their business and increase their profit to overcome the financial hurdles. But the main challenge is capital. As they have an insufficient amount of capital, they can't invest much in the business and as a result, their earnings are not enough to cover the family's expenses. 

Jhuma has come forward to help her husband. She heard about Kiva’s partner BJS and has taken a loan for her husband. After getting the loan, she wants to purchase branded colors and other tools, such as brushes, paint rollers, paint tray, etc. Her future dream is to develop this trade on a large scale, so they can earn much profit and cover the family’s expenses smoothly. 

Jhuma expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase colors and other necessary tools for her husband's house painting business.

loans.name: Rangila

texts.en:
Rangila is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of two daughters. She has had the opportunity to study up to grade 6. Her one daughter is a student of grade 10. They live in their own small house at Kandi, a remote region in the district of Murshidabad.  

Rangila's husband, Liyakat, is a contractor by profession. Her husband’s income is not sufficient for her family. She didn't surrender to the miserable conditions of her family, but worked to improve the living standard of her family by running her own grocery shop. 

She started her own business years ago with a small amount of capital. By hard work, she has developed her business. But with the growing prices of household essential commodities, Rangila needs to further develop her business.

So she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy grocery items like rice, pulses, salt, sugar, oil, biscuits, flour, etc. in bulk. With these she will be able to meet the demands of her customers as well as earn more to strengthen the family economy for a better future.

She is grateful to her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy necessary grocery items in a bulk for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali, 45, is a rural housewife of Falakata. She lives with her husband and four grown children (two sons and two daughters). Two of her children are engaged in gold jewelry work and crockery businesses. The other two are jobless. Dipali is a housewife who has received education to grade 4.

Now she manages her household work while her husband runs the crockery business. Her husband purchases glass dishes, cups, plates, trays and other crockery from the wholesale markets and sells to his local area people from home. As this business is a lucrative one and in high demand in his rural area, he has chosen this business for livelihood. Dipali assists him to run the business. 

To satisfy the customers' demands, Dipali wants to buy more crockery, but she lacks the capital. So she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to increase her stock of crockery.

This will enable her to generate more income and enhance her business for the family’s well being. In future she dreams to build a concrete house with the profit from her business.

Dipali is thanking her lenders.

loans.use: To increase her stock of crockery for enhancing the business.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a rural housewife of 49 years. She lives in a small village in Falakata with her husband and three children (two sons and a daughter). Two of her sons are engaged in medicine businesses and her daughter is married. Her husband runs his small poultry business.

Jyotsna’s sons purchase various kinds of medicines from the wholesale market and sell to their local villagers and neighborhood. Jyotsna helps her sons in selling the medicines to her neighbors, relatives and friends as per their requirements. As there is no medical shop nearby, her medicines are in huge demand because the local people can avail this benefit in acute emergencies also. 

Jyotsna wants to increase her stock so that she can supply and satisfy her customers with whatever they need. For this reason she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more stock of necessary medicines.

Jyotsna will be able to generate more income as well as profit from this business and improve her family’s financial status. 

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medicines in a bulk for the business.

loans.name: Consesa

texts.en: Consesa is a female who is aged fifty-six and is married with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a retail shop of general merchandise. She also decorates and teaches in order to supplement her income. She used her previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of buying land and educating her family for a better future. Consesa is faced with the challenges of limited capital and the high cost of education. Consesa is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Midius

texts.en:
Midius is a 38-year-old female Ugandan. She is married and has 5 children aged 16, 14, 11, 8 and 4. Three of them attend school and she is responsible for paying their school fees and for their other requirements.

Midius is a farmer who grows bananas and coffee. She has been doing this since 2000. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete her house. Her dream is to complete her house and also educate her children. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy building material.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a 39-year-old woman and lives with her husband and one son. Her son is grown up and studying in college. She lives in Gopinathpur village in Kandi, West Bengal. Kabita is a housewife who attended school till grade 10 and could not study further as her parents could not afford it.

Kabita's husband Krishna, aged 41, is engaged with a fishery business; he cultivates different varieties of fish in their pond and when the fish are mature, he sells them in the local market. Kabita also helps her husband in this business. The demand for fish in the region is very high as it is consumed by most of the people. This is the only source of income for the family. Now Kabita and her husband plan to cultivate small fish in their pond, but they do not have sufficient to invest in their business. 

Thus Kabita is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase fish fingerlings so she can grow small fishes in their pond. With a portion of her loan amount she will also buy fish feed, a fishing net and insecticides, to prevent fish from decaying, for their fishery business. She thinks this loan will help her to strengthen their business and satisfy the demand of their customers.  

She wants to get ahead with her business and she wants to thank her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: To buy fingerlings, fish feed, a fishing net and insecticides.

loans.name: Nurbanu

texts.en:
29-year-old Nurbanu is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Kandi. She is married to Habibur and blessed with 2 children. They live in a small village called Ghasipara at Kandi in Murshidabad district. One of her children is studying in grade 8 and another is working in a small company.

Nurbanu’s husband is a car driver by profession whose income is hardly sufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Nurbanu rears her dairy cow so she can sell cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she is able to earn for her family and save for a secure future. 

However, this young ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to further expand her business by selling more milk and milk products like butter, curd and cottage cheese. To achieve this, she needs capital to invest in her business. So Nurbanu seeks to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a new dairy cow. 

With this, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Nurbanu will be able to reach her goal of enhancing her business widely for her family’s well being.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is 32 years old. She is a cheerful lady who lives with her husband and two children (one son and daughter) in Kandi in Murshidabad district. Her children go to a nearby village school. Purnima has an education up to grade 5.

Purnima and her husband run a 'Dashakarma Bhandar' in their village. ‘Dashakarma Bhandar’ is a general store where especially Hindu festival and worship items are sold like photos of Gods and Goddess, idols, incense sticks, candles, artificial garlands, utensils etc. Now Purnima wants to expand her business.

Thus she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase the stocks of necessary articles for her shop. She hopes this loan will give a boost to their business. 

Purnima is grateful for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase necessary items to expand her existing general store.

loans.name: Nunnehaar

texts.en:
Nunnehaar lives in a small town Kandi in Murshidabad district. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She lives with her a family of 4 members which include her husband and her two sons. At the age of 44, she runs a small sewing micro-enterprise with her husband catering to her local community. One of her sons is associated with a timber business and the other works in a mobile shop.

Nunnehaar sews garments like shirts, pants, blouses, petticoats, frocks etc. Her husband brings the stitching materials from the town market. They sell their products to the villagers, who are their main customers. Together, they are working to build a corpus that will sustain them in their old age. 

Recognizing that prices will continue to rise and they may encounter home repairs and increased medical expenses over the years, Nunnehaar wants to grow her micro-enterprise. Buying a new sewing machine will help her improve her productivity. She wants to take on more orders and sew dresses, shirts, blouses, pants etc. Over the ongoing festive and auspicious wedding season, in particular, she will receive a lot of orders. Having a better machine will help her to take these orders on and enjoy a boost in business and customers. 

To access the micro-finance she needs to buy a modern sewing machine, Nurnnehaar has taken a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, which will help this hardworking woman realize her goals of financial stability and a better future for her children and family. 

Nunnehaar expresses her gratitude to her lenders and is thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Dhani

texts.en:
Dhani is a 42-year-old woman, married to Ichhora. They live with their three children (two sons and one daughter) in a remote village of Kandi in the district of Murshidabad. Both Dhani and her husband are illiterate and Dhani can only sign her name. One of her sons is engaged in a timber business, the other works for a private company and their daughter stays at home. 

Dhani is a homemaker and her husband owns a cycle-van (a kind of transport used in rural areas for carrying goods and people). He earns money by driving the cycle-van. He is the main earning member for the family, but the income is modest and hardly enough to manage the household expenses. So they thought of purchasing a new van, and they are planning to give the old one on hire for carrying people and goods, which will give them additional income.

Dhani has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a cycle-van for her husband who is an enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to provide his family members with a normal standard of living. She hopes the profit from the business will give her family financial stability. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving her a loan to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a new cycle van for her husband's business.

loans.name: Stanford

texts.en:
Stanford has spent most of his life around children and sports. He began working with children when he was 16, at the YMCA and with the Boys and Girls Club. He has always been passionate about sports, with an emphasis on basketball and football. 

When he realized that he could not be a professional athlete, he was determined to help children learn to love sports, as he did, by becoming the best coach he could be. 

He works as a personal trainer at a high school and works as the district and regional manager for the national company Fit Kids America. 

Coming from a hard childhood himself, Stanford has been determined to help his community.

Stanford has worked with Fit Kids America for over two years and has decided he is ready to purchase into the franchise. The purchase will provide him 20 schools in the Riverside, Temecula, Murietta, and Lake Elsinore area. 

His Kiva loan will be used to pay the remaining franchise fees he owes as well as to print promotional flyers and materials. 

Fit Kids America is a company striving to fight and end childhood obesity by inspiring children to find the love of fitness at a young age. This is a school enrichment program offered for an hour after school in a variety of sports such as flag football, dance, golf, cheer, basketball, etc.

loans.use: to pay the remaining franchise fees he owes as well as to print promotional flyers and materials.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en: Cesar is 19 years old. He lives in his father's house. Cesar makes money as a mason. He needs a loan to build his own room at his father's house. Cesar needs your help because he supports his family and he has his own expenses. Cesar is healthy and he will do anything to repay the loan. In the picture you can see the place where Cesar wants to build his room.

loans.use: to build his own room

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a motorbike mechanic and earns, on average, USD $7.50 a day. So far, he has been in this career for a few years. 

His wife, Mouy, 20, is a grocery seller with a daily income of USD $5 a day.

Currently, his spouse’s grocery store is running badly since there is no variety of grocery products to serve clients. Due to this reason, he is applying for a Kiva loan now to extend the grocery store. This loan will help his wife’s store become more popular and make more income as well. He is thankful to all lenders with their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to extend his wife's grocery store

loans.name: Mwadzine

texts.en:
Mwadzine is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor  piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a butcher shop business for the past ten years, selling goat meat at the market. He mentioned seasonality as a challenge in his place of operation.

With the loan he is requesting of Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: N6Thịtứdlực_We Love This Loan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngọc is 43 years old, and she is married with two children.

Ngọc has a store for sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to maintain the tailoring service. Ngọc has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Ngọc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2015, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Ngọc has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Ngọc is the group leader of the "N6ThịTứDLực_We Love This Loan" solidarity group, which consists of four members now.

Along with her business profit, Ngọc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain the tailoring service

loans.name: Las Alteñitas De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALTEÑITAS DE ALTO LIMA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de fresco y dulces, venta de mantas, venta de bolsas nailon, tienda de barrio. 
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace diez años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que brinda la institución.

En la foto aparece también el asesor de la asociación comunal que es el señor de chompa rojo y chamarra negra.
texts.en:
The Las Alteñitas De Alto Lima communal bank is going to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Alto Lima's Regional Hub. There are nine members and it is directed by a board of directors; Elsa is the Secretary. There are a variety of businesses that the members of the communal association carry out, among them are: meat sales, sale of fresh and sweet goods, sale of blankets and nylon bags, and neighbourhood shops. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small microbusinesses where Elsa is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer by invitation from a friend that is a client there. At the moment she has a business selling meat; she explained that she learned this business from her mother ten years ago.

The loan that they are now taking out is to increase the supplies (buying meat wholesale) that she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto, and then she will sell it in her shop. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She has a common law marriage and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training that the institution offers. 

In the photo there is also the advisor from the communal association who is the gentleman in the red sweater and black poncho blanket.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: N1Phố7-Qthắng-We Need You Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phương is 45 years old and she is married. Phương lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
She has had a service business shipping goods for two years. Because the truck was old and broken some parts, nobody wanted to use her service. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover this job is unstable. She is requesting a loan to repair the truck to continue doing shipping while providing good service.

In 2014, Phương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

In the future, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to repair her truck to do shipping and provide good service

loans.name: N2 Phố7-Qthắng-The Farm In City Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân is 61 years old, and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for five years.

Xuân lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Xuân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Xuân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Along with her business profit, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim is a 32-year-old married man from Kampong Speu Province.  He has four children, who are living under his support.  To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling his agricultural product to local dealers.  On average, he is able to earn $2.00 (USD) per day.

Recently, some parts of his house have deteriorated, and they need to be fixed to provide suitable living conditions for his family.  Due to a lack of funds, he has applied for a Kiva loan through HKL to pay for his house renovation.  He and his family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for his house renovation.

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela is a widow with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cerela is 68 years old and has one child in school.

Cerela has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cerela requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Cerela has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Cerela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 55 years old and has three children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

Luzviminda is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Luzviminda has been farming rice for 31 years now, and has borrowed 30 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Salvacion is 46 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Salvacion has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 59 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vitamins and feeds and other supplies.

Ligaya has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from farming rice.
