She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vitamins and feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta has been involved in business activities since 2014, when she started her business with her own working capital of $300.  She has a kiosk located in the center of the market.  She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies for her kiosk, including slippers, noodles, biscuits, shampoo, eggs, rice, hand body, toothpaste, and other items to sell.  Jacinta also raises animals, like pigs, dogs, and chickens.

loans.use: to buy slippers, noodles, biscuits, shampoo, eggs, rice, hand body, toothpaste, and other items to sell.

loans.name: N2 Phố7-Qthắng-Poor But Happy Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo is 31 years old, and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making stone furniture for five years.

Thảo lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Thảo faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to produce flooring stone for sale.

In 2014, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Thảo has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Along with her business profit, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to produce flooring stone for sale

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Ilusión se creó con el propósito de prosperar económicamente en cada actividad que realizan sus miembros. Son originarios de una comunidad con tradiciones y valores muy arraigados; son descendientes de la cultura mazahua y muchos aún conservan la lengua. Una de las festividades más importantes se lleva a cabo el 14 de agosto cuando celebran a la Virgen de San Juan, realizan bailes, comidas y se entretienen con los vistosos fuegos artificiales. 
   Juana, o Juanita como le llaman de cariño, es una mujer que transmite su pasión por el trabajo a través de su carácter amable. Las actividades que desarrolla van desde la cría de ganado ovino, la venta de abarrotes y la creación de bordados artesanales. Para ella todo está encaminado al beneficio de su familia integrada por su esposo Leobardo y sus cinco hijos, dos de ellos estudiantes.
   Debido a que la cría de ganado y la venta de bordados se ven afectados por las distintas temporadas del año, Juanita decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes, “mi suegra tenía una tienda y de ahí surgió mi motivación ya que aprendí mucho” comenta. Gracias a su negocio la comunidad se ve beneficiada pues anteriormente no existía un negocio que satisficiera sus necesidades. 
   Por otro lado, no descuida sus otras labores pues tiene 20 años de experiencia en la creación de bordados “desde muy pequeña llamo mi atención la artesanía y aprendí de la práctica”. En cuanto al cuidado de los animales, ella los alimenta puntualmente y revisa que crezcan sin problemas. Esta vez solicita un crédito para comprar más borregos pequeños, tela cuadrille, estambre de varios colores, hilos agujas, etc. para continuar estas actividades.
   Doña Juanita no tiene ningún inconveniente con sus tareas pues sabe manejar muy bien su tiempo, por ahora el único sueño que tiene es el de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos que siguen estudiando. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo con Maximina, Francisca y Janeth quienes invertirían en material para artesanías.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín municipal, Doña Juanita es quien viste suéter azul*
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Ilusion" was created with the goal that every one of its members would prosper financially.  The members are natives of a community with strongly rooted traditions and values. They are descendants of the Mazahua culture, and many of them still speak the language.  One of their most important festivals takes place on August 14th, when they celebrate the Virgin of San Juan.  During this festival they dance, eat, and are entertained with spectacular fireworks.       

Juana, or Juanita as she is affectionately called, is a woman who conveys her passion for her work through her friendly nature.  She is developing several businesses, including: raising sheep, selling groceries, and making handmade embroidered items.  For her, everything is done for the benefit of her family, which includes her husband Leobardo and her 5 children, two of whom are students.              

Because her livestock work and her embroidery work take place during different seasons of the year, Juanita decided to open a grocery store.  "My mother-in-law used to have a store, and this is why I became motivated to start the business, because I had learned a lot," she states.            

Thanks to this business, the community is better off because previously they had no such business to rely on to satisfy their needs.  On the other hand, Juanita does not neglect her other activities, as she has 20 years of experience doing embroidery.  "Ever since I was very young I was attracted to handicrafts, and I learned this skill."  As far as caring for the animals, she feeds them punctually and makes sure that they grow without problems.  

At this time, Juanita is requesting a loan to buy more lambs, checkered fabric, yarn in a variety of colors, thread, needles, etc., to continue with her activities.  Juanita has no obstacles with her work, because she knows how to manage her time well.  For now, her only dream is to improve the quality of life of her children who are still in school.  

The other members of this croup are Maximina, Francisca, and Janeth. They will invest their funds in materials to make handicrafts.  Note:  this photo was taken in a municipal garden.  Juanita is seen wearing a blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy lambs, and embroidery supplies

location.town: La Virgen del Centro, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: La Nueva Unión Los Lobos Group

texts.es:
La comunidad mexiquense de donde es originario el grupo La Nueva Unión los Lobos es muy tranquila y llena de vegetación. Los habitantes siempre muestran una gran atención a los visitantes quienes pueden apreciar el lindo paisaje lleno de frondosos cultivos de maíz y papas. Los integrantes de la agrupación están muy contentos y agradecidos por la oportunidad del préstamo con VisionFund, con esta ayuda pueden iniciar sus actividades. Ellos son Hilda, Carolina Y Susana que invertirán en la cría de borregos; Claudia, en pollos y Araceli en frutas y legumbres.
   Por su parte Doña Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y hule para cubrir su invernadero además de algunos borregos para crianza. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada con José Manuel y tuvieron siete hijos de los cuales dos continúan con sus estudios. 
   Tiene once años de experiencia con la cría de borregos; todos los días se levanta desde muy temprana hora para atender a los animales, es decir, limpiarlos, darles de comer y prevenirlos de enfermedades con vacunas. Esta temporada del año es muy benéfica para su actividad debido a que se llevan a cabo varias fiestas de graduación y ahí acostumbran elaborar platillos cuyo ingrediente principal es el borrego. Del mismo modo desde hace 5 años implementó un gran invernadero en su propia casa, allí cultiva jitomate, lechuga, brócoli, cebolla, entre otros productos. 
   Actualmente sus actividades son lo bastante estables para solventar sus gastos y los de su familia, "realmente el crédito para mi es de gran ayuda porque mis hijos pueden seguir estudiando" comentó Doña Rosa. Por lo tanto el principal sueño de Doña Rosa es que sus hijos emprendan una carrera profesional y con ello mejoren sus oportunidades laborales.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio, Doña Rosa viste una playera blanca y un rebozo azul*
texts.en:
The Mexican community where the group La Nueva Union los Lobos is from is very peaceful with lush vegetation. The residents always pay a great deal of attention to visitors, who can appreciate the beautiful landscape full of abundant fields of corn and potatoes. The members of the group are very pleased and grateful for the loan opportunity with VisionFund; with this help they can begin their activities. They are Hilda, Carolina and Susana who will invest in raising lambs; Claudia, in chickens, and Araceli in fruits and vegetables. 

For her part, Rosa needs a loan to buy seeds and reeds to cover her greenhouse, and to buy some lambs to raise. She is a very hard-working woman, she is married to Jose Manuel and they have seven children, of which two are still in school. 

She has eleven years' experience raising lambs; she gets up early every day to tend to the animals; that is, washing them, feeding them, and preventing diseases with vaccines. This time of year is very good for her business since there are many graduation parties, and they tend to feature dishes prepared with lamb. In the same way, five years ago she installed a large greenhouse in her own home, where she grows tomatoes, lettuce, broccoli, onions and other products. 
Currently her activities are stable enough to cover her and her family's expenses: "Really the loan is a great help to me because my children can continue with their studies," Rosa comments. Rosa's greatest dream is that her children will be able to embark on professional careers and improve their labor prospects. 
*the photograph was taken in their town, Rosa is wearing a white t-shirt and blue wrap.

loans.use: to buy lambs, seeds and reeds

location.town: Los Lobos, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans et mère de trois enfants, Ama est une femme mariée habitant à Gblinkomé. Fabricante de pains à la maison, Ama est une revendeuse qui achète ses produits deux fois par mois au  marché. Ama sollicite ce prêt pour l’achat d’un sac de farine de blé, d’un carton de beurre et d’un sac de sucre. Avec le bénéfice, Ama désire rehausser son niveau de commerce pour plus de rentabilité.
texts.en: Aged 48 ans and the mother of three children, Ama is a married woman living in Gblinkomé. A baker of bread at her home, Ama is also a reseller who buys her products twice a month in the market. She is asking for this loan to buy a sack of wheat flour, a case of butter, and a sack of sugar. With the profit, Ama hopes to raise the level of her business for increased profitability.

loans.use: to buy a sack of wheat flour, a case of butter, and a sack of sugar

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn is 33 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province.  She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and one of whom is too young to attend school.  To make a living, she grows rice (her main source of income).  Additionally, she earns income by sewing clothes and selling them.  She has run her current business for 15 years, and she is the leader of her group of five.   

She did not have enough capital to improve her farm, as well as her sewing business.  This is Yorn's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan.  With her past loan, she can make a decent income, allowing her to improve her business and send her children to school.  She will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer seed to support her rice farm and to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business in order to generate more income.  She hopes that she can earn more income to support her farming and to increase her yield (relative to last year).

loans.use: to buy fertilizer seed to support her rice farm and to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business in order to generate more income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge is 67 years old. He is married and he is still working as a teacher. He gives classes at night but during the daytime he runs his grocery store. Jorge needs another loan because he is getting good results with his grocery store and wants to purchase more sugar and rice. Jorge is a senior citizen and the only one in his house who supports his family so he hopes you can trust him again.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Odalys

texts.en: Odalis is 19 years old. She studies tourism and she needs a loan to fix a couple of rooms where she lives with her mother. Odalis' father is working in other country so he sends some money to the family when he can. Odalis needs help because her mother is unemployed but at least the house belongs to the family. Odalis is healthy. She is looking for a job and she will do any kind of work to repay the loan.

loans.use: to fix a couple of rooms where she lives.

loans.name: Aydibi

texts.ru: Айдиби добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Ей 48 лет. Айдиби живет в доме у родителей. К сожалению, она развелась с мужем. После развода ей было очень трудно жить одной, однако благодаря поддержке её семьи Айдиби начала самостоятельно работать. Она начала заниматься растениеводством. Ей это очень понравилась, так как она почувствовала себя независимой. Она получала доход, и ей было чем заняться. Теперь растениеводство кардинально изменило жизнь Айдиби. Так как сейчас сезон посева, Айдиби посадила урожай и хочет закупить минеральные удобрения для обработки. Для этого у неё нет достаточных денег, но она верит в Вашу милость и поддержку.
texts.en: Aydibi is a kind and sympathetic woman. She is 48 years old. Aydibi lives in her parents' house. Unfortunately, she is divorced. After the divorce it was very difficult for her to live on her own, however thanks to the support of her family Aydibi began to work independently. She began growing crops. She really liked this since she felt independent. She got income and she had something to do. Now crop growing has dramatically changed Aydibi's life. Since it is now the season for sowing, Aydibi has planted a crop and wants to buy mineral fertilizer to treat it. She does not have sufficient money for this, but she believes in your kindness and support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buys more kind of snacks, ingredients for cakes, and rice

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has an animal sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Lolita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock and sell.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.en:
A $1000.00 is offered to Margarida to improve her business. She has a store where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies with this loan such as milk, cooking oils, sugar, salt, biscuits, candy, slippers, Including soft drinks and other things to sell. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011, with her own working capital. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Margarida independent because she can be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy milk, cooking oils, sugar, salt, biscuits, candy, slippers, Including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay a person to help with the crops.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol, 55, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing cassava and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make earnings of USD 5.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.  

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Sok Leang

texts.en:
Sok Leang is 50 years old and has seven children. She lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farm, primarily growing rice and selling her harvest to the local dealers and customers in the market. She has been in this business for 30 years, earning $2 a day. 

In this farming season, Sok Leang is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, she requested a loan, which she will use to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi, 53, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has four children. To make a living and support the family, he manages and operates a farming business. He primarily grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, he has been in this business for around thirty years. On average, he is able to make earnings of USD 2.00 a day.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for his farming. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Penila

texts.en:
Penila is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with ten children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming and selling vegetables. This is her third loan.

Penila dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Diena

texts.en:
Diena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Diena has a buy-and-sell scrap business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell.

Diena has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries.

Virginia has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of two children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a spare parts retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop. Judith is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts to offer for sale.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts to offer for sale.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genalyn is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Genalyn has a nipa making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks and other supplies.

Genalyn has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks and other supplies

loans.name: Ollitas De Barro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OLLITAS DE BARRO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Santusa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de colchones, comida, venta de carne, venta de ropa, venta de zapatillas, venta de cosméticos y tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Santusa es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de colchones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de colchones por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que brinda la institución.

En la foto, también aparece la asesora de la asociación comunal, es la señora que viste con traje negro y blusa blanca.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Ollitas de Barro” will begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Point of Alto Lima. The bank is composed of eight members and led by an executive committee with Ms. Santusa as its president. The businesses led by the bank's members are varied and include sales of mattresses, food, meat, clothing, athletic shoes, and cosmetics, as well as a general store. 

The loan requested will benefit these microentrepreneurs, including Ms. Santusa. She tells us that she was invited to join Pro Mujer by a counselor who is a member of the organization. At present she sells mattresses, a business that she learned from her aunt several years ago. The current loan request is intended for increasing inventory (to purchase mattresses wholesale), which she will purchase from sellers in the city of El Alto and will later sell at her store. This work enables her to earn income and support her family, as she is single. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services provided by the organization. This photo includes the bank's counselor, who is wearing a black suit and a white shirt.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses wholesale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, two of whom are in school, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grain to sell for her rice business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grain to sell for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a shoe sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a clothing retail business. Teresita is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of footwear and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her buy-and-sell dried fish business.

Teresita has been in this business for 14 years. She earns more income from fishing and farming coconut.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Abelita

texts.en:
Abelita has been involved in activities since 2014. She started her business with her own working capital of $ 200. She is a businesswoman and she is very high interested in doing her business.

Abelita has a shop. So she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants use to buy additional supplies that people like, including soap, cooking oils, sardines, sugar, chips, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. 

She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business big in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: To buy soap, cooking oils, sardines, sugar, chips, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is 52 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Victoriana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, homecare products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Victoriana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, homecare products, and other groceries

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 1 Group

texts.en:
Alejandrina is one of the coordinators of her group, which is called Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope) 1. She is from the city of Hato Mayor, which is one the most rural cities in the country and whose economy is dependent on agriculture. She is a dedicated entrepreneur who sells from her grocery store (called Colmado). She is young and dedicated to work and study. 

Alejandrina is very excited to receive her 7th loan from Esperanza International after having satisfactorily repaid her previous loans and, with each one, taken steps towards growing her business. For about four years, she has had loans with Esperanza. 

She is planning to invest her latest loan in the purchase of a variety of goods like rice, beans, vegetables, cooking oils, canned food and other food products. She plans to reinvest in her business and improve it in the short term to have a sustainable future. 

She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Norma Leisette

texts.es: Norma de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda desde hace 10 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia,tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos, huevos, aceite, leche, etc. para surtir mas su negocio y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en: Norma is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has had a store for 10 years at her home and has many clients due to her low prices. The business enables her to pay for her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, eggs, oil, milk, etc. in order to stock her business and be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, eggs, oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Deolinda works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Deolinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including sugar, aqua, sardines, biscuits, noodles, soft and alcoholic drinks, and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2012 with her own working capital of $150. 

In taking out this loan, she will use the money to improve her management of her business.

Anita wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, aqua, sardines, biscuits, noodles, soft and alcoholic drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Calacala Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS DE CALACALA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ines es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de fertilizantes, venta de queso, venta de papa y tunta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ines es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años y lo aprendió de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una vaca lechera que lo adquirirá de las comunidades cercanas, con esta compra la señora podrá aumentar su capital porque podrá elaborar más queso  para posteriormente comercializarlo en su las ferias de las comunidades. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Rosas de Calacala” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Focal Point. The bank is composed of eight members and is led by an executive committee with Ms. Ines as its president. The businesses led by the bank's members are varied and include sales of milk, fertilizer, cheese, potatoes and freeze-dried potatoes.

The loan requested will benefit these microentrepreneurs, including Ms. Ines. She tells us that she was invited to join Pro Mujer by a counselor who is a member of the organization. At present she sells cheese, a business that she learned from her mother several years ago. The current loan request is intended for purchasing a dairy cow, which she will purchase at a neighboring community. This purchase will enable her to produce more cheese to later sell at community fairs. This work enables her to earn an income to support her family, as she is married and has six children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training programs provided by the organization.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es: Jose de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su  grupo familiar, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años comercializa todo tipo de producto comestible y no comestible, con las ventas que realiza es como logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de jugos, granos básicos, leche, huevos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 41 years old and lives in his own home. He has a store located in his home where, for the last 10 years, he has been selling all kinds of food and non-food items. His sales enables him to cover his household expenses. Jose is requesting a loan to purchase juices, basic grains, milk, eggs, oil, etc. wholesale to continue his business, as this is his source of income.

loans.use: to purchase juices, basic grains, milk, eggs, oil, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 57 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, candies, home care products, and other groceries.

Nida has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Nida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, candies, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia is a widowed woman with six children. She is 53 years old and has one child in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Anesia has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Anesia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 62 years old now.

Consolacion has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw products and ingredients for her business.

Consolacion has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw products and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Melida Susana

texts.es:
Mélida, mujer emprendedora de 31 años de edad oriunda del cantón Pangua pertenceciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi, de la República del Ecuador, este sector es muy reconocido por la  comercialización ganado de leche y leche cruda, la caña de azúcar y el licor puro, Mélida es soltera  ive en la ciudad de Latacunga en casa arrendada junto con sus pequeños hijos, es madre soltera.
Mélida  se dedica al servicio de maquila desde hace mas de un año, primeramente empezó trabajando con una amiga y desde hace tiempo tiene su propio taller y sus propias máquinas, esta actividad la aprendió de su amiga.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en  la compra de telas ya que empezará a confeccionar ropa, ya que tiene pedidos, y esto ayudará para incrementar sus ventas y por ende su utilidad.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una buena salud y trabajo para seguir cuidando de sus hijos ya que no cuenta con nadie mas.
Mélida quiere extender y hacer llegar un sincero agradecimiento a KIVA por la oportunidad que le brindan para poder crecer en su negocio y mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mélida, age 31, is an enterprising woman from the Pangua canton, Cotopaxi province, Ecuador.  This area is very well known for selling dairy cows, raw milk, sugarcane, and distilled liquor.  Mélida is single and lives with her small children in a rented house in the city of Latacunga.  She is a single mother.

Mélida has worked doing subcontract factory work for over one year.  She first started working with a friend, and after some time she now has her own shop and her own machines.  She learned this business activity from her friend.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric to start to make clothes because she has orders.  This will help her to increase her sales and, therefore, her profits.

Her biggest dream is to be able to have good health and work in order to continue caring for her children.  There is no one else.

Mélida wishes to extend sincere gratitude to Kiva for the opportunity that they provide in order to be able to grow in her business and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, which will help increase her customers and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: N3Thànhđạtthlong- I Learn To Do Business Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tâm is 27 years old and she is married. She has a stall selling clothes. Tâm lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the town, and the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Tâm faces is lack of capital.  

In 2011, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business and she has successfully repaid three loans. She is a reputable person in the community. Tâm and four other neighbors established the "N3ThànhĐạtThLong- I learn to do business" group to get loans for in order to improve their income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell. With her business profit, Tâm hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susana is 51 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Susana has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw products and ingredients for her business.

Susana has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw products and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Faith

texts.en:
Ma. Faith is 27 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Ma. Faith works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Faith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ma. Faith has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Ma. Faith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Donnabelle

texts.en:
Donnabelle is 44 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Donnabelle is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Donnabelle has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and gasoline retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 35 years old, and five of her children are in school.

Rowena has a buy-and-sell scrap business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.name: Patricia Carolina

texts.es: Patricia de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee un molino, tortillería y tienda desde hace 7 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo es como pueden salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos para el molino como discos, fajas, cuchillas, etc. maíz y mercadería para la tienda para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder obtener  mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Patricia is 39 years old and she lives in her own house with her husband and her three children. She has had a mill, has made tortillas and has had a store for 7 years. Her business is located at her house and she has many clients especially her neighbors. With what she obtains from her work and with the help of her husband they mange to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy parts for the mill like discs, belts and blades, etc. corn and merchandise for her store in order to continue her work and be able to obtain greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy parts for her mill like disks, belts and blades, etc. corn and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more cakes, fried corn, candies, soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Liezl works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Liezl is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Liezl has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Floredel

texts.en:
Floredel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

A loan of PHP 22,000 loan, made through NWTF, will be used to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

Floredel has been in this business for six years now, and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. 

In the future, Floredel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, etc

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 54 years old and has four children.

Catalina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Catalina has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Gabriela Cristina

texts.es:
En el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos se encuentra el Recinto San Bernabé un lugar muy hermoso con un  clima cálido húmedo, su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Recinto  es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo existen hosterías y ríos en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con mucha amabilidad.
En este Recinto vive y tiene su negocio la señora Gabriela una mujer luchadora y emprendedora de 26 años ella es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 7 años estudian en la escuela de este Recinto, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas como salchipapas, hamburguesas y otros, aprendió este negocio por iniciativa propia le dedica un promedio de 6 horas diarias.
Solicita el crédito para emprender en el negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres sin descuidar su negocio anterior a este negocio le dedicará todo el día, aprendió esta actividad porque fue ayudante en uno de estos locales ahora decidió poner su propio negocio.
Con esta nueva inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos ya que podrá atraer y atender a más clientes, la señora Gabriela agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
The San Miguel de los Bancos canton, in the San Bernabé precinct, is a very beautiful place with a warm and humid climate. Its people are kind and hardworking. This precinct is the entry point of many tourists, as it is surrounded by inns and rivers in which to rest and receive great service. 

Ms. Gabriela lives and works in this precinct. She is a fighter and an enterprising woman of 26 years of age. A single mother, she has two children aged 5 and 7 who attend the precinct's school. Ms. Gabriela earns a living selling fast food such as fried potatoes with hot dogs, hamburgers, and others. She learned this trade on her own and works an average of 6 hours every day. Ms. Gabriela is requesting this loan to begin selling fruits and vegetables in parallel to her current business, an activity she can engage in the entire day. She learned the trade as an assistant in a local business and then decided to start her own. She hopes that this new investment will enable her to attract and serve more clients and thanks Kiva for the opportunities it offers.

loans.use: to begin selling fruits and vegetables while continuing with her current fast food business; the additional income will enable her to provide for her children's needs.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 50 years old and married with seven children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Celia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Celia has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Fabiana works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Fabiana is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Fabiana has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell personal care product business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosa is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy more personal care products to sell, such as lotion, lipstick and other items.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell such as lotion, lipstick and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 18 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 2 años sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo agrícola, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su padre y su madre, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The youth who has had her face blanked out is 18 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She has worked growing corn for two years. Her parents taught her agricultural work. She sells her product in the different markets located close to her house. She lives in her own house with her father and mother. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, herbicides, etc. and improve the land shown in the photo. Then she can continue with her work and be able to obtain greater economic revenues.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, herbicides, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Agro Servicio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGRO SERVICIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y chuño, venta de leche, venta de ganado, servicio de transporte.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y tunta; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de semilla de papa y fertilizantes por mayor  que los adquirirá de las comunidades más cercanas a su casa, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar la producción de papa; para que posteriormente lo pueda comercializar en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que  ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "AGRO SERVICE" will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), as part of the focal center of Senkata, it is composed of ten members and is led by a board where Mrs. Virginia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out vary, among them are following: potato and freeze-dried potato sales, milk sales, cattle sales and transport services. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises where Mrs. Virginia is a member, she highlights that she entered Pro Mujer by her friend's invitation who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a potato and freeze-dried potato sales business. She has it be known that she learned this business form her parents several years ago.

The credit which she will now take out will be invested in the purchase of potato seeds and fertilizers at wholesale prices which she will acquire from the communities closest to her house. This purchase will help her increase her potato production; this will subsequently allow her to sell in the El Alto city trade fairs. This job allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the healthcare area and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: Compra de semilla y fertilizantes por mayor

loans.name: El Mirador De Cconchaccalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL MIRADOR DE CCONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dorotea ella es conviviente y tiene 43 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the EL MIRADOR DE CCONCHACALLA community bank in San Jeronimo, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Dorotea, 43, is married and has 3 children.  She makes a living raising and selling animals.  She fattens young animals and sells them when they are ready for market.  The business provides her with an income for supporting her children and sending them to school.  Sra. Dorotea would like to open her own shop one day.  For now, she is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy guinea pigs and chickens and the rest to buy animal feed.  

Sra. Dorotea wants you to know that she is grateful for your support and committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.

The group's other members have a range of businesses that include farms, grain sales, corner groceries and animal sales.

The two members in the photo at the bottom left of the group photo asked to be photographed separately because they had to work on the day the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Con 30 años de edad Norma es una mujer trabajadora que siempre busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, hace 11 años cuando decidió formar una familia, compro junto a su compañero de vida un terreno en el que construyo la vivienda en la que habita junto a él y sus 3 hijos una niña de 12 años y dos varones de 6 y 2 años de edad. A Norma siempre le gusto el negocio y aprendió con su madre a preparar pupusas, plato típico que sus clientes le solicitan mucho, por su delicioso, lo que le permite sostener a su familia. Norma desea instalar el techo a su vivienda, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, pines y mano de obra para instalar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Norma is 30 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is always searching for a way to improve her and her family's quality of life. Eleven years ago, when she decided to have a family, she bought, along with her partner, a plot of land in which they built their home. They live there with their three children: a 12-year-old girl and two boys aged 6 and 2. Norma was always attracted to entrepreneurship and learned how to prepare pupusas from her mother. Pupusas are a traditional dish often requested by her customers for its great taste, which has enabled her to support her family. Norma would like to install the roof of her home and is thus requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase corrugated metal sheet, beams, and pins, and to pay for labor to install the roof of her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated metal sheet, beams, and pins, and to pay for labor to install the roof of her house as soon as possible.
